40961472.review:
Deep Rock Galactic is not your typical 4-player coop shooter (e.g. L4D, Vermintide).

Levels are not carefully handcrafted but are procedurally generated. Enemies do not spawn at cleverly thinked spots.

Its main asset comes form the (partial) randomness of the levels which makes the exploration much more interesting between games and larglely increase replayability.

Sure, you will end up shooting more or less enemies depending on the difficulty setting, but exploration remains the main focus of this game.

Developpers managed to make a well balanced game, with consistent gaming experience between sessions.

Worth a buy.

40913799.review:
ドワーフ4人で鉱石採掘を行なうCoopFPS。

基本4人が前提となるCoopゲーで、ミッションを選択して難易度（ハザード１～）を選んで、決められた鉱石（アイテム）を収集するのが基本的なゲームの流れとなっており、決められた鉱石を一定数集めると脱出ポッドが呼べるようになり、呼んでから5分以内に降り立った場所に来る脱出ポッドに全員で乗り込めばクリアになります。
全員で脱出しなくても一人でも乗り込めば一応クリア扱いにはなりますが、生存ボーナスにマイナスが入って貰えるゲーム内マネーが減ってしまうのでなるべく4人でクリアした方が良いです。

そのゲーム内マネーを使って各ドワーフ4人をカスタマイズすることができ、外見・見た目はもちろん各固有装備も強化することができ、それによって武器の総点数や威力が上がり、装備の利便性やシールドの耐久値が上がったりもします。
一部強化には、洞窟探検で手に入れた鉱石を必要とするので、色んな鉱石やアイテムを洞窟内で見かけたら積極的に集める事をオススメします。（そのほうがゲームとしても楽しいですし！）

それに他ゲーと違って一人1クラスという制限はなく、全員が全員同じクラスで行っても問題ないです。
地形採掘が可能なドリル及び固定ダメージを全エイリアンに与えられる火炎放射器を持つドリラー・高低差ある場所にジップラインを引き、ガトリングガンで物量を殲滅するガンナー・広い範囲を照らすフレアに、単独行動ができるグラップリング持ちのスカウト・どんな場所にも足場を作るプラットフォームガンと自動掃射タレットを2機設置可能なエンジニア、と特徴的且つどれも使いたくなるようなドワーフが揃っていてかなり中毒性が高いです。
たまにエンジニア１のスカウト3でエンジニアが置いて行かれる事があり、申し訳ないと思いつつそういうのも面白かったりします。

各ステージも毎回プロシージャル生成されるので、同じ洞窟はあまり見かけません。それにチャットも日本語で打つことができ、ブラウザ検索した時には、地域表示にJPもあるので日本人とマッチングすることも多々あります。
アーリーアクセスの割に既にクオリティが高く、公式で99％の日本語翻訳も完了している万全っぷりで是非とも日本でも流行って大きくなって欲しいCoopゲーです。
因みにレベル10で銅像が立ち、レベル20でその銅像が金色に変わるので、全ドワーフレベル20以上に挑戦してみても良いかもしれないです。

翻訳所（https://crowdin.com/project/deep-rock-galactic）

40913764.review:
Best played with friends or a group. The classes are simple and need more depth, but so far my friends and I are hooked. The higher difficulties are a blast to play and hunting for those rare resources keep us going. The swarms are awesome.

If you like mining, resource gathering, first person shooters, and dwarven humor then this game is for you.

Positives:

Graphics are clean. Drilling a tunnel and having it upon up to crystals reflecting off of your flares can be breath taking.

Action. Lots of Action. The swarms are really high paced on the higher difficulties.

Ore. Forever chasing the rare ore. Gotta have em to get those bling armors.

MUSIC. MUSIC. MUSIC. The music is outstanding and very fitting for this atmospheric game.

Granted this is Early Access, but here is what needs work:

The classes need more customization options. Right now if you fully upgrade your gunner class, it will be identicle to every other gunner class. Give us different items/guns to unlock. Give us more reasons to pursue that precious rare ore so we can truly stand out.

More enemy types are needed.

More biomes. ICE/SNOW biome please.

Overall this game is fun for where it is but has outstanding potential. Best early access game i have played in awhile and I am looking forward to future updates.

Must buy if you aren't scared off by early-access!

40908187.review:
Surprise, surprise! The game turned out pretty damn good even this early!

Running with a full dedicated 4 man squad, working together and been having an absolute blast.

It's a mission-type kind of game, where you get a set of goals to complete, then you have to escape without dying.

Mix a bit of Left for dead, Vermintide but a little calmer with some resource gathering similar in survival games and you'll get this, pretty much!

Every class you can pick so far has their own use which helps the group over all in some ways which is handy.
I personally wouldn't recommend playing this game alone. Best to be in a group, even better to be experienced with a bunch of friends working together, strategically planning and running the missions which constantly feel rewarding.

The game is also a lot more forgiving, even if you don't survive you'll still get what you've mined from the mission, that is if you complete it.
It's challanging to an extent, puts pressure when it's needed and constantly fills you with a satisfying reward.

Give it a try!

40899818.review:
４人COOP重視型の採掘シューター。端的に言うならMinecraft+Left 4 Dead。
装備被りが少ないドワーフのヒゲヒゲオッサンズを組み合わせて、銀河の中でも最高に危険な鉱山に挑む。

EAであるUpdate10現在は、機動力が高くと照明も強力なスカウト、汎用性の高い足場を発砲設置し、セントリーが置けるエンジニア、硬い岩盤をものともしないドリルを持つドリラー、頭一つ抜けた瞬間火力を誇り、全員を輸送可能なケーブルを設置出来るガンナーの４種。
戦闘でも手数や弱点の配置関係で共闘を強いられるのだが（後述）、採掘でも共同作業をするのが大いに推奨なのがとてもユニーク。一人でシコシコ掘っても理論上は資源の完全回収は可能なのだが、各々の移動アイテムを組み合わせる事で効率が良くなる。このゲームの洞窟はとても暗く、標準装備のフラッシュライトはあまり長距離を照らせない。自動回復のフレアを投げる事でマシになるのだが、復活は遅めなので一緒に投げあう事が必要。それに加えて各キャラの装備が以下：
スカウト：ほぼ何処でも超高速で移動可能。大きな部屋の天井付近にある鉱石は彼の独壇場。定員が本人のみなのが弱点。もう１つの武装のフレアガンは大部屋を明るく照らし出すアイテム。光量に優れ、また壁に張り付くため非常に使い勝手に優れる。
エンジニア：射撃で足場設置するため、スカウトと組み合わせる事で、単独での回収がほぼ不可能なアーチになっている場所の鉱石の回収も可能。連射すれば即席で階段や橋を設置する事が可能。ただしスカウト用の足場ならともかく、大きな構造物を作ると弾の消費が激しい。
ドリラー：規格外の掘削力で無から階段を削り出す。燃料は有限だがかなり持ちが良いので気軽に使って行ける。縦穴が得意で、一部の目標でも大活躍。何もない空間を渡る手段が無いのがキツい。
ガンナー：長距離を移動可能なジップラインを作成する。大きな亀裂や崖を素早く渡る事が可能で、また爆破されても他と違い無敵なのがポイント。光り続けるので目印としも優秀。空中では殆どの敵が攻撃して来れないのでその点を上手く活用する事も出来る。装弾数がとても少ないのが欠点。
大部屋の流れとしては、スカウトが部屋を照らし出し、ガンナーが下層へ降りるケーブルを設置、エンジニアがスカウト用の天井足場を設置しつつセントリーを展開、ドリラーが地面に埋まったアイテムを掘り出す・・となるのが理想。

通常のモードにおいては、道なりに鉱石を回収し、ドア代わりにエリアの区切りを示す土で塞がれた部分を掘りつつ進んでいき、最下層の部屋に辿り着いてそこに一杯ある鉱石を採掘後、目標達成で押せるようになる脱出ボタンを押して帰りのポッドを呼び出してそこまでダッシュで帰るのが流れ。もちろん一筋縄ではいかない。洞窟は、ベース部分こそ定型タイルを利用しているものの、鉱石は自動生成だし、その他の巨大なクリスタルや危険物の配置によっては複雑を極める。もちろんFPSなので敵が出現する。敵は蜘蛛+昆虫ベースで数種類おり、定期的に発生するラッシュでは高密度の波状攻撃を仕掛けてくる。装甲で覆われている部分が多く、弱点を狙わない限りダメージが通らない敵もいる。中には後ろにしか弱点がない敵もいるので、一人が引き付けて残りのメンバーが叩く必要が出てくる。ドワーフの武器もそれぞれに得意・不得意な局面があるので共闘する必要がある。また携行可能な弾薬数がかなり控えめで、連発するとあっさり底をつく。弾薬の補充にはそれ用の鉱石を一定量ためて補給を呼ぶ必要があるので、おいそれと乱用するのは禁物。また全弾薬が半分だけ回復するので武器をバランスよく使う必要もある。帰り道は無限ラッシュになり、時間制限もあるので地形によってはかなりの難易度。耐久力はクールダウンを置いてゆっくり回復するシールドと回復する手段に乏しいヘルスの２層式。ヘルス０でダウンはするが他メンバーが一定時間Useすれば無限に起こせるのが良ポイント。

戦闘外ではただ一緒に鉱石を掘っているだけなのだが謎の面白さがある。鉱石は１種類につき４０までしか持てず、定期的についてくる足つき採掘カートに入れる必要があるのだが、みんなで一緒に掘れば大鉱脈もサクサク片付くのだ。ドワーフ達は戦闘外でもよく喋り、バリエーションも豊富で楽しい。とりあえず適当にRock and Stone! By the Beard!言ってるだけで一体感が生まれてくる。ロビーでは宇宙空間にある基地で待機なのだが、暇つぶし要素が充実しているし人口も多いので待機が苦にならない。

個人的には初めてPayday2が出てきた時並みに楽しませてもらったのでサポートパックを購入させてもらった。こちらはエンジンがUE4なので拡張面でも安心。まだEAなのだが開発チームの士気は高いもよう。COOPプレイヤーなら是非とも。

40928481.review:
After almost 3 hours, I can tell this is a game that I will be interested in for a while. It reminds me of some sort of L4D/Virmintide kind of setup, but one where it involves exploration and well thought out teamplay in order to achieve better outcomes in missions. It has much more to offer than what is seen on the surface - the classes in this game, while only 4 and somewhat limited at the present (which will change as more is added I'm sure) are absolutely necessary to play this game correctly and collect not only what is needed but a surplus of supplies in order to obtain better gear and excell. 

The gameplay at the moment is a little static and could use some more events/situations that differentiate from each other (yet again, still very realy access). Regardless, the Devs made a game where you always feel the tension of getting further from your return back home, and it becomes a game of tactical thought out risk and reward scenarios where the deeper you go, the better it gets - but also the more difficult. A coordinated team of 4, each performing their own roles, can turn this game from a somewhat awkward at first run and gun with mining into a professional mining expedition where your teammates must have your back and perform, and vice-versa.

For a game that is this early, and I'm sure will improve on many systems (like a perk system, there is currently a weapon upgrade system that isn't too deep), I am very impressed and would recommend to any who are fans of mining, exploring, adventure/action, and horde-related scenarios.

まだ要素自体が豊富というわけではなく、各キャラの強化もガッツリやればすぐ最高まで到達できようだが、
現時点でも、基本的な気持ち良いFPSとしての操作感やマップ生成によるリプレイ性も高く、十分評価できる。
他のFPSと比較する個性としては、「ライトを投げながらの穴掘り探索」、「弾の補給が特定の鉱石を集めて、
ドロップポッドを呼んで、皆で補給するシステム」や「目標達成後の脱出」（これらのタイミングは任意で、
周りをみてのなんとなくの空気）で、なんとなくの一体感が野良でも起きてるのは興味深い。
（ドワーフっぽいemoteによる謎の一体感もあり）
現状の4クラスはどの組み合わせでもプレイは可能だが、取りたい鉱石をマークして、そこまでのジップラインと床生成の組み合わせ等の連携がふわっとできると気持ちよい。
ドワーフらしいドワーフ愛がつまってるドワーフゲーなので、ドワーフが好きな人には特におすすめ。

やりたいことをちゃんとやれている作品なので、値段分の価値は十分にあり、このまま開発を頑張ってもらいたい。

40884287.review:
Now this is a very rare case of two things for me, one buying a game at full price and  two buying a game with in minutes of me finding it. This was an impluse buy at full price and it was worth every penny. Now there is room for imporvement and although they haven't  been on Early access for long they've already done two small updates so my hopes (unlike my wallet) are high. 

The gameplay consist on dropping into a planet crust and mining out caves while fighting of swarms of aliens that try to kill you, and I adore the movement of the aliens (even if sometimes the bigger ones go a bit werid in small tunnels). I'd simply say this is a combination of early astroneer with it's ground scuplting and left 4 dead with it's well everything else really. Some more content and variation would be welcomed and they are working on it so if it isn't quite your cup of tea now come back in a few months and see where we are. Oh I nearly forget to mention the performance is great even on some weaker systerms according to a friend.

All in all deep rock galatic is a polished Ruby not quite a diamond but with some time I think it'll get there. (before anyone says I know rubys don't become diamonds but metaphors and shit)

40857577.review:
Deep Rock Galactic is an early access game on Windows PC and Xbox One that stars a group of dwarves who have to work together to mine certain materials out of the ground.
Each character has three light canisters they can throw like grenades, and they recharge with time. Learning how to time your throws with your team — so you can always see what you’re doing while giving everyone a chance to recharge their own supply — is a crucial skill, especially since the game makes it easy to get turned around inside the mine.

The Scout class has its own weapon that shoots out a large light source as well, which makes it even more important that your team includes one of every class. Learning how to work together to keep the area illuminated is both important and enjoyable, and it emphasizes how much you have to work together to survive.

There’s nothing better, or worse, than looking down a deep chasm, throwing a light canister down and then seeing the light reveal a group of the game’s scurrying, spider-like insects. The importance placed on light and on your management of it helps to remind you at all times that you are deep underground, in a hostile environment — and you’re likely going to die down there.

This game is definitely worth it's price point. Each class has it's own unique abilities that help contribute to the team. It has a little bit of the Minecraft feel with the mining and the enemy waves feel alot like Vemrintide or left for dead. It runs very well and feels optimized. 40852780.review: This is an amazingly polished game given that it's early access, I've played solo, 2 player co-op, and 3 player co-op, and it's a blast. The difficulty scales from a slight challenge all the way to 'I can't finish a level at this difficulty... yet' and while I suspect that long term they're going to need to provide a deeper upgrade tree and harder levels for high level teams, the current game will easily justify the price. The solo game is surprisingly satisfying, 'Bosco' provides more than adequate support, although it's current tendency to repeatedly interrupt actions that take time is a little annoying. The rooms and tunnels in each of the level types vary between claustrophobic, through dizzyling tall, to dauntingly vast. After 50+ hours, I really have nothing bad to say about this game, and I'm still having a load of fun.

40849950.review:
Fellow Steam users, this is literally the BEST Early Access game I have ever experienced.

Let me start off with there are some bugs here and there, but in my experience I have encountered only two. AND THEN THEY FIXED THEM. Immediately. 
To see the Devs actually care about this gives me so much hope for this game because we all know how it feels when a game you really see potential in, just flops bcause it was abandoned and all your money was taken. 
This is not that.
The Devs are really on top of their game and the fact this Early Access actually has a decent amount of content already is awesome because it gives such a good outlook for the rest of the game and I cannot wait to see it. 

Are the graphics like Hunt: Showdown?
No, but they are so pleasing anyways. The animations are so crisp and fluid it makes each cave experience very immersive and working together as a team actually works and feels like it should. The caves are randomly generated every mission and there are different complexities and lengths of caves. SO caves can be long, can have high ceilings and winding pathways, or have both which gives you a lot to do. 

This game has some fabulous potential and I cannot wait to see what they continue to do to it. They add fixes and updates every day.

SUPPORT THE DEVS

40847385.review:
Divertentissimo, la cosa che lo rende tale è quel senso di ironia che si percepisce in tutto il gioco, dalla lobby con i balli davanti al jukebox fino a dentro i dungeons con le battute dei nani. Grafica molto piacevole e animazioni degne di nota come il doppio tap o i tricks che fanno i nani con il revolver dopo la ricarica.
Nonostante sia un early access è già ottimizzato più che bene, non si notano cali di framerate ne crash e il gioco gira molto fluido senza nessun rallentamento.

Le classi sono ben bilanciate e questo fa in modo che il party completo utilizzando tutti e 4 le classi riesca ad finire una missione molto più facilmente, ovviamente se si è coordinati anche grazie all'utilizzo della chat vocale, rispetto a un party che non le utilizza. Si può giocare anche in single player però giochi come questo esprimono il massimo se giocati fra amici.

Il prezzo di lancio forse è un po' alto e ancora mancano dei contenuti endgame per chi ne ha già abbastanza del grinding fine a se stesso (livellamento personaggi e acquisto skin per armature, barbe e cappelli), però gli sviluppatori rilasciano update a cadenza settimanale e questo fa ben sperare. Basterebbe l'introduzione di qualche raid anche da fare in più di 4 o di qualche loot unico per cambiare completamente l'appeal del gioco, comunque voto più che positivo.

40846730.review:
Tons of fun with friends and finished enough to be worth your money right now, though it could use some additional polish.

Each mission lasts between 30 and 45 minutes (in my experience) consisting of looking for and mining a primary resource and an optional secondary resource. The game plays like a cross between Minecraft and Left 4 Dead, with hordes of aliens popping up every so often to harass you. The genre blend works really well, surprisingly well in fact, especially during the mad dash to extraction at the end of each mission. The procedurally generated levels are actually fun to navigate and I haven't run into any game-breaking level generation glitches yet. The 4 classes are all unique, though some are more interesting to play than others. 

I would love to see some alternate weapons and an endless mode added to the game, which seem likely to be added in the future. The existing character upgrade system is decent but will definitely be improved with more options; the same goes for enemy types.

As of right now, March 2018, this game is good, like a 7.5/10. I think when it's done it has the potential to be an all time classic.

40843816.review:
Deep Rock Galactic (En early access) est déjà un très bon jeu qui repousse les frontières de la coop grâce à ses interactions poussées entre les différentes classes mais aussi avec le décor entièrement “minable” façon Minecraft.

Le gunplay est très sympa, les classes sont intéressantes et contribuent toutes équitablement au succès de la mission. Parfois par des détails aussi simples que bien éclairer une vaste cavité pour dénicher les streums pendus au plafond (ils pondront des oeufs).

La quantité d’interactions mentionnée plus haut est malheureusement une source de contrariétés en ce qui me concerne parce qu’elle pousse souvent à l’ingérence de certains joueurs dans le jeu des autres. “Mets une plateforme ici”, “Mets une zipline ici”, “Creuse ici”… Suivant votre tolérance à ce genre de pratique (spoiler alert : la mienne est très basse), ça pourra passer, ou pas.

Ca n’enlève rien aux qualités su titre et c’est certainement quelque chose qui va s’estomper avec le temps et l’expérience.

Le jeu devrait rester en early accès assez longtemps et quand on voit le degré de finition déjà excellent aujourd’hui, ça se présente plutôt bien !

40842971.review:
This is going to be somewhat different recommendation, as I asked for refund. 

I have this game on my wishlist now, and I'll check back to this later. 

I think this game is unique combination of shooting & exploring with buddies. I believe developers have found something unique that can be turned into mithril. 

Pros:
- different character classes (I liked difference of engineer and gunner)
- graphics
- seems to have tons of unlockables :)
- darkness is very good, i like how the light system has been done
- exploration (not in sense of "mining/drilling") but in the sense of "walking down through cave and finding new species/organisms)
- network code worked very well (played with buddy who is on the other side of the planet, planet Earth that is)
- swarms of aliens
- deposit system
- turrets :)

Cons: 
- This game needs "which way to go" hints on objectives. Now I have no idea where to find those precious minerals. I tried map or scanner or what it's called but could not say which way I should go. In the beginning this would be very good. Later in the game, maybe these could be obfuscated. If I'd know area where to find resources, I believe I could plan my steps ahead. Now it's unknown when I'm going to hit something good. 
- "Drilling/mining" does not feel nice as in minecraft or such games. In this game you have time pressure so the mining aspect feels somewhat lacking. I feel it should be faster. Almost like... the "driller" class could be 5x faster and all non-driller dwarves would mine 10x faster. 
- I don't know if 2 players is so good, as then it's lacking the "driller". Maybe me and my buddy just suck at this :) I have gut feeling that 3 would be better than 2 players.
- Related to above: I almost think "driller" is useless, but then again I played less than 2 hours so who am I to tell :)
- Getting 0.3 points of gold felt bad. I would have wanted to get 3 gold. It felt like "oh dear, I have to find 200 units of mithril... and I got only 0.7 here :/"

I'm quite certain there are people who will like this game already. 

For me, I think that this game needs some fine tuning. I think it needs those "map that shows somewhere in this area you'll find what you need" and "faster drilling" and those alone will make this game more enjoyable for me and my buddy. 

I asked for refund for now, but as said, this game is on my wish list. I will check this later again. 
Anyone who has co-op buddy to play with should add it to their list. Or try the game to see yourself if you like it.

40841079.review:
[h1]Overview[/h1]
Deep Rock Galactic is a great hybrid class-based FPS, Mining game, and waved based survival game. What makes this game stand out is the mining system uses a polygon system instead of a cube voxel based system. These same polygons are used to create a unique and hard-edged art-style that feels properly dwarfy. Teamwork is an important aspect as any dwarf on his own will die a terrible bug ridden death. Sound design is crisp and sounds just like digging a hole in real life with a drill or pickaxe. The game could use a bit more content, but the developers are responsive and are actively developing the game for the better.

[h1]Game Breakdown[/h1]
[u]Gameplay:[/u]
There are four unique classes in the game to choose from and they are all really enjoyable to play. These classes work best when used in conjunction with one another. While it can be fun to have four gunners, one of each class is the best way to find success in the missions. The Scout has a stereotypical FPS assault rifle, a double barrel shotgun, a really fun grappling hook to traverse the huge caverns, and a flare to light up aforementioned large caverns. The scout pairs really well who has a semi-automatic shotgun, a grenade launcher, sentries, and the platform gun. The platform gun can place yellow, octagonal platforms against any wall. This mean that he can put platforms at high, hard to reach mineral deposits and the scout can grapple to them. The Gunner has a Gatling gun, revolver, zip line gun, and satchel charges. The driller is the most unique class as it directly and greatly effects the digging component of the game. He has a flamethrower, a pistol that is weaker than the gunners, satchel charges, and giant dual wielded power drills. These allow the player to easily shape the world around them to their liking.

The mining in the game includes the digging of dirt and the digging of minerals which are found in the dirt. There are few different mineral types such as: gold which gives the player credits, nitra which allows players to call in supply drops to refill ammo, morkite which is the objective of some missions, some specialized ores which work the progression system, and some large gems which require quite a bit of digging. The world is comprised of triangle polygon system of digging. While a dwarf mining will remove a square amount of dirt, explosive enemies can leave oddly shaped craters in the ground which look great. Each cave system is also randomly generated so that each mission never feels the same. The special mineral fuel Deep Rock Galactic’s progression system.

Each class has permanent upgrades which can be bought for every part of the class’ equipment. For example, armor can be upgraded so that the player has more shielding or a weapon can have more max ammo. Flares can also be upgraded so that the dwarves have more of them and they last longer. This equipment lights up the darkness that the dwarves find themselves in. These upgrades can be bought with credits, but the more powerful upgrades require the special minerals. This makes sure that the player does not play only the easy biomes. Different biomes have unique obstacles but they also vary in the amount of hits they require to break the dirt blocks. The driller is great because his drill doesn’t care about hardness and will cut through any rock like butter. These upgrades help fend off the monsters in more difficult mission and biomes.

Enemies spawn in both small pockets and giant waves. These occur randomly and make the game quite challenging. There are a few different enemy types to challenge the unlucky dwarfs mining a faraway asteroid. One type explodes and does quite a bit of damage and can set off a chain reaction with other explosive bugs. Another type has an armored front but an exposed abdomen and diffuse poison gas into the air upon death. The varied nature of waves and their random compositions help to keep this game mechanic fresh and challenging. A player can predict what kind of enemies will be on a particular mission which makes the darkness all the more frightening.

As with any multiplayer game, I must talk about the quality of the community around the game. While this game is great with friends, sometimes they aren’t around and randoms are one’s only option. From my experience, the community is really nice and every player actively revives their teammates and tries to win. The powerful abilities and friendly fire could make grieving prevalent, but it isn’t. I think that this is because a game of Deep Rock Galactic takes on average thirty minutes to complete. No one wants to lose twenty minutes of work so everyone plays nice to get the materials they need.

Overall, this is a really fun game with friends and randoms that combines wave based FPS gameplay and mining. Progression feels rewarding and makes the player get out of their mission comfort zone. The developers are also actively adding more content, which is the major gripe that people have with this game. 

[u]Sound:[/u]
The game’s sound design is excellent. The music is used only for ambiance and never distracts from mining or gunning. The dwarves all have really enjoyable lines that are immediately funny and memorable (ROCK AND STONE BROTHER!!!). Mining sounds are realistic and it really felt like I was a dwarf mining in a cave. Guns have great audio feedback and are satisfying to use on the future squelching bug bits.

 [u]Graphics:[/u]
The graphics have a really unique style. The polygonal mining system’s art style is used on the dwarves and enemies to give the world a harsh, hard edged look. It helps to create the theme of four dwarves stranded on an asteroid while being yelled at by a corporate manager who doesn’t care about their safety. The colors are quite muted and all of the materials are matte to once again create a desolate effect. The graphics are quite crisp and I never became confused when looking at different enemy types as they are all uniquely models.
 
[u]Performance:[/u]
With such a complex mining system I was pleased to find that the game ran excellently on my computer on max settings. The game looks beautiful with these settings and I don’t even have the highest PC specs possible. 

[h1]Conclusion[/h1]
[u]Pros:[/u]
Great Community
Fun Gameplay
Memorable Sound Design
Responsive Controls
Unique Setting

[u]Cons:[/u]
Could Use Some More Content

[u]Rating[/u]
[b]9/10[/b].

If you liked this review or want to see more recommended games, be sure to follow our curator group: [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/Original_Curators_Group#curation]Follow Original Curator Group[/url]

40830382.review:
Good:
Exploration in Deep Rock Galactic is varied to keep things fresh (There are enough semi-randomized locations to not
feel repetitive early on)

Four class options forces teamwork and does it well (Some abilities are incredibly helpful and satisfying to use,
like the platform gun or the Zipline gun that changes the map and how you travel through it)

Alien swarms are chaotic and fun to constantly fight against (different locations provide different strategies to fight the
enemies.  Mobs climb all over, including the ceiling)

Destructable environment gives you strategic options (You can mine a tunnel in a straight line to the escape pod instead of running
through winding tunnels)

Reasonable amounts of ammo capacity forces teamwork (You need minerals to call a supply drop for more ammo, forcing you to be
careful with how you use your abilities and weapons)

Average:
Enemy mobs will partially clip through terrain and objects (This can be both good and bad considering the alternative.
(By fixing this and forcing the creature to follow terrain accurately, it can create a problem where players can barricade
(themselves from harm and slowly pick mobs off, stretching gameplay up to double the current length and nullifying the chaos
and teamwork.  Leaving minor clipping in for now won't harm the game in its' current state.)

Not enough public games for all types of missions (There are numerous private games, sadly it's difficult to find a public
game for certain missions that are not super popular) (Not a fault of the game itself)

Bad:
Issues with latency and teleporting enemies (Had an instance where everything melted into the ground and became unplayable)


$24.99 on Steam.  Highly recommended for explorers and with a group of friends.  Can be lots of fun with strangers, but I
would not recommend Deep Rock Galactic right now for solo play only.

40828754.review:
Normalmente, los juegos estilo Minecraft, incluso el citado, me causan una pereza enorme. Hay excepciones, como el Starbound, que realmente me atrapan y me gustan. Si a la mezcla de conseguir minerales en entornos desconocidos le agregas un componente cooperativo de 4 jugadores con 4 clases diferentes a escoger y con su función, entonces tenemos un gran juego en ciernes.

Dejando a un lado la construcción y enfocándose más en sobrevivir en un entorno hostil, éste juego nos pone en la piel de cuatro enanos malhablados y cabroncetes en un entorno futurista, en donde el nombre del juego procede de la compañía minera que nos ha contratado. Nuestro objetivo principal será abordar diferentes misiones de minería en el planeta HOXXES IV, ya sea en busca de algunos minerales específicos o destruír cierto tipo de enemigos.

La cuestión es que cada enano tiene su función y su equipamiento, y el saber combinarlos con el resto del equipo es fundamental. Y es el verdadero quid del juego: El Explorador es el que menos poder ofensivo tiene, pero es el encargado de ir siempre por delante e iluminar el terreno (ya explicaré un poco más el tema de la luz), además de poder llegar a lugares inaccesibles. El Ingeniero es el adecuado para la defensa y creación de plataformas, sobre todo por su habilidad para crear torretas centinelas, mientras que el Artillero es el guardián del grupo gracias a sus explosivos y su potente ametralladora, así como poder usar una tirolina para alcanzar sitios complicados. El último y no menos importante es el Perforador, que como su nombre indíca, está pensado para poder excavar a toda velocidad y conseguir accesos imposibles en la roca, además de tener un lanzallamas bastante letal.

Los niveles son procedurales, por lo que cada partida será diferente, y el poder llegar a ciertos minerales o zonas dependerá del tipo de personaje escogido. Matizar que, al ser un juego en el que la acción transcurre bajo tierra, la luz es un bien escaso. Con cada personaje tenemos tres bengalas que podemos lanzar a cualquier lado, pero aunque son inifinitas, debemos esperar que recarguen cada vez que tiremos una. Matizar que no se pueden colocar en techos o paredes, además de que rebotan varias veces y tienen inercia y gravedad, por lo que habrá que estar atentos donde las colocamos. Por supuesto, si contamos con un Explorador en el grupo, éste podrá iluminarnos de forma más efectiva.
Para poder extraer los minerales tendremos a MOLLY, un robot cuadrúpedo capaz de colgarse de cualquier superficie, y que una vez extraigamos con éxito tendremos que seguirla para que nos guíe hacia la nave de salida en una carrera contrareloj, mientras innumerables enemigos intentan evitar nuestra misión.

Recordad que es un juego que ahora mismo está en Early Access, por lo que todavía no está terminado del todo y podremos encontrar bugs o fallos por todos lados. Muy, muy pocos he tenido yo en las horas que llevo, y ninguna salida al escritorio ni nada parecido. Por cierto, los textos están traducidos al español, así que eso le añade un plus.

Recomendadísimo, sin duda alguna.

40823225.review:
tl;dr: Co-op fun that can also be enjoyed alone

I won't bother explaining the game itself, as that can be deduced from videos an so on. What I will talk about is how wonderfully balanced this game is. Having a fully kitted out character won't make you a Golden God who can't be challenged by the bugs and the procedurally generated levels. You will often times fall off into the abyss from a cliff you did not even notice. You will often times get swamped by creepy critters from all sides and join your fallen team mates. You will often times rush to the drop pod and make it out of there intact.

All of the 4 classes feel distinct, but none of them feel obsolete. You can play with all of them or use any combo you'd wish. Playing as an Engineer with your mate who's a driller? No problem. Gunner and Scout? No problem. Gunner and Driller? Still no problem. Just you as a Driller? Stop it already.

You never feel useless!

The game has been out for roughly two weeks and it's already a solid game. With added game modes, an increased level cap(albeit this isn't necessary), customization options and more varied enemy types, this can only get better.

It's all so wonderfully enjoyable. The most fun I've had in a co-op game in quite some time.

Well worth your hard earned moolah.

40821071.review: The only thing that compares to this level of cooperation is the left 4 dead series. 40821001.review:
This is the greatest game Ive played in a looong while, It goes back to the root of video games, and is shockingly refreshing! It is simple and pure, you explore classic video game places like "lava zone" and "sand zone", while participating in 4 player coop shenanigans. 

You have to explore new caves, work together to dig and climb and zip line and platform puzzle to reach the ore, and fight off hordes of bugs, while avoiding mining tragedies like falling to death, or bumping your friend and making them fall to their death. (dont worry you can revive them by ziplining down and pouring alcohol on them) the pacing is wonderful, with a perfect mix of exploration and combat. The dialog is hilarious, (they say what youre thinking!) The graphics are BEAUTIFUL and the combat is high quiliaty, intense, in depth and satisfying. And you can make it as easy or difficult as you wish immediately! No gating behind 20 hours of mind numbinlgy boring gameply before it is challening *DIABLO3*.

Finish it off with a mad dash against a timer and endless hordes to get back to the drop ship, and heroicly rescue your brothers in arms, or tragecially watch them get dismembered as you leave them to die in the tunnels on Hoxxes IV, the sole survivor of your ill fated mission. 

SUMMARY: This is why you fell in love with video games in the first place! So fun and pretty even your girlfriend will want to play! (If shes real)

40817974.review:
For being as young as this game is it's 10/10, amazingly fun, simple to learn, beautiful graphics, great audio, and great teamplay. However, I would like to mention there isn't as much variety in the monsters as I'd like to see. The environments you can visit are so vastly different, yet the creatures in each map are exactly the same. I hope that as this game ages there will be a more diverse creature-base to make the maps more diverse. Also, I would like to see different load-outs for each of the four dwarves, the ability to choose between a few different weapons for each loadout would be very cool. Lastly, I'd like to see more dwarf classes. The four that are already present are PHENOMENAL but I think more variety such as a ranged rail-gun class (for example) would be a cool addition to make the game more diverse. 

Overall, it's a wonderful game that I honestly think any group of friends would enjoy. The price of $25 is a bit steep but I personally think it's worth it if you have a group of friends who you would play it with.

40812448.review:
I´ve played a lot of games but this game stands out.
The gameplay is super fluid and the game feels very user friendly- whereas with other games it feels like the game is a conspiracy to frustrate you. 
There are many small things that add up like the ledge grabbing with the little upwards boost, the way you can kinda stick to surfaces that seem very steep or small. 

The wall-transcending bugs can be a bit much and should be tweaked, but at least it circumvents the issue a lot of other games have where you can find spots where the AI can hardly get to you.

But what impresses me most is the lighting and effects. I slipped up and feel down a really deep shaft the other day, landing directly on a volcanoe while a wave hit my team dozens of metres above me. Dead bugs raining down, the glow of the scout grenades emp field, the gunner zipping around on his lines with even the overheating effect clearly visible from far away, lots of explosions rocking the ground. It looked amazing. The game is already more impressive than most games I played, it feels good, it looks good, the performance is rock solid.

40802130.review:
Shallow, but well executed. Fun with friends. Worth the buy.

-The classes are well divided and fun to use. Everyone brings something to the table. Everyone has a job. 

-Maps are really cool to explore. The 'biomes' feel different enough to keep it interesting and the procedural generation is on point.

-Solo play, while mainly beside the point, is well executed. The support robot is responsive and legitimately useful.

- Developer response to host toxicity is appropriate; they're addressing the issues while not overreacing.

- The music is great. Very "Stranger Things".

-Overall, the whole thing feels like good old fashioned spelunking in minecraft (which was the best part).

40798135.review:
So far, this game has presented itself of being an potentially good game. It's pretty much an rough gem that hasn't yet been processed into a precious gem like a diamond. First off, The enviroments are vibrant and beautiful, also very interesting with procedural generation mechanic.

I love how this game incorporated the L4D-like co-op with mining and functional teamwork between classes. Like if one were to play an Scout, they can reach spots where others can't, though there can be limits to their grappling abilities of where they can go. Sometimes they would need an Engineer to place platforms where there is minerals, though they have no where to stand. Maybe you'll need alternate escape routes to drop pod, a driller could drill his way up to create an stairway up an steep wall, or maybe the gunner could place an zipline across that wide chasm.

Love how the game encourages teamwork between players with these classes and their gadgets, instead of running off acting like Rambo. Though the game does have an solo mode, the game is more fun and interesting with other people such as friends. One should never leave an dwarf behind the group, or things will get out of hand and dangerous.

Now, go with your mining brothers and sisters, then sing "I'm an dwarf and I'm diggin' a hole!" through the dark depths of the asteroid mines.

40794593.review:
マイクラを採掘、探索、戦闘に特化させたようなFPS
日本語対応はしてるが翻訳設定は毎回リセットされるので起動したらまずオプションを弄る必要がある、ちなみに右を8回で日本語になる
クラスが4種類あり、装備もそれぞれ全く違うので出来ることもかなり違う
クラス同士の連携が出来るとマルチプレイの難易度が格段に下がる
特にエンジニアとスカウトは互いの短所を互いの長所でカバーし合えるのでかなり相性が良い
エンジニアが高所の物資を採掘しようとすると何個も足場を作るか採掘して階段を作らないといけない
スカウトは高所移動が出来るだけで移動した後は落下しか出来ないのでそのまま死ぬ
二人が協力すればエンジニアは物資採掘出来る場所に一つ足場を置くだけで良いしスカウトが落下死することも無くなる
他にもドリラーはドリルで大きめの穴を素早く掘ることが出来るので階段を作ったり土を掘ったりするのが得意
ガンナーはジップライン設置でショートカットを作ったりできる
特定のクラスが強すぎて他クラスが死んでるということは今のところ全くないし被ってもok
装備をアップグレードするにはある程度はクラスを使い込む必要があるがそんなに時間は掛からない、物資集めの方が大変なくらい

マップはランダム生成だが採掘遠征ならほぼ一本道、殲滅は三本道くらいだが目標地点が常に表示されてる
離脱地点は広めの部屋一つで中央付近に物資の納入場所がある
捜索と採取は洞窟の複雑さLV3なのもあってか地形がやや複雑なので最も迷いやすい

モードの違いによる説明が無いので初見だと分からないこともあるので簡単に説明すると
採掘遠征、捜索と採取は物資を集めてM.U.L.E.とかいう自立型の納品ロボに納品するモード
捜索と採取はより複雑なマップ構成で迷いやすい
殲滅は目標を倒すモード、目標地点は常に表示されてるので最悪ドリラーで直進でもokではある
離脱地点は納品だがM.U.L.E.がいない、代わりに納品地点に大型ライトとタレットが併設されている

ミッションを行う惑星が幾つかあるが惑星ごとに購入、アップグレードに要する特殊物資の内容が違う
特殊物資はミッションクリアに関わらない代わりにクリア報酬には含まれないので自力で採掘して持って帰るしかない
参加メンバー数によって取り高が減ることは無く、入手した数に難易度補正でプラスされた数が全員に配布なので低難易度をソロプレイよりもちょっと難易度を上げて協力プレイした方が効率は良い
資金は物資を集める方が大変なおかげで不足するのは序盤数時間くらい、10時間超える頃にはコスチュームとかに手を出す余裕が生まれてたり

First things first, this game is a ton of fun. Awesome cave exploration and the combat system is really good so far.

The music is definitely a plus, I love the space synthwave style. :)

However, the biggest bug is when the game randomly won't let me control anything in the game and I am forced to restart and cancel EVERYTHING I did in a quest and lose rewards. It really sucks when you spend 30-40 minutes on a cave to only have the game stop working. Please fix this devs.

Bug #2: Sometimes as the scout class my grappling hook will stay tethered to the ground and never return to me, thus rendering it useless for the rest of the game until our exploration is fixed. 

I will still recommend this game for now only because it is a ton of fun and is unique. But please fix that issue devs.

Классы позволят гибко подстроится под ваш стиль игры, а уникальные перки не дадут вам заскучать (Чего только тросик у стрелка стоит). На данный момент игра сто процентов рекомендуется к покупке с друзьями, надеюсь, что впереди нас ждёт куча новых и интересных патчей.

40774602.review:
[h1]CO MI SIĘ PODOBAŁO W TEJ GRZE?[/h1]
[b]Pewna doza współpracy:[/b]
- Kopiemy sobie surowce, ale mamy ograniczoną pojemność krasnoluda. Więc wzywamy M.U.Ł.A i do niego przesypujemy to co zebraliśmy. Muł jest 1 i jest to taki mały element który zcala całą drużynę. Nie potrafię tego dobrze opisać, ale to jest fajne.
- Można rozkładać "linki" po których przechodzimy nad przepaściami. Linki te mogą mieć max kąt nachylenia 30*. Bardzo mi się to podobało, kiedy w dobrym miejscu taką linkę rozłożyłem i moje random-ziomki zaczęły z niej korzystać. Czułem się przydatny :]
- Możliwość ulepszania ekwipunku. Co prawda ilośc upgrejdów nie jest zbyt wielka (w przeciągu 1,5h zabawy wykupiłem ~40% przedmiotów w jednej klasie krasnoluda (z pośród 4 klas)) No ale... lepsza mała ilość niż żadna. Zawsze coś, a to jest w końcu Early Access.

[h1]A CO MI SIĘ NIE SPODOBAŁO W TEJ GRZE?[/h1]
Przeglądając inne negatywne recenzje, nie znalazłem by ktoś miał taką samą przypadłość jaka mnie spotkała. Niemniej jednak napiszę dlaczego postanowiłem zwrócić produkt.

Freezy.

Co kilka/kilkanaście minut gra mi się zamrażała na 15-20 sekund. O ile na początku nie było to aż tak uciążliwe, o tyle w późniejszym etapie gry, kiedy w pobliżu znajdowali się wrogowie - stało się to mocno niefajne. NIE WIEM DLACZEGO JE DOSTAJĘ. Gra chodzi bardzo płynnie, nie odczuwam również żadych lagów (nikt się nie teleportuje, ani nie dostaje hiper prędkości).

Więc tak: dostaję freeza. Po 20 sekundach widzę że jestem martwy. Czekam cierpliwie 3-5 minut na to aż ktoś przybiegnie i mnie "podniesie" (ożywi). Jak już wstanę na nogi i biegnę razem z moim ziomkiem ... dostaję znowu freeza. Po kolejnych ~20 sekundach jak gra mi się odmraża widze ze znowu jestem trupem... Akurat gracze z którymi grałem nie wyzywali mnie od noobów/retardów czy frędzli, ale założę się że pod nosem mówili to do samych siebie i po zakończeniu misji i tak mnie kikneli... Więc co do community tej gry nie mam nic do zarzucenia. Na ich miejscu też bym samego siebie wyrzucił z teamu. 


[h1]KRÓTKIE PODSUMOWANIE[/h1]
Gra na chwilę obecną może nie być warta 90PLNów... to zależy od grubości waszych portfelów. Zawartość tej gry może nie jest narazie zbyt bogata, niemiej jednak gra ma potencjał i ma coś fajnego w sobie. Jednak ze względów technicznych ogarnęła mnie spora frustracja bezsensownego ginięcia... dlatego wolę poczekać aż autorzy grę dopracują, rozbudują i dadzą jakąś promocję. Narazie jestem na małe nie.

40773799.review:
В игре не так уж много контента, да, но зато какой он там! А ведь это только ранний доступ
Оптимизация просто шикарна! Хоть тут и написано 6 гигов оперативы, у меня стабильные 60 фпс с моими четырьмя и херовой видеокартой.
Мне нравится, какой здесь присутствует тимплей. К примеру:
У тебя в команде есть инженер, ты играешь за разведчика, освещаешь огромную пещеру, он находит руду, ставит под нее платформу, а ты со своим крюком лезешь к этой руде, вставая на эту самую платформу.
Вообще, все классы в какой-то мере полезны в тимплее, это здорово. 
[b]Разведчик[/b] очень хорош для тимплея, ведь со своим крюком он спокойно может добраться до кого угодно, спасти его, если там, конечно, есть платформа
[b]Инженер[/b] ставит турели, которые помогают всей команде при обороне, к примеру, гнома, который воскрешает другого гнома, или опять же платформы для разведчика
[b]Буровой чувак[/b] (забыл название класса) пробуривает всем пути к руде или, опять же, к союзникам
[b]Стрелок[/b] может сделать трос, который схож с крюком разведчика, но который может использовать вся команда, и он еще и многоразовый (бесконечный)
И это я расписал только классы! В этой игре еще есть прокачка классов, разные локации, разные побочные руды, которые тебе не нужны на задании, но нужны для улучшения классов, разные режимы игры и еще многое другое! (но контента все равно мало)

40772918.review:
I am dwarve. An engineer. With my three fellow miners I drilled down deep into the rock to get the precious gems my people desire. We got out of our drop pod and swarmed the cave. It was all gloomy, wet and it smelled like mushrooms. We digged trough a number of chambers until we found our first gold deposit. We cheered, got the loot and that was the time when the rattling noises started. Dozens of bugs crawled our way and I just barely had the time to set up my sentry guns in order defend us. Both guns bled their lead into the bodys of those monsters. Minutes into the fight I looked at the sentries. Gun 1  was on 20 ammo, Gun 2 on 50. BLAM! BLAM! Gun 1 on 5, second on 20. BLAM! BLAM! first one is dry, second on 10... but it was just enough, the stream of bugs ended shorty before our ammo ran out. Maybe they gave up. We didnt though... We dug deeper...

Deep Rock Galactic is the miners dream! From the trailers I expected greatness and the game delivered. The content the game already has is shiny and polished already and there seems to be more to come.

The game features matches with up to 4 coop dwarves in suprisingly nice looking generated caves where you explore, fight and mine. The more time you spend in the caves the more likely a failure becomes, but the more stuff you bring home.

I havent encountered bugs, just some connection issues. If you remotely like the idea of this game: Buy it.

Très bon jeu que je viens de découvrir. Encore un jeu en Early mais qui est plutôt bien fourni pour le moment.
Le jeu est simple vous pouvez jouez de 1 à 4 joueurs, vous choississez un nain avec une classe spécifique (No spoil sur les classes pour ne pas gacher la surprise).
Vous devez coopérer pour récupérer des minerais ou autres, dans un réseau de grottes généré de manière procédurale, et remonter le tout à votre foreuse, le tout en subissant des attaques de créatures insectoïdes. Vous avez tout un système d'upgrade de stuffs mais également de cosmétiques. Vous débloquer ces upgrades en fonction de votre niveau mais aussi en fonction des ressources supplémentaires de vos missions.
Petit point négatif, le jeu n'est vraiment pas fun en solo (sauf si vous utiliser le système matchmaking du jeu), je vous conseil vivement d'y jouer au minimum à 2 et pour en profiter totalement à 3 ou 4.

Pour les graphismes, ils sont simples mais pas dégueux du tout, le jeu est très bien fait et plutôt beau dans son genre. Le jeu n'est pas non plus très gourmand, il tourne à fond à 144FPS sur ma config.

• Note finale •

16/20

40764958.review:
Ich kann das Spiel nur wärmstens empfehlen wenn ihr auf actionlastige Coop games steht.

Hier mal ein kurzes Beispiel: Runde startet, man kommt mit dem Stimmungsvoll in den Berg reingebolzten Begehbaren Mega Bohrer an seinem Zielort an und verlässt diesen erst mal. Kann sein das die "LZ" heiß ist und du direkt erst mal das gebiet von den spinnenartigen Aliens befreien musst. So weit so gut, nachdem das Gebiet gesäubert ist wird sich erst mal ein Bild über die Lage verpasst, da kommt der Scout zum Einsatz und schießt erst mal eine seiner Flares aus seiner Flaregun an die Decke, somit wird der riesige Raum zumindest teilweise erhellt und man sieht ob es vielleicht hier oder da ein paar Ressourcen gibt. Am anderen Ende des ersten Raums sieht man an der Wand das dort sowas wie Erde zu sein scheint, also geht der Driller mit seinen 2 überdimensionalen "Armbohrern" los und buddelt sich in sekundenschnelle durch die Erde und schafft einen Durchbruch in einen zweiten Raum. Dort lauern allerdings mehr dieser Aliens die sich direkt auf uns zustürzen. Der Engineer schafft es gerade noch so seine "LMG Gun Platform" aufzubauen, was hilft den Ansturm der krabbelnden Viecher zurückzuschlagen. Wir erkunden den nächsten Raum und finden dort einige merkwürdige Krystalle, Gold, Eier etc. was wir später zu Kohle machen werden am Ende der Mission. Unsere Aufgabe ist es 375 Morkite zu sammeln, Morkite ist einer dieser genannten Krystalle. Der Engineer markiert eine Stelle ziemlich weit oben an der Höhle, an der er ein Vorkommen entdeckt hat. Er schießt mit seiner "Platform gun" eine provisorische begehbare Plattform unter das Vorkommen, so kann der Scout jetzt mithilfe seiner "grappling Gun" was wie ein Enterhaken funktioniert zu dieser plattform gelangen und baut das Vorkommen ab. Er füllt das Morkite gerade in Molly die die Funktion eines Förderwagens aus dem bergbau hat als sich unsere Missionsleitung über Funk meldet das ein Schwarm von diesen Krabbelviechern auf uns zubewegt... 

Das war jetzt nur ein kleiner Ausschnitt aus dem was da noch alles kommt. Im Endeffekt wird das Spiel nicht langweilig, jede der vier Klassen (Engineer, Gunner, Scout und Driller) haben jeweils ihre Stärken und speziellen Aufgaben im Spiel. Die Höhlen sind alle prozedual generiert, d.h. jede Höhle spielt sich komplett anders da sie immer random generated ist. Ich bin sehr gespannt was die Entwickler noch so einbauen werden und werde noch viele Stunden in dem Spiel verbringen. Am besten taugt das Spiel wenn man es mit Freunden und Discord / teamspeak spielt, wobei das Spiel auch einen eigenen Ingame Sprachchat hat der auch einwandfrei funktioniert von dem was ich bisher mitbekommen habe.

40761820.review:
Foncez sans regret, surtout si vous avez trois potes qui ne savent pas quoi faire.

Des gros nains grossiers de l'espace du futur qui partent miner une planète hostile pleine de bestioles en compagnie d'un robot qui couine, de leurs flingues et d'une bonne dose d'audace, voilà ce qu'est le jeu.

Deep Rock Galactic, c'est un peu comme si Dwarf Fortress et Killing Floor faisaient un gosse, mais que celui-ci était fan de Minecraft et Starship Troopers.

Question gameplay, c'est un fps mêtant l'accent sur la coopération entre quatre classes de personnages que l'on pourra dire syénergétiques. Toutes ont un flingue, plus ou moins différent de celui du voisin, mais chacune aura son petit gadget facilitant la progression dans les grottes et cavernes regorgeant de minerais précieux. Tandis que l'un pourra lancer un grapin pour atteindre un filon d'or, l'autre pourra lui créer une plate-forme pour ne pas qu'il se casse la figure. Un autre pourra placer des tyroliennes, tandis que le dernier préfèrera tailler son chemin à grands renforts de foreuses motorisées. Les combinaisons de talents sont grandes et laissent place à quelque chose d'important : l'imagination des joueurs.

La difficulté est paramètrable selon le niveau de complexité de la caverne et l'objectif de la mission à son lancement, ce qui conduit, dans les plus complexes des niveaux, à se retrouver dans des labyrinthes opressants, obscurs, trompeurs, et dangereux, dans lesquelles il sera difficile de s'aventurer seul ou avec une équipe peu soudée. Ou mal équipée.

La progression du joueur est très classique: en faisant des missions, on mine de l'or, cet or se transforme en fric, avec ce fric on achète des améliorations d'équipements (il faut parfois quelques minerais rares aussi), qui sont disponibles à différents moments selon le niveau de la classe ou le niveau général du joueur (un système de double leveling).
Le pognon sert aussi à acheter des barbes et des casques. Eh oui! Un nain soigne son apparence! Et quoi de mieux que de choisir sa barbe et son casque, qui sont les deux seuls composants du visage d'un nain? ;)

Visuellement, le jeu est très joli, dans une patte graphique assumée très "blocky": on bouffe du polygone. Toutes les textures ne sont pas encore terminées, bien sûr: c'est un accès anticipé. Que cela ne rebute pas. La gestion de la lumière est très bien fichue, et c'est important dans des cavernes obscures, et pourtant très colorées, pour peu que les joueurs se donnent la peine de l'éclairer. Globalement, ça tourne en qualité haute/ultra sans trop de problème (gtx960 / 16Go ram par ici).

Enfin, le potentiel humoristique du jeu est présent dans les différentes mises en situation: les joueurs vont se créer leurs propres scènes après que l'un d'eux soit tombé dans un trou, ou après un tir ami, ou bien après que toute l'équipe soit hors jeu sauf celui qui n'a plus de munition et qui va devoir relever ses potes nains en échappant aux bêbêtes méchantes rôdant dans l'ombre :)

En conclusion: des barres :')

40758669.review:
It's a pure, fun experience - and I mean pure in that the core concept & mechanics are rock solid.

The game already has neat graphics, is very atmospheric & immersive along with great voiceovers and sound.

The classes could use some work, the engineer isn't that interesting to play and neither is the driller. I'm sure these classes will be developed over time. The problem with the driller is that there just isn't much of a use for the heavy drill and if there were I'd definitely want a longer non-stop drill time. Problem with engineer is that the platforms are only sometimes handy, turrets need to be reloaded too often, turrets could be cooler.

Scout for me is the most fun. A useful and fun to use grappling hook and the opportunity to light up huge caverns along with a decent shotgun & machine gun, the scout is overall a very efficient character.

The most important aspect is that the game is so much fun to play with the other classes. There's a lot to say about it and my wishlist for it is already pretty large (more resources to mine, better procedural generation, more types of enemies with better ai/pathfinding, less emphasis on waves and more on exploration/teamwork, less predictable) so I hope they continue working hard to polish and develop the game more and more.  But, I'd definitely recommend supporting the title and playing now as well.

40754849.review:
Having bought and played this recently, I will say this is certainly one of the most polished early-access games I've come across. It has both a cool concept, interesting design choices, and engaging social gameplay if you decide to play with your friends!

If you're either burnt out or jaded by the recent wave of Hero Shooters, Battle Royales, eSports, and all those other type of games being pushed hard as such, I recommend this. This game gives off a good feeling of yester-year where there were strong co-op games such as Left 4 Dead where it's you and your bros just duking it out against environments and the horrors that lurk in them. 

The only irksome thing that might halt some folks from buting is that the content is a bit barebones right now, but watching the devs on their Twitter and other various platforms, it sounds like they have a determined, steady path on what they want this game to become. 

If you want to wait for a sale or for further updates, totally up to you, but even then I'll still heavily recommend this. I think it's got a strong future and it's genuinely great to see such a potential co-op game being made. 

Until then, ROCK N' STONE.

40754118.review:
Was passiert wenn man Zwerge in den Weltraum schießt?
Richtig!
Sie suchen sich den nächstbesten Felsen und graben ihn um.
Deep Rock Galactic ist ein Koop-Shooter für Rauhbeine.
Als einer von vier Zwergen lässt man sich von einer Orbitalstation aus in einer Art bemannten Mining-Driller tief in die Kruste des Planeten schießen, wo man mithilfe des Teams verschiedene Vorgaben erfüllen muss.
Die Missionen umfassen derzeit das Sammeln von Erzen (Morkite), das finden von versteckten Objekten (zB. Alieneier) oder das ausschalten von besonders fiesen Monsterkäfern.
Das klingt gar nicht so viel, aber durch die 7 Grundverschiedenen Höhlensysteme, die bei jeder Mission neu generiert werden, verläuft keine Runde wie die andere.

Unten angekommen können die ausgewählten Klassen dann zeigen was sie können und worin sie sich Unterscheiden.
Der Gunner ist zB. der typische Frontkämpfer und hinterlässt dank Minigun ordentlich Blei in der Luft. Außerdem kann er Reißleinen verschießen, die in Schluchten sehr teamdienlich eingesetzt werden können.
Der Scout ist dank seiner Hakenpistole der mobilste aller Zwerge und kommt Problemlos jede Höhlenwand hoch. Außerdem hat er stark verbesserte Möglichkeiten die dunklen Tiefen auszuleuchten (der erfahrene Gynokologe wählt den Scout).
Der Driller kann sich Dank seiner Drills extrem schnell durch Wände und Böden bohren. Außerdem ist der Flammenwerfer im Nahkampf mit vielen Gegnern mindestens so effektiv wie die Minigun.
Zuletzt bleibt noch der Ingenieur, der aber ebenfalls eine klare daseinsberechtigung hat. Er kann als einziger automatische Geschütztürme aufstellen, die Gold wert sind, wenn die nächste Gegnerwelle heranrollt.

Nun öffnet sich also die Luke unseres Landing-Pods und vier brachial brüllende "Rock and Stone" Zwerge stürmen in die Dunkelheit.
Und dunkel ist es in der Tat. Um die Höhlen zu erleuchten müssen wir ständig mit Flare-Fackeln um uns werfen, die sich aber gottseidank wieder aufladen und somit unbegrenzt verfügbar sind.
Es gilt 250 Morkite zu finden und im Idealfall dabei nicht zu sterben.
Einer der Kollegen ist bereits vorausgerannt, obwohl wir den Startraum noch gar nicht fertig erkundet haben. Da krabbeln doch noch zwei Lootbugs an der Decke herum.
Als wir uns auf den Weg tiefer in die Höhlen machen, erfahren wir, dass der etwas ungeduldige Kollege soeben von einem Tentakel gefressen wurde. Schade für ihn.
Generell lernt man schnell, dass man das Team immer nahe beisammen halten sollte. Speziell die Tentakelpflanzen freuen sich über Einzelgänger.
Nach kurzer Zeit ist unser Sprinter gefunden und wiederbelebt.
Der Raum ist riesig und auf mehreren Ebenen von Wegen und Säulen durchzogen und überall hängt Morkite, Gold oder Nitra (Ressouce für Munition) an den Wänden.
Das übliche Chaos bricht aus. Die Zwerge rennen in alle Richtungen, brüllen die gefundenen Ressourcen stolz in den Raum und rufen abwechselnd den kleinen Mule Molly zu sich. Molly, das ist der keine Metallkasten auf vier Beinen der unser ganzes Zeug schleppen darf. Wir sind noch nicht ganz fertig mit dem Raum als die Kommandozentrale uns mitteilt, dass wir wohl einen großen Schwarm von Monsterkäfern aufgeweckt haben, der sich auf den Weg zu uns macht.
Wir suchen uns schnell eine geeignete Stelle und verschanzen uns so gut es geht, als auch schon die Hölle losbricht. Zu dutzenden strömen verschiedene Käferarten aus dem Gang in den wir uns eigentlich zurückziehen wollten. Manche davon können uns sogar ein Sekret ins Gesicht schießen, dass uns die Sicht raubt, so dass wir kaum noch erkennen können, worauf wir schießen.
An dieser Stelle sollte ich kurz das Friendly-Fire erwähnen. Ja das gibt es. Und ja, die Kollegen finden das gar nicht witzig.
Nach kurzem Feuergefecht haben wir das gröbste überstanden aber auch die Munition aufgebraucht. Gottseidank gab es genug Nitra im Raum, so dass wir ein Supply-Pod mit Munition herbeirufen können.
So oder so ähnlich wiederholt sich das Spielchen dann noch 1-2 mal, bis wir alles eingesammelt haben, weswegen wir herkamen (inklusive des ein oder anderen Dau-Todes - Oh, diese pulsierenden roten Ballons explodieren also in Kettenreaktionen). Wenn man schließlich so weit ist, kann man Molly mitteilen, Sie möge bitte den Landing-Driller rufen, damit wir uns abholen lassen können.
Hier kommt dann doch noch mal etwas hektik auf. Sobald der Driller gerufen wurde, hat das Team genau 5 Minuten Zeit bis zum Evakuierungspunkt zu gelangen. Wer das nicht schafft wird Käferfutter.
Bei simplen Höhlensystemen kein Problem. Bei komplexeren Höhlensystemen mit großen Höhenunterschieden kann es da schon mal knifflig werden, wenn man nicht vorgesorgt hat.
Hatte ich eigentlich schon erwähnt, dass während dieser 5 Minuten ständig Käferhorden aus allen Richtungen auf unsere armen Zwerge herabprasseln?
Wer Probleme mit zu niedrigem Ruhepuls hat, dem sei diese Erfahrung wärmstens ans Herz gelegt.

Die überlebenden Zwerge dürfen dann nach erfolgreicher extraktion ein paar der seltenen Ressourcen die sie gefunden haben, behalten und diese für Upgrades für Rüstung und Waffen ausgeben.

Fazit:
Trotz Early Access fühlt sich Deep Core Galactic jetzt schon sehr rund an und ich werde nicht müde, weitere Höhlengänge anzustreben. Die Unterschiede der Klassen funktionieren toll, die Spannung vor allem bei der Extraktion ist hoch und die Freude heile rausgekommen zu sein umso mehr. Abgeschmeckt wird das ganze durch die wunderbar kernigen Stimmen und Sprüche der Zwerge, die einfach nur passen. So und nicht anders klingen grimmige, gierige Zwerge!

Für mich ist der Content bereits jetzt ausreichend um mich noch eine lange Zeit gut zu unterhalten. Der Entwickler verspricht jedoch, dass noch eine ganze Menge kommen soll und das Spiel deutlich an Umfang zulegen soll.
Kurzum: Zugreifen! Es wird nur besser.

PS: Gebt dem Spiel 1-2 Stunden um euch richtig "abzuholen". Spielt man nur das Tutorial im Singleplayer, kann das langsame vorankommen einen sehr falschen Eindruck vom Spiel hinterlassen. Ich selbst war von dem gemächlichen Tutorial schnell gelangweilt.
Es ist ein Coop-Spiel. Macht also keine Solonummer draus. :-)

40753407.review:
Deep Rock Galactic (DRG) is a dwarven aesthetic action/platforming co-op FPS with strategy, exploration and horror elements thrown into the mix. You, a dwarf, along with your friends (also dwarves) get sent to explore underground cavern systems full of riches, secrets and an abundance of creatures with more or less than 2 legs.

DRG provides you with four different classes of dwarves including:
Gunner - equipped with a gattling gun, revolver, satchel charges and ziplines
Engineer - provides portable sentry guns and a great utility in form of a platform gun
Scout - brings self mobility via a grappling hook and plenty of light sources from the flare gun
Driller - plows through caves and enemies with titanium arm drills and a flamethrower
And last but not least some universal tools including a pickaxe, disposable flares and grenades.

The game is currently in alpha but easily manages to bring an amazing co-op experience which really pushes you and your friends to work as a team allowing you to maximize management of resources and accessibility in the caves. There isn't a huge amount of content in DRG currently but it's still incredibly addicting.

+ Graphically pleasing to look at
+ All the weapons and tools are easy to pick up and feel good to use
+ Caters towards both casual and hardcore gamers with highly varying difficulties and level complexity
+ Fair upgrade/leveling system
+ Funny dialogue
+ Optional vanity items allow you to customize your dream dwarf
+ No microtransactions
+ Updates regularly (From what I've seen recently anyway)

- Gameplay and progression can become quite repetitive and grindy (it [i]is[/i] an alpha after all)
- Only a few areas are available at once and they rotate via an hourly timer
- Game sessions can take up to 30-60 minutes to complete and require much attention
- Driller feels somewhat weaker than the other classes (even after a recent buff)
- Bosco (A singleplayer exclusive AI) can be extremely helpful when playing alone but tends to get in your way a lot
- The price of DRG is a little costly for whats currently available

Again, it's early access so take what i'm saying with a grain of salt. If you're into games like Left 4 Dead, Terraria and Minecraft you might like this game too. While the available content is fairly lacking I see a lot of potential for the future of this game.

[b]I'm not too great at writing long reviews and there's a good chance I missed some important information. If you have any questions I'll try my best to answer them for you.[/b]

40750546.review:
It's epic.
Kicks the crap out of Payday, Vermintide, and every other title to use the general Left 4 Dead formula of 4 players vs endless waves on your way to an objective.

4 different classes fo you and your mates to mix and match, none getting stupidly stronger from where they start in comparison to where they end up leveled and geared - so you won't be getting left behind by competa-tarded players who can't be bothered to stoop down to helping a "noob" which is why I Refunded Vermintide 2 to get this game in stead - I can actually play with people without having every game experience determined by level locking, character locking, and elitist players - IMAGINE THAT!
Stages and Characters are not level locked.
Difficulty levels are not level locked.
You can play the same favorite character with your friend, without your character being locked by another player if you only have gear unlocked for one character - you don't get totally shafted.
There is no stupid RNG loot system forcing people to clamor over each other in status and speed, and constantly measure eachother's E-peens against difficulty levels.



(Everyone I knew who got Vermintide2 couldn't be stuffed to stoop down in difficulty [difficulties, stages, and character classes are all locked by individual character level], and the general community is full of so many stupid people, that advancing with pubs was literally impossible, so going up in character level was impossible - especially if people playing already took your character. You aren't allowed to have duplicates for no actual reason. People just run away in different directions, and always act like they are the only one who exists in the game, without ever working together, so I never once finished a mission in Verm2 or Verm1 with public players. Vermintide community is the worst in gaming, second only to PUBG. I don't buy pure co-op games to play with bots all day)


*notes for the devs*
Haven't noticed any major bugs aside from the ones you have to blast.
Would be nice to free up our secondary weapon to be of our choice - they don't always match up the best; the Gunner is screwed by having a very low damage and high refire rate weapon that can't hit anything past ten meters unless you waste 50 rounds to make the gun MORE accurate after prolonged fire... so you run out of ammo almost entirely after a single wave of baddies, and then you only have a VERY LOW capacity revolver to defend yourself with after your ammo is gone; meaning that your party is limited to how much Nitra you can find to call down ammo pods until you have no nitra to call ammo and are FORCED to leave by necessity of survival, because people get totally ammo boned.

I get that ammo conservation is part of the challenge - which gives an incentive to find more nitra, but it's ridiculous how much ammo is spent on NORMAL difficulty. 
This would be okay on more dangerous modes, but on standard "Difficulty 2"?
That's a bit much.
Also makes the game impossible to solo if you aren't a total tryhard. I don't get purely co-op games just to be a competative tryhard... another reason I ditched Vermintide 2.

Maybe lower the cost of Nitra for ammo drops, or add *more* weapon upgrades for ammo capacity so our efforts on lower difficulties can mean a bit more and make our advancement help us keep going - not harder and stronger - but longer on higher difficulties. The difficulty in this game is never combat - and ALWAYS ammo conservation.
Nobody I play with has even died yet. Ever. We just run out of ammo, and are forced run away/after the loot box and back to the pod on our last magazines of ammo.
Or better yet, give us all a really basic weapon option with infinite ammo like the secondary weapons from Left 4 Dead.
-No matter what, we need OPTIONS for weapons in the future. Side-arms at the very absolute least.

40740950.review:
[h1]De las mejores experiencias cooperativas que he probado [/h1] 
En Deep Rock Galactic, tendremos que ir en busca de minerales y piedras preciosas a los sectores mas peligrosos del planeta, si es posible con la ayuda de hasta 3 compañeros.

[h1]PROS[/h1]
-Graficos muy suaves que me recuerdan un poco a Borderlands (pero sin el contorno)
-Niveles generados de forma procedural INCREIBLES con formaciones rocosas y fosos increibles como nunca antes habia visto.
-4 clases de enanos con habilidades y armas unicas. En el futuro ya han anunciado que habrá más clases.
-Semilla de generacion de niveles que cambia en lo que tardamos en completar un nivel aprox. De esta forma es imposible conocerte los niveles.
-Iluminación INCREIBLE y que nos hará la vida imposible muchas veces. 
-Efectos de particulas muy guapos.
-Posibilidad de mejorar las habilidades de los enanos a medida que suben de nivel, pero necesitaremos trabajarnoslo mucho consiguiendo materiales muy dificiles.
-La base donde empezamos es una pasada a pesar de que esta casi incompleta.
-La mula que nos acompaña y en la que depositaremos los materiales mola mucho.
-Las extracciones son muy épicas en la mayoria de ocasiones.
-Por fin un juego en el que la munición cuenta y hay que contar cada bala y cada item que utilizamos.
-Trabajo en equipo imprescindible.
-Posibilidad de cambiar la estética de los personajes.
-A pesar de estar en fase Alpha, apenas hemos encontrado un par de bugs y en general el juego es MUY estable.
-Entorno 100% destruible. Muy muy guapo.

[h1]CONS[/h1] Estando en Early access, son cosas que puede que cambien en el futuro
-Poca variedad de enemigos
-Las mejoras estéticas de los personajes son muy básicas y caras. Por ejemplo es carisimo cambiar el color el pelo y apenas se nota.
-Echo en falta un modo de creacion de personaje o al menos poder editar la cara.
-Seria guapisimo poder utilizar más gestos de interacción social o para comunicarse con los amigos.
-Es necesario un filtro "amigos" en el browser de partidas.
-El jugador que hace de host, aloja la partida en su equipo con lo que en caso de tener una conexión mala, la carga de niveles para sus compañeros puede durar un buen rato. Tendrian que añadir servidores dedicados y que al crear una partida, esta se alojara en uno de esos servidores.

En resumen, una de las mejores experiencias cooperativas que he visto hasta la fecha y que van mejorando poco a poco. 
Me parece tan bueno estando en fase Alpha, que me da miedo verlo terminado y con todo el contenido que han prometido. De momento solo hemos jugado dos dias, pero han sido dos sesiones de 5 horas sin parar. 

Aqui os dejo un video para que lo veais en movimiento. Espero que os guste.
En ese caso , podeis suscribiros a mi canal aqui --> https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC0PmKlXopkymAT1A4tLcsIQ?sub_confirmation=1

40737420.review:
Amazingly fun game that's currently (unfortunately) shooting itself in the foot by having an expensive 23€ price-point (not including the 15€+ supporter upgrade) when it's so incredibly early in development. It currently has the following issues that i will update as development goes along:

--------------

1. Any given objective or generated cave is incredibly samey and gets repetitive quickly. You land in your drop-pod, run out to have a small cave network and then you search for the "wet spot", which is compacted soil that you dig through to get to the next cave section to do your objective, whatever it is. Rince and repeat. 

2. Despite there currently being a dedicated "Digger" role, there's currently no meaningful integration of digging required in the current actual gameplay. Dig shortcuts to the other cave sections? Impossible because you have no idea of knowing where they are without finding the aforementioned compacted dirt wet spot (which any of the classes can get through within seconds using their standard pickaxes). This would be a thing if there was anything resembling ground-penetrating radar or if the in-game map wasn't complete garbage but sadly not. All the digger is currently good for is creating make-shift stairs to reach certain ores (not actually mining them with said drills hilariously enough) and panic-digging straight tunnels to the escape pod at the end.

3. The headlight you have on you is completely useless. It doesn't actually emit any light and only serves to apply glare on any object or wall you're staring at so If you're looking at a wall a certain distance away from your face, it'll be completely invisible until you step one feet forward more to have it become visible whatsoever and a gross majority of all caves are pitch-black which makes every session be a disgusting over-reliance on flare spamming.

4. Enemies appear and "dig" themselves out of solid rock right next to you constantly without making any noise whatsoever. It heavily breaks immersion and is only made worse by the leeches that latch onto you with no warning whatsoever while being 200 feet above in a pitch-black ceiling, out of your hearing range while you also have no way of actually seeing them due to your headlight's pathethic range and the flares more often than not being unable to reach up to anywhere near most ceilings. I've also seen said leeches being able to grab people that's completely horizontal from their base (when the cave spawning has allowed them to align with the cave you approach from) which is ridiculous.

5. Loadout variation. There is none for each class.

6. Progression system. Again, there's basically none besides upgrading specific bits of your gear to "be better". No specialization, no customization and nothing resembling any RPG elements like leveling up, perks, talents, stats, etc.

7. Vertical traversal is a f*cking pain. The zipline poles that the gunner gets (which you'd usually use to solve this problem) are heavily (and arbitrarily restricted) by descent and ascent angles that can't be upgraded or reduced while fall damage is HUGE. The personal zip-line that the scout gets is also the most suicidal (and hilarious to observe) thing in the game right now.

8. The kick system is STILL being flamboyantly abused and getting a tiny 25% cut (AKA, you FAILED reward) does not alleviate or fix this problem whatsoever.

9. The mule bot conceptually needs to be overhauled or removed. It is FAR too slow to be shared by 4 different people that more often than not run off in all different directions in huge cave networks (not to mention the long animation times), bugs CONSTANTLY by walking beneath the ground to get to whatever place it needs to be, often finds itself obstructing important paths and combat.. The list goes on.

40735384.review:
是个不错的好游戏，特别是我这种玩个mc沉迷挖矿的。不同职业之间的配合也不少，玩家能通过对职业的理解和操作的熟练感受到自己的进步，而不单单是装备的提升。说说个人对几个职业的感觉。
首先，工程师是我玩的最多的，因为当初守望玩的最多的也是炮台233.工程主要是和侦查的配合，在别人到不了的矿边上打上平台，让侦查飞上去采。同理也和枪手有一样的配合，不过目的是便于大家通过而不是采矿（不然太伤弹药了）。炮台尽量搭的靠前一点，因为存在友伤，靠后容易攻击队友，同时别太靠近，尽量拉开角度，因为有些怪需要攻击特定位置不然浪费弹药。一波攻击结束后，尽量把炮台弹药填满以防万一。刚下飞船的时候，就近找个制高点搭炮台，能方便大家很多，因为进新区域会有很多小怪。
然后是侦查，玩的一般，感觉就是全程望天，标矿，然后带路找东西。一点心得吧。进一个顶很高的大型区域之前，先往上面打个光，可以有效发现水蛭，同时提高勘探效率，千万别省弹药。（曾有队友被水蛭抓了又不说话，过去一个一个救一个一个死，被一个怪打了个团灭。论交流的重要性）其次队伍里的救人重任一般也是侦查比较适合，最后撤的时候一定要保证自己能活着到飞船，之后在考虑接应队友，回去一路上遇到地形复杂区域，记得帮队友打个灯，很有用！！哦还有减速手雷很有用
枪手的话，见过几个玩的挺6的，枪手的枪法就不说了，重点在于心思要缜密，一路上前进的时候要想好回去要怎么走，哪些地方要打绳会比较好，那几次任务我们几个腿短的职业回去路上无比舒心，ez的不行。还有就是战斗的时候就得留意头顶，远程怪左轮是一枪还是两枪一个，工程和挖掘都比较难打远程，手雷和c4一般和侦查的手雷配合好，效果就很好
挖掘这个职业吧，我是一次都没玩，所以也没啥发言权。。有一点在土里要能保持自己的方向感和位置感很重要。
希望官方能勤于更新，毕竟游戏内容还不多。个人建议可以搞些季度性的活动，比如公司要建造什么东西，不同的矿需要多少，然后让玩家收集上交，最后按照不同地区的分公司上交数量发放奖励称号啊，勋章啥的。拙见。
不错的游戏，希望更多人能加入吧。

40732162.review:
Deep Rock Galactic is a co-op FPS game that puts you in the shoes of a dwarf (with multiple classes to choose from). The goal of the game is to complete a random main objective usually in the vain of mining a certain amount of a specific ore, collect a specific amount of a certain item, or perhaps even kill a specifc amount of a specific type of enemy. 

The game puts you in a procedurally-generated cave of various biomes that is completely destructible (which means you can destroy anything you see more or less). 

Besides completing the main and bonus objective of each game, there is plenty of fun to be had exploring the caves mining various ores and finding rare items, all while finding tons of alien monsters. There are also random encounters such as swarms of monsters and bosses to fight. 

The game allows up to 4 players online, and playing the game with friends is a blast. But the game also offers a fun and solid experience if you prefer to play it alone, and even though you will have to fight hordes of monsters, the game and it's soundtrack can be quite relaxing (though very intense at times).

With multiple classes to choose from, offering completely unique experiences with their own weapons and tools, and more on the horizon, Deep Rock Galactic has a lot of gameplay value to offer. 

Even at an early stage of Early Access the game offers a lot for your money, great performance and hardly any bugs encountered. If Ghost Ship Games can provide regular content updates Deep Rock Galactic may very well shape up to be one of the better co-op experiences around, and so I highly recommend this for anyone who wants a fun, addicting, yet challenging co-op game to play either with your friends or by yourself!

40718758.review:
Down down underground,
Go two Dwarves with rocks to pound.
One he heard a shrieking sound,
Sounds like a Leech the other found.

Spiders biting on our toes,
Noxious gasses in our nose,
Shoot a bug and up he blows,
That's the way our mining goes.

Lost my partner to a glitch,
Down in caverns black as pitch.
He's now laying in a ditch,
But I don't care, I'm filthy rich!

This pretty much sums up my gameplay of Deep Rock Galactic. While there may not be a lot of content as yet, what there is has a strange addictive quality to it. 
  The unpredictability of the ever changing procedurally generated landscapes is what gives this game, for me, a terrifying charm. Just when I think I have the hang of it, (which translates as managing to complete a mission without dying once) and I confidently venture forth into another beautifully rendered cavern, a swarm of arachnids swallows me up in a sea of spiky legs and chomping fangs. 
  Playing with a partner is also no guarantee of success, as my friend will attest to...though to be fair we do seem to spend a lot of time trying to knock each other off cliffs and into fire pits. 

  In summery, this game while still needing work, is an excellent addition to my collection of fun and rewarding games to play. I look forward to future updates and content, but in the meantime please excuse me while I go pack my pickaxes and bug repellent..theres GOLD in them thar hills!
