40706519.review:
Tl;dr: a super fun well balanced and polished co-op game that will provide a solid experience to almost any type of player even though it is in early access. Worth the buy especially if you have friends to play with.

(Written at 16 hours in to the game) Found out about this from PC Gamer and I bought this game on a whim while looking for new games to play because I"m tired of the same old stuff. Turns out it was a great idea and one of the best and most unique multiplayer experiences I've had in a very long time. There's really no other game quite like this; it's part class based co-op hoard shooter, part survival, part mining game. 

You can currently play one of four dwarf classes, each with their own special abilities and weapons, and the best part about it is that every class feels just as useful as the other; each for different reasons. One guy can drill through anything, another can zipline to anywhere in the map, the next dwarf can build up defences or help build platforms, or you could just go with the default gunner class that deals a ton of damage and even that is super useful. Plus the voice lines and dialog are funny as hell.

The levels in this game are randomly generated labyrinths of complete immersive exploration set in outer space that are completely destructable, each area having unique materials to mine, special objects to search for, and various different hazards to avoid.

The only areas that I find this game lacking in is enemy variety and game mode variety; but this is an early access game that's still in the alpha stages of development so I'll cut it some slack there.

All in all; this is a solid game that will provide many hours of great fun for you and your friends; or even on your own, but this is definitely a multiplayer game at its core and should be played as such. And even though it is in early access; it's polish and fun factor would sure suggest otherwise. Definitely worth your hard earned money; the devs deserve it.

40702851.review:
If you're a fan of both Dwarf Fortress and Team Fortress, this might be a game for you. If you like what you see in the trailer, just buy it, because it's pretty much exactly what it looks like. Badass space dwarves, fully destructible terrain, waves of spider hordes. You can play solo, but I recommend the four-player co-op.

For an Early Access game, it's surprisingly well-rounded and fully-featured. The four character classes are well-balanced, though unfortunately there's only one interesting synergy (between scout and engineer) at the moment. Level generation is solid, and each cave ends up feeling fairly unique; some features, like hives of deadly alien bees, only show up in occasional maps, so even after hours of co-op I was still discovering new things. The different regions could stand to be a little more different from each other, but I suppose that will come in time. Enemy variety is decent, but still needs more work -- probably another one or two whole classes of enemy. The pace is a nice balance between quiet lulls for exploration and swarms of baddies. And there are four different difficulty levels to pick from, with 3 being a decent challenge and 4 (from what I've heard) very hard. All in all, it took about ten hours consecutively to start getting a little samey; in all honesty they probably could have released it as-is and it would be adequate; but it's good that they're still working on adding new content.

40697988.review:
Eight hours into the game I can say that I really enjoy it.

Here's a list of things that I like about the game

1. The classes feel unique in every way, some of them have explosives while others a flamethrower, or a grappling hook. This makes me feel like there is a need for a balanced team and it allows for different playstyles.

2. The environment is amazing, I feel like I am an explorer on a foreign planet. The lighting is perfect for the environments you are in.  Playing i've found plenty of plants, that can either harm or help you. 
 
3. The monsters are perfect, theres your light, annoying ones, and your heavy and hard to kill ones. Inbetween is your typical suicide exploding one, and medium cannon fodder ones. Certain enemies block your view and soem are just ranged. 

4. The environment isn't always your friend, sometimes theres a liquid dripping from plants that hurt you, or a tentacle arm reaches down and grabs you. 

5. Mining is easy because you don't have just a set inventory but a number for every item on the map. So you can carry the max amount of all the resources before dropping it in the MULE

6. You have the ability to call the MULE to you instead of going to it. 

Now, some of the things I would like to see changed in the game. Or, some things that need to be added to

1. Upgrades, currently the upgrade system is very minimal, but it is rewarding.

2. I am sure more locations will be added soon, but right now the current amount is fine. 

Overall, I really like this game, and I will say that its current price is perfect for the content you get.

40697466.review:
Think Left 4 Dead meets Minecraft/Red Faction meets Starbound, with lots of Starship Troopers en Lost Vikings comedic vibes thrown in! 

Teams of up to four players band together to do simple missions in randomly generated cave levels. There are multiple biomes, so to speak. Explore, dig, loot and fight to achieve the objective, then call in an extraction. 
People getting lost during extractions can lead to great tense moments, as the clock is ticking down and people have to reach the extraction vehicle on time. As a matter of fact, helping each other with navigation is important all the time. For example, players can mark minerals and anything else in the world so the people doing the digging can still get their bearings.

Gunplay feels solid and the otherworldly spelunking atmosphere is well done with weird flora and fauna and ambient sound effects.  Although it's nowhere near as tense as Aliens, it's not that hard to get seriously startled by bugs suddenly coming out of the goddamn walls! Sometimes you pop through a wall yourself and suddenly there's a bug in your face trying to get into your tunnel! Monster variety has been fine so far as well. 
The game features 4 character classes who complement each other nicely in terms of abilities. My favorite is the Digger, who has two drills for arms and can easily drill tunnels in all directions. Everybody also has pickaxes of course. The mining feels incredibly chunky and satisfying. There's also a Diablo-esque hub where you and your buddies can visit all kinds of vendors or even explore a bit to find silly things to engage with in between missions. The jukebox is especially great.

One of the noteworthy things about this title are its' dynamic lightning effects from flares and lamps. Sometimes you throw a flare through a hole and suddenly a massive cavity becomes visible. Of course you must satisfy your curiosity and go down there. But getting down there can be a real puzzle in itself. Will you combine skills or dig, or continue on in the current tunnel and see where that will end up? Luckily the game communicates where new areas are so you can always just go there to continue.

In terms of visual fidelity it's no Assassin's Creed Origins, but it's certainly a massive step up from Minecraft. In fact, I kinda like the slighly blocky and full-on cartoony look this game features. The dynamic soundtrack is quite the standout as well. Outside of combat it features sci-fi soundscapes that really set the tone, but during combat things ramp up with some great electro- and techno-like tracks. The accent of the dwarves is typical rowdy British, but still funny with lots of silly one-liners.

Very promising early access game! And that for a first title of this studio. Cool stuff.

40693268.review:
TLDR; Had crashing issue after a patch, reached out to devs via discord, got back to me and fixed within a few hours. Great gameplay and performance with lots of potential. 

I don't think I have ever written a review on steam before. However, I figured this game deserves one as I needed to reach out to one of the devs due to a brief crashing issue. The game runs extremely smooth all the time, ultra settings, 1440p at 60fps. However due to a patch earlier, my game kept crashing about 20/30 seconds after launch. I spoke to one of the devs name Johan on discord, he immediately came back to me and tried to help solve the issue, and within a few hours the team had managed to get out a patch which fixed the issue. So 10/10 on the support side of things. 

Regarding the game itself, I am personally having a lot of fun with it. DRG has a great balance of exploration/mining and combat, and the mining/combat also works towards progression of the classes, which is something I always enjoy in games. CS:GO and such like have never quite hooked me due to no progression/levelling system other than a number. 

DRG may not be everyones cup of tea, but if you are looking for great co-op experience, then this will satisfy that itch. Kinda reminds me of a mix between Killing Floor 2, Team Fortress 2, Borderlands and Minecraft all rolled into one, and that is certainly not a bad thing. 

Performace wise it runs super smoothly on ultra settings 1440p at a constant 60fps, and I really enjoy the graphic style. 

The game has a lot of potential and has a lot of features that need to be added and tweaked, most of this seems to be in the works though, and the devs are listening to the community and feedback which is always a good sign.

40691638.review:
+This game is what the underground caves of Astroneer SHOULD be like. The classes are very balanced, fun to play as, and very unique.
Scout - assault rifle, grappling hook, run and gun
Gunner - minigun, ziplines for entire team, can hold off entire waves
Engineer - turrets, platforms, ultimate support
Driller - flamethrower, drills, opens up new passageways, slowly burns entire crowds

+The maps are beautiful and diverse, each with unique hazards.
Dense biozone- pink and green, filled with tons of plants that want to eat you
Crystalline caverns- bright blue tough to mine caves that drain your shields
Fungus bogs- lush underground jungles
Sandblasted caverns- arid environment filled with bees
Magma caverns- earthquake prone, volcano-filled hell
Irradiated caves- poison gas, tumorous growths

+The community is great. You can hop into a match with randoms and everyone follows their roles, communicates well, and is generally very nice. "Rock and stone, brother!"

-Four classes at launch is a good start, but the future of this game depends on new classes. A medic class, a drone operator, and a shield deploying tank are a few ideas off the top of my head.

-Enemy variety is a bit lacking. The game has plenty of weak enemies, but there is only one boss monster, the dreadnaught. I would love to see more large bosses with unique ways to take them down involving plenty of teamwork.

Overall, I strongly reccomend this game for the strong classes, beautiful maps, and solid community.

40685790.review:
This is one of those games that, for the most part, will see you making your own fun. The feedback loop is fairly simple - you enter into levels through a mission select screen, use all the tools at your disposal to take out gigantic bug creatures, and mine as much ore as you can. Then, you rush to your escape pod and return to your base where you can spend your spoils on upgrades for your character.

Outside of the feedback loop, this game has personality. Hilarious dialogue between your commander and fellow dwarves goes a long way if you play with friends. The major downside is that's where the content stops. There aren't may upgrades in its current state, and very little to do outside that basic feedback loop.

TLDR: I'm excited to see where it goes, because gameplay is tight and the game shows a lot of character. But there just isn't much here at the moment.

Пара острых жвал, пробив защитный костюм, впилась мне в ногу. Я рефлекторно всадил четыре патрона прямо в пасть этой инопланетной твари. Всадил бы и больше - так неожиданна была боль - но вместо выстрелов раздались лишь обречённые щелчки курка.

Так далеко от дома.

Присоединяйся к Deep Rock Galactic, говорили они. Тебя ждут золотые горы и реки с уманитовыми берегами. Конечно же, об ордах враждебно настроенных гигантских насекомых было сказано лишь в общих чертах, на последней странице контракта и мелким шрифтом.

Так далеко от дома.

Нога тупо ныла. Из-за спины доносились звуки очередной партии жуков. Не обращая внимания ни на что, я бурил породу, пытаясь пробиться к трём своим соратникам. Я даже не понял как мы разделились - видимо, в какой-то момент, слишком увлёкшись добычей моркита и сбором окаменелостей, я забрёл в ответвление пещеры, слишком круто уходившее в сторону от основного направления движения группы. Потом я помню только бесчисленные орды жуков и потерянную связь.

Так далеко от дома.

Это не первая моя экспедиция, но одна из первых. Я успел свыкнуться с мыслью о том, что при каждой высадке есть неиллюзорный шанс не вернуться на орбитальную базу. Я привык к тягучему чувству опасности, поджидающей за каждым поворотом пещеры, за каждым отколотым куском породы. Я даже научился сходу определять уязвимые места населяющих планету жуков и выбивать из них всё дерьмо парой метких выстрелов. Я даже был близок к мысли о том, что скоро смогу выплатить долги и...

Так далеко от дома.

Нет, мне не выбраться отсюда живым, но дворфы так просто не сдаются. Пусть нет патронов и топлива для огнемёта - подходи в рукопашную, хитиновое отродье! Вооружившись двумя бурами, я стоял в тупиковом кармане пещеры среди залежей золота, магнита и уманита. Из единственного выхода наконец показались ядовитые пасти в тусклом люминесцентном свечении. Хищный рык многократно отражался от стен пещеры. Я стоял ровно и дышал спокойно. Моя очередь рычать, насекомые.

40678576.review:
[h1]简介[/h1]
看起来像《异星探险家》的挖矿玩法地形破坏+《Helldivers》的四人协作武器搭配？确实。但是这就是一个成功的作品在借鉴这点上与其他游戏的不同之处：看起来没什么不同，实际上完全不同，但总归没什么不同——它们都很好玩。
[h1]总分：35/40[/h1]
讲实话，我自己都觉得这个打分有点鸡蛋里挑骨头了。不过看在78的售价的份上，这游戏还有点可以提高的部分。
[b]游戏性：10/10[/b]
[list]
    [*]自由的地形破坏与出色的地貌生成系统
    [*]对照明玩法的合理应用
    [*]各有特色但整体平衡的职业设计
[*]将以上三点有机结合所产生的大量策略集
[/list]
[b] [strike]叙事[/strike]沉浸感：9/10[/b]
[list]
    [*]昏暗的洞穴探索[spoiler]和迷路[/spoiler]体验
    [*]周期性的大小虫潮使关卡富有节奏感
    [*]不错的矮人角色刻画[spoiler]按V致敬[/spoiler]
    [*]装弹动作略显糊弄
[/list]
[b]画面：9/10[/b]
[list]
    [*]出色的优化
    [*]恰到好处的画质和特效，完成度很高，高的不像个EA游戏
    [*]地表特征重复度还是太高了，不过相信以后会改善
[/list]
[b]音乐：7/10[/b]
[list]
    [*]音效很到位，无论是台词和战斗音效都称得上舒服[spoiler]按V致敬[/spoiler]
    [*]恰到好处的画质和特效，完成度很高，高的不像个EA游戏
    [*]与之相比BGM的质量就相当一般了
[/list]
[h1]玩法综述[/h1]
就像你们看到的这样，这个四人合作游戏的单局目标（一般）是挖到指定数量的矿物。围绕着这个玩法有以下游戏元素：
[b]地形[/b]
本作的地形破坏与异星探险家高度相似，Low-poly风格让塑造各种地形形状成为了可能。在游戏里，自动生成的地形包括隧道，天坑，窄桥等等，它们是玩家在挖矿时要面临的主要挑战之一。游戏的不同职业，除了挖矿的十字镐默认都有之外，都拥有至少一种独特的处理地形的方法。
[b]照明[/b]
游戏中不存在能看到天空的洞，所以所有照明都只能由玩家，矿骡和洞窟里一些会发光的晶体提供。每个玩家都有会随时间自动回复的荧光棒可以丢出用来提供小范围的照明，还有一些职业可以提供额外的照明。同样，由于地形复杂的影响，这也导致迷路的概率大幅提升，跟紧队友在任何时候都很关键。
[b]敌人[/b]
矿洞里栖息着外星虫子，目前出现的主要虫子敌人有五种，各具特色。除了零星游荡的虫子之外，每隔一段时间会刷新大量虫群来袭击玩家（会提前拉响警报），类似求生之路里的尸潮，玩家需要集中应对才能通关。
[b]挖矿与逃生[/b]
游戏里存在一个一直跟随玩家的矿骡。玩家身上能够携带的矿物是有限的，所以需要周期性的回到矿骡提交矿物，也只有这样才会增加任务进度。矿物大部分都出现在洞壁上。除了任务必须的矿物，洞窟内还会刷新黄金（直接奖励金币的矿物）和硝石（呼叫弹药补给必须的矿物资源）这种通用矿物和一些根据地区不同出现的稀有矿物（在商店购买需要）。在玩家满足任务目标决定回城后，玩家需要跟矿骡一起前往空投仓位置逃生，同时会无限刷新大量虫子，玩家需要快速跑到空投仓逃脱才算完成单局。
[b]职业[/b]
游戏目前包括四种职业：
枪手：武器为加特林机枪，左轮手炮（伤害最高的单发武器）和C4，擅长重火力持续倾泻。拥有可让全队成员使用的滑索发射器（就是PV里那个），在跨越地形时非常高效。
工程师：武器为弹鼓霰弹枪，榴弹发射器和自动炮台，擅长防守，常年稳坐击杀第一宝座。拥有平台发射器（PV里的那些黄色的台子），能够让其他职业的同伴方便的在墙壁上停留，也可以搭桥跨越一些较窄的深沟。
钻机手：武器为火焰喷射器，一把普通手枪和C4，擅长处理大批敌人，火焰也可以穿透护甲造成伤害。持有钻机，是全队挖洞最快的职业，能够处理几乎所有地形，就是需要花不少时间。同样，在逃生的时候让钻机一路钻过去也是个常用套路。
侦察兵：武器为自动步枪和双管霰弹枪，擅长处理少量敌人，火力最低。但拥有万能的弹射抓钩，无限使用次数，能够穿梭在各种地形中，非常适合挖一些别人不好挖的矿物。照明弹发射器可以发射一颗黏在地形上的照明弹照亮相当大的范围，属于一个功能性很强的职业。
[h1]整体评价[/h1]
游戏整体难度并不高，12小时足够让玩家适应较高难度的游戏，最高难度对配合的要求会更高，但操作如何其实并不重要。目前游戏的销售量大概在6万左右，还处于快速上升期，暂时不用担心鬼服问题。
我个人认为这款游戏最吸引我的正是游戏性一项里提到的三种元素的有机结合。由于玩家有着对地形，照明和敌人这三项需求的需要从而产生了四种职业的各自专长。很多游戏设计者在处理这种需求时通常会盲目的把一个人能做的事情强行分拆给四个人，如此就让每个玩家都感觉自己是个残疾人。但Deep rock galactic这款游戏并没有让我产生这种感觉。虽然四个职业良好分工能够以最快速度通关，但在单人模式里一个人单刷同样也没有解决不了的问题（虽然要花的时间可能…）。而这种设计所诞生的各种战术组合则极大的延长了游戏的寿命。对于一个EA阶段的游戏而言，如此的完成度实在难能可贵。要说唯一的问题，游戏的bgm有些索然无味，建议自备歌单，那些欧卡推荐歌单就不错。

Pros:
great 4 player coop experience
distinct 4 classes to play
good procedural generated levels
challenging at higher difficulty levels(1-2pub friendly, 3-4 better know your class and team)

Cons:
few maps and modes
few weapons per class
few enemy types/boss types
few mission objectives


Missions play out as you landing in the planets underground cave system via droppod with the task of gathering a certain mineral to reach a quota(plus the secondary object to gather x amount of something like flowers of mushrooms native to the planet's region) as you explore the level which is never the same thanks  the way the game creates maps through procedural generation. As you go through the cave system you’ll encounter the planet’s inhabitants, mostly of bug like creatures who are spawned throughout the map, who will attack in waves frequent through a mission in different patterns, be it a swarm of little crawlers nipping at your knees slowing you down as you kill them, to suicide bomb bugs who will rush you, bite you then blowup, to a cave leech in the dark ceiling that will pull you up to drain you and sometimes boss class enemies spawning every other bug enemy type at once the deeper you do in a mission. Once you mined enough minerals to complete the mission you’ll call the drop pod back and have to rush back to it while enemies start spawning from the walls to stop you which makes things interesting as you and your time will have to navigate back through the cave system working together before you are swarmed the coming hell that has awoken.

Game is a great coop experience that relies heavily on your teamwork to get through a mission by other means than another gun to pull a trigger. The Classes synergistic with each other either to gather minerals easier or transverse the terrain of the mission be it the platform gun of the engi used to shoot platforms on walls so others can use to cross, the gunner throwing a zipline others can use to get to higher places, the driller making tunnels for quick escapes to the droppod or the scout who hookline gun makes gather minerals at high place faster easier for the team(may need a platform most of the time).

40671382.review:
TL/DR; Great fun with the right group, but absolutely awful playing solo.  Get it for the online coop play not for SP.

Take the following with a grain of salt - it's only my set of experiences, not everyone's...

Bosco, my solo 'helper', spent most of its time getting in my way and preventing me from mining or shooting enemies.  Worse yet, Bosco did nothing when cave leaches grabed me; it waited each time until I was downed then revived me (using up one of only 2 revives available in solo play).  Bosco is as much a liability as it is a help - it would help a lot if Bosco would just keep its distance from the player and not interfere.

Compare this with coop:  where players actively cover each other, but rarely cross each other's line of fire; cave leaches are often killed before they get their grubby mouths on the player; and rarely do players get in each others' way while mining.

Whlie solo has limited revives by Bosco (only 2), multiplayer has unlimited revives.  This frees coop play from the artificial and unnecessary hard limit placed on solo play.

In solo you only have the class you chose to play; in coop each player can bring a different class, allowing for intended game play where each team member is a vital part of the whole - solo misses out on this entire interplay and is weaker for it.

Basically, the greatness of this game lies in its multiplayer coop, not in the single player.  If you're looking for a single player game, I'd suggest looking elsewhere.  If you're looking for quite a few hours of online coop goodness (with built-in voice chat), I can highly recommend Deep Rock Galactic.

40666913.review:
This game is in the alpha stage.

In nine hours of playtime, I have found [b]one[/b] desync issue, and occasionally Molly likes to walk through extremely thin patches of terrain. I have encountered no other bugs.

The game runs incredibly well, especially considering the environment is -all- voxel. The graphics are fantastic, favouring minimalistic textures and an excellent lighting system that puts you in the moment without straining lower-end machines.

And then there's the Starship Troopers-style bug hordes that crawl on the goddamn ceiling which almost never fail to make my butt pucker atleast one time every mission. The shooter gameplay is well done, and pretty well balanced for an early access title - will likely need a tweak or two as more content is added in later development phases.

There's a Ron Swanson mustache.

If anywhere near a fraction of the current game industry put as much work and passion into their projects as this studio, we'd have world peace. [b]Buy it, and join us in screaming at cave leeches as they abduct our friends. You won't regret it.[/b]

40654149.review:
There are few games I can say that I purchase without any regrets whatsoever. Deep Rock Galactic is one of them.

Deep Rock Galactic is a class based coop first person shooter based on a procedurally generated and completely destructable map. The game emphasizes working together to not only fight enemies but to navigate through the terrain and darkness. The 4 different classes offer a large range of complementary skills all while retaining a very solid identity. Unlike many other coop class games, the classes in Deep Rock Galactic are very well thought out, offering unique skills while all still feeling very badass to play.

The developers have done an amazing amount of the polish to the game. Reading the Early Access note, the players have estimated another 1-2 years of development in the Early Access period, a remarkable promise given how finished the game already feels. In short, Deep Rock Galactic is a solid game that will only get better as more content is added.

40646205.review:
I understand that this game is still in early access, and when the game fully releases and if it seems a lot better to me I'll come back and play it again and edit this review. As of right now however I would not recomend this game to anyone unless you have a group of at least three other friends who would be down for playing this game as a group. I've seen it addressed in some other non positive reviews but the "quickplay" feature is awful. It gives the host the ability to kick anyone they want, and when you're a solo player ready to dive into a mine and start spelunking, getting kicked from multiple parties, even the same one mulitiple times, is an awful way to spend an hour. Perhaps simply changing the quickplay feature to just that a quickplay feature, when playing Overwatch I can't kick someone on my team, so why here? For people with a team let them do invite or private groups.

Besides that the actual gameplay itself was a bit lack luster. Sure you'll spend some time mowing down waves of spider like creatures during a "horde" section. And even some time traversing the underground caves mining and recieving minerals, etc. But I found the majority of the time I spent in caves was spent back tracking where I had just been, or where my teammates had been. There is a map in the game, but it's bound to the "M" button I believe and requires you to hold it down to activate (and while you want to use it)... That is just plainly bad game design. You litterally have to remove you right hand from your mouse, or strech your index finger so far that your normal "WASD" position is thrown off horrendiously. also the map itself is poor and confusing, and in a game where you are constantly changing elevation players would be much better off with a 3d map, along the lines of the one in Subnatica, that displays the area around you in a 3d image, this would better help the player understand where they could possibly go. Back to the back tracking, but not off of navigation, the game itself is very dark, of course it would be I mean you're spelunking there is no sun down there. And you are given 3 flares that recharge but don't provide a long amount of light, their is also a class that offers a flare gun. Said flare gun can be upgraded in a few ways one of which I believe was allowing the flares to last longer, as I'm sure their is probably one for your common flares too. The problem is the flares don't last long enough and even when you think you've found a new tunnel to explore, many times you'll soon come to find a handful of burnt out flares littering the floor, left by one of your teammates, or even you. 

I feel like I could go on for a while, but I in know way mean any disrespect to the developers of this game. Obviously the game itself peaked my interest enough to purchase it (even though I later returned it), and the game itself runs well, the concept is fun, and the writing and voice acting warranted a few chuckles. I just don't think the game is all there yet ( It's early access I know). But from the other early access games I've played I was just expecting more. Of course I'm sure they'll add some sort of a "campaign" to the game, and maybe even scale down the single player difficultly too, as when I tried that I kept getting destroyed by the "Horde" sections, it almost seems they didn't change anything between single and team mode besides you getting a robot companion to help out.

If a dev does read this though, good job on what you've done! When your game fully releases and it seems more player freindly I may shell out a more expensive fee to give it a whirl again and then happily change this review! 

Just please take these notes into consideration:
- Rework the map - I'd say make it 3d and stick it in the character's U.I. so it's not clunky for the players to view and use it
- Seperate private and quickplay lobbies - If someone has 3 friends that want to play a game together great! But let the loners group up together without getting kicked from game after game.
- A slight rework on the flares, at the least scouts flare guns flares should be upgradeable to never run out (this may be a later upgrade already that I just never reached). And if you're worried about scouts spamming flares and supply drops to light up the whole tunnel system, cap the amount of active flares each scout can have. Say 10 perma flares be scout, unless you think having a possible 40 never dying flares up at a time is too much.

40643217.review:
Deep Rock Galactic ist ein netter Ressourcen Grinder für zwischendurch. Das Gameplay und die Grafik ist gut, die Features müssen aber noch ausgebaut werden.

Einige Merkmale:
—————————

» 4 Klassen mit unterschiedlichen Waffen und Fähigkeiten. Jede Klasse kann seine Teamkameraden mit einer nützlichen Fähigkeit unterstützen.
» Die Munition ist sehr begrenzt und kann aber in der Mission mit einer Nachschublieferung wieder aufgestockt werden.
» Einer Mission wird per Browser oder Quickjoin beigetreten
» In der Mission sammelt Ihr Ressourcen gemäß Zielvorgabe mit einigen Waves an Monstern
» Ist die Mission abgeschlossen erhaltet ihr Erfahrung aufgrund der gesammelten Ressourcen und der Teamleistung
» Das Upgrade der Items oder die Anpassung vom Aussehen, geschieht durch die am Ende jeder Mission erhaltenen spezial Ressourcen
» Die Waffe kann bisher 3 Mal verbessert werden und die restlichen Items 2-3 Mal. Ich sehe hierbei keine Motivation oder hatte große Ahaaaa Erlebnisse, da muss noch entwickelt werden
» Auch die Skins hauen mich nicht vom Hocker. Einige Bärte und Farben dafür sehen die Rüstungen gut aus.

Das Flair mit 4 verrückten Zwergen durch zufällig erstellte Höhlen zu grinden kommt ziemlich cool daher. Trotzdem fehlt mir noch das gewisse etwas, um mich länger mit dem Spiel zu beschäftigen. Als Early Access Titel macht das Spiel schon mal einen guten Eindruck und bin gespannt wie sie das Spiel verbessern werden.

40639339.review:
An absolutely fantastic co-op experience. It manages to merge the best qualities of Left 4 Dead, Earth Defense Force, and *ahem* Minecraft all into one very cohesive and fun experience. The gameplay is simple and smooth, the game as a whole is relatively bug-free at the moment, and each of the four characters feels unique and interesting as far as their play-styles go.

The only gripes I currently have with the game are: 
The lack of a "Vote to Kick Player" option in the menu.
The lack of items to spend your currency on (this is early-access, so it's completely understandable)
And the lack of enemy variation. (Spiders, Big Spiders, Flame Spiders, and... that's pretty much it)

But again, most of these problems are due to the game being in early-access. They could honestly fully release the game right now and it'd feel finished, but with a bit more content, the game could be something truly amazing. I definitely feel like this game was worth my money, and even more importantly, my time.

40635402.review:
In every way possible this is a prime example of early access done right. The developers are focusing more on quality over quanity which is something that not enough EA devs focus on. 

This is a total better with friends type coop game, my first mission with friends took us to a deep dark cavernous cave, hardly knowing what to do we walked around looking for the precious material Morkite, but the planet had other plans for us, immediately after finding our first vine of Morkite we heard there was a swarm coming for us, we really didn't know what to expect but damn. It was literally something right out of Starship Troopers, giant bugs came out of all spots of the cave, they came out of the walls, came out of the ceiling, came out of the floor, we were totally surrounded we quickly ran out of ammo and had no clue how to get Nitra which is a material needed for calling down supply drops eventually we found some and restocked. We gunned down a countless number of bugs and eventually called down our extraction. Once you finish your objective you're not exactly in the clear, you gotta fight your way to the drop pod. Getting to the drop pod is probably my favorite part of this game since you only have 5 mins to do so, so any aliens you come in contact with can really limit your time to get back to and that pod is leaving with or without you. Deep Rock doesn't care that you and your fellow Dwarves just did all their hard work, they just want the materials, My friend playing as the miner dug us a hole straight up to the drop pod but that strategy isn't the best, bugs immediately crawled into the hole making it impossible to run away, we had to stand our ground and thin their numbers, we wound up making it on the drop pod with only seconds to spare, we looked at the score screen and realized that this mission just took us a full hour to complete and the best part is that it was considered a tier 1 mission, so basically the easiest least complex caves in the game. After that we started getting used to how things work and have been running all the more complex missions. 

This game really is incredible and I can't wait to see where early access takes it, already having a ton of fun playing this through so can't wait to see more content

40631346.review:
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1323157556
[i]（射爆）[/i]


[h1]合金矿工[/h1]

【2018.3.7】

截至发评测时本人游戏时间8.3小时，只尝试了钻机手职业，并未深入挖掘游戏内容，所以该评测内容不一定准确

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1323157512
[i]（淘金热）[/i]


[h1]采集矿物，扫除障碍，逃出生天[/h1]

简单，日复一日的工作

目前游戏正处在抢先体验阶段，所以内容就那么点，你大概只需要15小时就能体验到目前阶段全部的游戏内容，除非你想把所有职业练满级之类的。【注：四种职业的经验是分开计算的，并且装备不互通】

游戏的大致内容就是携带好公司给你的装备坐上班车，到了工作地点后探索并收集所需要的矿物（或战利品），用公司给你提供的装备扫除路上所有挡你路的东西（不管是会动的还是不会动的），最后把矿物或战利品装上矿骡（昵称莫莉）并跟随矿骡坐上回家的班车。

如果你是单人模式上班，深岩银河公司还会很亲切给你配备一台单兵作战机器人（昵称博里斯），不得不说这个机器人比我的工友苏哥靠谱多了。

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1323157969
[i]（工友苏哥）[/i]


[h1]分工协作，人多力量大[/h1]

咱们工人有力量

这年头，砍个僵尸抢个银行都得起码四个人，你要是想拆迁还得再多加一个人，为何不叫上你的工友也来一起挖矿呢，在深岩银河公司里，你会见到许多穿着不同工服携带各类设备的员工，每种员工所携带的设备，公司是有相关规定的。

职业不同，所擅长的事情也不同，枪手擅长清理各类中小型怪，火力强 枪法准，哨兵上天入地飞檐走壁，还拥有最耀眼的照明弹，我的工友苏哥是工程师，擅长塔防和架设工作平台，并且还有一把大到连裤裆都塞不下的榴弹炮，而我是钻机手，左右两把金刚钻，逃跑全靠这两把刷子，我还配备有火焰喷射器用来消灭害虫、煎蛋以及给苏哥点烟。

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1323158020
[i]（神奇宝贝的故事告诉我们不要钻草丛）[/i]


[h1]卡通风格，随机地图[/h1]

卡通画风的优势就是好看护眼并且不烧配置，虽然满屏幕都是马赛克和我的工友苏哥那臃肿的大屁股，但是在绚丽的光影效果下，被困在矿洞里听着另一头的接线员哔哔哔，似乎也不是一件很糟糕的事情。

游戏内的洞穴网络是由程序生成的，也就是说你总会在新的地方迷路，不存在两次相同的迷路体验，同时因为是程序生成，导致有些洞穴系统过于怪异，以至于你的矿骡和怪物可能会从一些诡异的地方穿墙而过。

[h1]总结[/h1]

目前阶段游戏内容太少了，我除了吹牛逼实在没什么可说的，不过我觉得这个游戏有很大的拓展空间，就像最早连30帧都到不了的《PAYDAY 2》一样，买来就当做是一种投资，期待后续的更新使他更加完善

40625178.review:
A breath of fresh air for an early access game. This is what early access games should look like out of the gate:

PROS +
------
+Optimized
+Replayability
+Content Rich
+Minimal Bugs
+Working Mulitplayer
+Room to grow
+Realistic and Reasonable Price Point
+Barrels

CONS -
------
-Friends required to keep it enjoyable
-Not solo friendly
-Progression not fleshed out yet

This game is just plain fun. This cool little multiplayer shooter is chock full of dyanimically generated content that keeps every match fun and interesting. Each level is unique and chock full of ore to discover and alien bugs to kill. So grab some friends, kick some barrels, and kill some aliens whilst stuffing your pockets full of every kind of rock you can find.

I usually won't touch early access games with a 20ft pole, but I'm willing to make an exception: Deep Rock Galactic is an immensely fun game as-is and I look forward to seeing what the devs have in store for it. ROCK AND STONE BROTHER.

40622931.review:
DRG is a pretty neat idea of a game. Go mining for stuff you need,shoot big ugly nasty bugs in the face,and escape. Honestly,the escapes are the best part. I've had times where it goes smoothly,and I've had a time or two in my limited go so far,where it all goes side ways and it's total chaos as we scramble to get back to the escape pod.

Is it worth it? Yes and no. It really does need more content. But right now,it's a good,solid EA game,that I can reccomend.

Have I had problems? A few. Namely,lots of disconnecting issues. I don't think it's being kicked,I really do think it's a glitch that results in getting the boot.  If you alt tab out sometimes you get a hard lock of the game and you have to alt-F4 it.

Can a potato run it? Probably,my PC is now considered middle of the road,

Pros
-Game is fun,it's easy to get into,and quick to learn
-character customization and upgrades
-runs pretty well for an EA game other than a bug here and there.
-Dwarves with big guns.
-No regenerating health/ammo means the game is a fun challenge.


Cons
-Customization needs more options and upgrades
-classes need more/varied weapons
-That hard lock bug I've had.
-No medic class.

40621745.review:
I'm recommending this with a caveat. The game is fun and seems to scale well, but it is tough. You will die. You will fail missions.

Overall it runs well. There's been some lag online (despite a great connection and no lag in 99% of other games). But the lag doesn't really detract from the experience.

The characters, the classes and the weapons/tools are all well thought out and fun to play. I've only tried gunner and driller so far and find myself prefering driller. 

There does seem to be a bit of a pattern in how the bugs spawn and when they appear. Hopefully this is more randomized in future updates and it doesn't just feel like they swarm you on a timer or on mission exit.

If you've got friends to play it with, like digging... alot, and like shooting bugs, go ahead and pick it up. But keep in mind in its current state, there's not much more to it than that and you will be frustrated at times.

I'm looking forward to leveling up a bit, unlocking new mission types and seeing what else is added over time.

40611577.review:
I have put about 25 hours into this game so far.  I am enjoying it alot.  There are a couple variaties of missions and a couple varities of map types, Lava, lush, crystal, radioactive....  If you have a group of 4 friends to play this game with highly recommend it.  The 4 classes in the game are balanced very well.. there is not a class that is dominate over the others and the abilities meld well together.  You will want to have 1 of each when you are heading into the unknown which makes everyone feel imporatant and usefull.

8/10 - the resource/level progression could use some more work to flush it out and give the game more purpose.  Right now it feels a little grindy and a little short. 40610039.review:
This is one of the first reviews I have ever written but this game deserves it! It has a lot of ups and just a few downs.

Let's start with the downs: Longevity. This, however is something that will surely change during development. Right now you have your standard gameplay loop, a couple of things to upgrade and that's about it.

The positives start with the fact that all of the negatives will surely change over time since the devs have shown they are ready to give this amazing game the love that it needs. 
The in-game "review" system is very extensive and they ask for a lot of feedback and even creative ideas from the community (e.g. ideas for new classes, enemies, game modes, you name it).
Even with just the "small" amount of content that is available right now, this game is a blast. 
The game is at its peak when you play it with a couple of friends and co-operate which eachother. There is a real sense of danger when you are exploring and the game tends to punish you hard if you wander off alone and end up getting everyone killed, but this is something I highly appreciate. 

The game rewards teamwork and there's a big difference between the 4 difficulty settings in the game right now. You need to ease your way up the difficulty slider or you will get sent back to the space rig with just a fraction of your xp and no money whatsoever.

To summarise: It's an amazing game, needs more content, will get more content, worth full price!

oh yeah... NO MICROTRANSACTIONS!!!

11/10 Beards are the most expensive items in the game.

Graphiquement le jeu peut en repousser certain. Ca me fait penser a du astroneer, il faut savoir que le terrain est entierement destructible. Le jeu a sa propre patte graphique et finalement on s'y fait, on le trouve même plutot beau.

Les maps sont générées aléatoirement, explorer une mine menera forcement vers l'inconnu. Et c'est ça qui est bon, découvrir une nouvelle map, explorer une nouvelle mine, y chercher toutes les ressources nécessaire, que ce soit des ressources pour remplir un objectif de mission, ameliorer son equipement ou encore demander un ravitaillement pour refaire le plein de munition.

 Et des munitions vous en aurez besoin car les montres propriétaires des lieux ne vous laisseront pas prendre leur minerais sans réagir. Les mobs vous attaqueront régulierement, vous subirez des vagues d'ennemies, d'ou la référence Left 4 dead. Vous avez la possiblité de choisir le niveau de difficulter, sachant que plus c'est difficile plus vous aurez de bonus en fin de mission.

En solo le jeu est également très sympa car vous serez aider par un petit robot à qui vous pourrez donner des ordres comme miner, attaquer, vous éclairer et le plaisir d'exploration sera toujours présent.

Biensur l'ideal est d'y jouer à 4 potes car il y a 4 classes avec ses propres capacités et qui viennent donc se completer.

Pour moi ce jeu est une très bonne surprise, biensur il y a des choses a améliorer et du contenu a rajouter mais j'en suis sur cela viendra par la suite. 

Aujourd'hui le jeu tel qu'il est pour moi vaut son prix.

40603594.review:
Well done Devs, this is Early Access done right.  Game is well optimised, already contains enough content for many hours of play, you regularly communicate with the playerbase and take/act on feedback given... keep it up.

The game itself is a blast, kind of  a mix of minecraft meets Payday2 meets Starship Troopers... all in hectic 4 player coop.

The precedural gen cave systems are fantastic, you'll find yourself exploring through tight twisting tunnels which then open up to huge expansive caverns or leading to a sudden drop of hundred of feet that you'll have to try and navigate/create a route down (or up).

You can see in places where new content is planned (talking about the orbital mining station here) and the devs are seeking suggestions on new content to add so I have really high hopes for this one.  Normally with early access titles I enjoy whats there and hope more comes, with this I'm seriously confident more will come to turn this into a real gem of a game (pun intended).

If you are on the fence about buying this and you enjoy coop based games.... get off the fence, buy it and get your friends to buy it... you won't regret it.

A playable game with promising framework of coop element. That's all there is to it. 

Once you played the intro stage you bascially played all this game has to offer. You are actually do the same thing as intro stage over and over with little variaty. The game seriously lack of content and gameplay polish needed for coop game like those, this actually reminded me times from Killing Floor 2 which is shit until Tripwire finally pulled their head out of their ass and lift KF2 out of 3 years medicore shitpile last year.


So I'll just put problems I have about this game really quick for your judgement.


 - Very little content to play with, mission/enemy/class lack varity which makes game became mundane past inital stage

 - 'Mining' itself is not that interesting or fun since the game gave player only one way to solve them, that is, right click(dig) until they are done.

 - Classes are pigeon holed into necessary tasks which means if you don't play the game with all four class present you are seriously punished by game and is punished not in a fun way

 - Difficulity came in a form of annoyance than challenge, lack of firepower (gunner), lack of lightning (scout), lack of ammuniation(needs to mine nitro), lack of quick mining capability(driller), lack of navigation tools(engineer/gunner)

 - Various exploit and balance issue(i.e. invincible zipline)


Games like those usually head two direction, either dev managed to update the game in timing manner and build the game to be better and better or failed to do so and left this game in the ocean of forgotten games. It's too early to tell.


Put this game on watchlist, this game have potental to achieve greatness...or just another disappointment.

40599699.review:
Great game. Excellent place in development for early access. Everything that is in works. Great game to play with friends.

[h1] Good stuff: [/h1]
[list]
[*]The game has a sense of progression.
[*]Using your pickaxe to dig into the world seems more of a problem solver than a way to find minerals.
[*]The feeling created when walking into some of the caverns is great.
[*]Lots of fun fighting the monsters.
[*]Evacuations are super fun, probably my favorite part. Always a different escape.
[*]Super fun if you like adventuring and exploring.
[/list]
[h1] Stuff I'd like to see: [/h1]
[i]* I say the following not having read the developer's roadmap.[/i]
[list]
[*]I'd like to see more unlocks like weapons and maybe more abilities mining related or otherwise.
[*]Most minerals are along the walls in the cave systems you explore. Perhaps hiding some ore deeper in the walls. Allowing for miner intution and maybe even some more upgrades.
[*]Maybe different races of monsters. I do like the ones that exist.[*]Allow upgrades to Mule, Bosco, drop pod and supply drop.
[*]Jumpsuit color and pattern customization.[*]Ability to abandon mission, but via means of extraction - for when missions end up too long.
[*]Allow for party generation before mission selection. It's possible a new player doesn't immediatly see how to play with their friend.
[/list]
[h1] Bad stuff: [/h1]
[list]
[*]Needs steam trading cards.
[*]It really needs more people to play.
[*]Sometimes the levels can take longer to play a map than you were expecting due to distributions in the level generation alogrithm.
[*]Can feel shallow if you grind.
[/list]
[h1] For people trying to play with their friends: [/h1]
[list]
[*]When you start it's a little confusing. You have to goto mission selection. Then while clicking a mission you are given the choice to "quickplay", "host" or "join" as most players are lead to "quickplay" via the starting point computer.
[/list]

40599496.review:
Закончились деньги на очередную бочку пива? Тогда давай к нам в компанию Deep Rock Galactic…место, где сбываются мечты и не платят за сверхурочные.

[h1]Не потеряй свой шанс[/h1] посетить самые отдаленные участки галактики, побывать на богом забытом куске астероида, который битком набит драгоценными и не очень рудами. Заскучать тебе не придется, разнообразие сочных биомов и атмосферные пещеры станут твоим вторым домом, а их обитатели устроят теплый прием.
[quote]http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1321207708[/quote]

[h1]Когда же ты познакомишься с местной фауной,[/h1] так еще и познаешь прекрасные мелодии многоствольного пулемета или тонкие мотивы автоматических турелей…все это под вой умирающих ползучих гадов и взрывы случайно брошенных гранат. Ммммм…музыка для ушей.
[quote]http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1321207867[/quote]

[h1]Но давай поговорим о работе конкретнее…[/h1]снаряжение у нас 4-х типов и выдается отдельно, поэтому выбирай осмотрительно…

Инженеру на данный момент кампания предоставляет набор из:
 убойного дробовика для близкого общения с супостатами; мощного гранатомета, прекрасно подходящего для зачистки ограниченных пространств; платформенной пушки, позволяющей создавать опорные точки для подъемов; пара пулеметных авто-турелей для защиты важных точек. Стандартный набор предусматривает гранаты, сигнальные ракеты, кирку и силовую броню.

Разведчик тоже не обижен и получает:
штурмовую винтовку; классически обрез и крюк-кошку, позволяющий залезть куда угодно; помимо этого в комплекте предусмотрена сигнальная пушка, которая выстреливает более мощными сигнальными ракетами; стандартный набор, за исключением  подавляющих гранат, такой же.

И вот мы добрались до бурильщика – веселого парня, который в нужный момент может спасти от окружения или наоборот загнать в такое…итак:
Титановая бурилка – основа твоей жизни и здоровья твоей команды, а когда ее недостаточно – заряд убойной взрывчатки позволит решить многие проблемы; впрочем не отказывайся от огнемета да и пистолет в комплекте полагается. Стандартный набор как у твоих товарищей.

И последний набор шахтера – для стрелка:
Тяжелый пулемет, доказывающий, что пуль мало не бывает; в качестве альтернативы бронебойный пистолет и взрывной аргумент на манер бурильщика; но не забывай про тросовую пушку, позволяющую создавать целые мосты между бездонными обрывами. Стандартный набор как у всех.

Но что-то мы заговорились…думаю тебе интересно, что ты будешь делать? А все просто…берешь снаряжение, полезаешь в капсулу и погружаем тебя поглубже в неизвестное…добудь нужной руды или образцов био-материала…хочешь заработать пару лишних баксов – копай с излишком. 

Только не забывай, что там на глубине тебя ждут…и даже самые мелкие тараканы с удовольствием откусят от тебя кусочек повкуснее.
Но ты не один…или один? А без разницы…

[h1]И что сказать в заключении? [/h1]

Наша кампания развивается и светлое будущее быть может не за горами. На данный момент мы испытываем нехватку снаряжения, ждем новых мест для посещения и некой личной цели для каждого шахтера.
Если верить рейтингу последних обзоров, то оценка 8 из 10. Будем надеяться, что на этом уровне удержимся.

40599111.review:
Here is my review after about 60 hours of gameplay so far...

Deep Rock Galactic is a cooperative mining shooter that takes place in sprawling procedurally generated caves that are filled with precious resources. These are used for vanity unlocks and gear upgrades, as well as to complete the mission. Finding valuable and rare items will give you an insane rush of dopamine I'm not even kidding.

The monsters are a blast to fight especially in large groups. Mind the small ones though. When people say strength in numbers they aren't kidding. They will chew you up and won't spit you out... Stay together as there may be a particular monster lurking on the dark ceiling, waiting for an unsuspecting victim.

The four classes are all fun to play as and I feel that they are balanced nicely. 

The driller can make extracting things like Aquarq, Pearls, Bittergem, Eggs, and Jadiz so much easier, as well as dig into pesky compacted dirt faster than anyone else. Not to mention his trusty flamethrower that is good against groups.

The Scout can get to hard to reach places with his grapple hook as well as produce an insane amount of light with his flare gun

The engineer can support others with his sentry turret and place down platforms which can really work hand in hand with a scout incase the cave wall is too steep to stick to.

The gunner is the tank of the group. His minigun contains tons of ammo and can output an insane amount of DPS on bigger enemies especially. His revolver is kick*** too, and when fully upgraded, its like a mini sniper imo.

The ship that you take your break time on has little purpose as of now, BUT there is a jukebox that you and your fellow dwarves can dance to with a variety of music. There are  barrels to be kicked, and a memorial hall to be visited with goals to be met for show. There are other things coming to the mother ship but as of now those areas are blocked off. I really can't wait to see what the Abyss Bar is gonna be all about!

Anywho. Don't want to spoil everything but thanks for reading!

-Rock and Stone!

40598669.review:
Possibly the most "complete" early access game i've purchased - everything about the game is already great , completely replayable and most of all, fun!  Bring a friend or 3 for some truly great times :)  Spelunk deep into some amazing procedurally generated caverns, dig out any terrain you want as the whole environment is destructible, and bring your itchy trigger finger along for the ride - cos once those insectoids start attacking you're gonna need to use every limited bullet you have :)  

Theres a great progression from the initial finding the bearings, exploring deeper while fighting back occasional waves of creatures, and then the final escape where it can either be a peaceful stroll to the finish line - or all hell breaking loose in the greatest way possible!  The pathfinding on the creatures and the adorable ore depository Molly (I haven't cared so much for a large metal box since my Companion Cube!) is really brilliant - they scale all the walls to get to you and take advantage of any gaps in the scenery to get at you from any angle - if you've made a hole big enough to get through - they will too.

Missions while not massively varied, all play out differently due to the change in environments/biomes and the procedurally generated level designs.  The classes feel very well balanced (except maybe the digger at first but plays better once you upgrade his equipment) and all offer some useful unique skills.  Single player is a bit of a disadvantage as you're limited to just the skills of one dwarf - but its compensated with a combat robot companion which is a nice touch.  But the meat and 'taters of this game is the multiplayer and its fantastic for it.  Can't recommend enough and more than justifies its price.  Its already a fantastic title so can't wait to see what more the next year of early access will add to it.

40598226.review: If you enjoy games like Helldivers, this is a must-buy. The game is tons of fun. Rock and Stone!

40598000.review:
Comme souvent, c'est lorsque l'on n'attend pas spécialement un jeu qu'il nous met bien souvent une claque.
C'est précisément ce qui s'est passé avec celui-ci.

Je n'avais jamais entendu parler de ce projet jusqu'à il y a quelques jours.



Alors pour partir sur de bonnes bases, il est important de savoir dans quoi vous mettez les pieds. 

N'attendez pas un jeu profond plein de poésie qui va vous transporter dans un monde féérique.

On est dans le cas d'un jeu hyper bourrin mais relativement tactique et très bien fini.



En dehors des graphismes un peu particuliers qui ne plairons pas à tout le monde (des triangles des triangles et encore des triangles...) ce jeu est à mes yeux et au moment où j'écris ces quelques lignes une très très belle surprise.





Tout d'abord l'aspect technique :

Aucun lag ou ralentissement. Le jeu tourne à 200fps en permanence sur ma bécane de guerre.

Très peu de chargements également. Les graphismes sont très typés mais ont le mérite d'être singuliers et amusants.

Une vraie personnalité.



La musique a été la grande surprise de ce jeu. Souvent un peu mis de côté dans l'industrie du jeu vidéo ou tout du moins, moins prioritaire comparé à d'autres aspects, la musique de DRG est absolument parfaite. L'ambiance "Alien" haletante est parfaitement adaptée au titre et grâce à elle on retient souvent son souffle lors de vagues de monstre qui vous foncent dessus. Une petite touche année 80 dans les instruments choisis nous rappelle quelques peu également l'ambiance "stranger things" qui étrangement se mêle très bien au côté bourrin du jeu.

Les voix des protagonistes courts sur pattes sont hyper fun. 

Un accent british bien trempé et des phrases humoristique dans la même veine.

On se plait à retrouver des nains dans un contexte tout autre que l'heroic fantasie.



Le gros point fort du jeu est la cooperation des joueurs.

Car il est clair que ce jeu même s'il est jouable en solo, prends tout son sens avec trois potes.

Chacun son rôle et ses caracteristiques specifiques. L'un possede un grapin et des fusées eclairantes. Le second une sulfateuse et des mines, le troisieme la capacité de créer des platemeformes et des tourelles etc...

Bref il est clairement plus facile et fun de jouer a DRG quand on est avec des amis, organisés et capable de gérer la pression. 

Car oui pression il y aura. Quand vous êtes aspiré par une éspece de langue qui vous attire vers le plafond et que vous restez sans défense, vous serez bien content d'avoir créé cette partie avec des gens possédant l'ésprit coop. (Syndrome left 4 dead)



En résumé DRG est un bon défouloir mais il mérite plus que ce simple titre réducteur dans le cas présent. 

Possedant un systeme de niveau et d'amélioration d'équipement en plus de son aspect tactique et coop, il nécessitera plus que simplement dix minutes de jeu avant d'être maitrisé.



Pour terminer, à un peu plus de 22€ et si vous avez des amis avec qui jouer. foncez, vous ne le regrèterez pas.

After 50 hours of playing, I felt I should write a review. I rarely do, but I felt that I should for this game.

If you are like me, and like team play, mining/resource gathering, "left-for-dead" zerg rushes of bugs, this game may be for you.

I initially bought this game for myself and for my 10 year old son, and since 3 of my buddies bought the game, and I have made plenty of friends in game. The fact is, even if you are solo, you can quickly get into an existing party that has room and profit. It's hard to see from the gameplay videos without playing yourself, but there is a certain rush when an alien swarm comes at the worst times, or when you realize that the evac back to the ship will be a hard one because of some complex (and sometimes vertical!) tunnels.

So yes, I would recomend this game for most people who find the game already aluring. After a few missions, and starting to upgrade your dwarves weapons and tools, you will likely start to "want to do just one more mission" !!!

Well worth the 30 dollar price tag. Looking forward to Ghost Ship Games to keep adding to the game!!

40595001.review:
Dwarves

4 player Co-op

Synthwave music

Alien bug swarms

If any of that sparks your interest, then look no further! Deep Rock is a great little co-op game. Its simple, and yet, amazingly fun.  This game doesnt try to be some big, complex game with intricate, detailed systems that you have to learn. Its not an rpg. Its not a moba, or a battle royal. Its not a survival game (unless you could surviving waves of alien bugs). What it IS, however, is fun.

I was gonna post a long review about what this game is about. I realized it was pointless, since what you see in the trailers IS basically what the game is all about. Mining, exploring, fighting bugs, and dwarves being dwarves. That it? Pretty much. Why is that special? Easy answer: Its Fun.

The game is solidly made. No crashes. Very few bugs in its current state. Devs adding new features and functionality with each frequent patch.

PROS

See the list at the top 

Ive had a total blast playing the game so far.

CONS

My only concern is with the progression system. Each item only has 2-3 upgrades for it. After that, there is nothing else to progress towards outside of cosmetic changes. This worries me additionally because if progression stops so soon, then can we really expect the games challenge level to increase beyond a certain point?

I really want the devs to be open and let us know what they have planned for this in the game. Will each of the 4 characters be able to buy and equip different items? IE: multiple types of pick axes? Will there be multiple tiers of upgrades per item, so you dont "cap out" 1 week after playing? Etc etc.

Overall, for 25 bucks, you can easily get multiple hours of fun. If you are looking for a game with a story, or a large open world, or in depth RPG elements, then look elsewhere.

40588600.review:
I'll start off by summarizing most of what this review is gonna say. This game is a fantastic co-op experience, especially with friends at a higher difficulty.

After playing this game online for a few hours with random folks in teams of four, I got a feel for how this game plays and looks. It's great. The art style is fantastic, the level design is super atmospheric, the weapons feel weighty, but not overpowered, and the class design is outstanding. The game feels super polished and well put together, with a rock-solid core gameplay loop, especially considering this is an early access game.

 That said, playing online with random folks in my opinion is not this game's best experience. The majority of online games happen at Hazard 2, the "normal" difficulty, and it's too easy once you're at terms with the game. You mine some rocks, explore a cave, shoot some bugs when there's a swarm, rinse, repeat. When you grow tired and complacent of the game, you start to be bothered by the little details, like how the reload animations are almost all the same.

I grabbed my roommate and an online friend of mine, and we matched with a random scout who was competant and had a microphone and a good sense of humor, and we played hazard 2 for a while and decided to kick up the difficulty. Playing together with a team of each class with microphones on a high difficulty is the game's best experience. Each swarm felt like a threat to our game; in hazard 2 you could leave 2 players to fight the swarm and it was fairly easy, on a higher difficulty when a swarm is announced there's a heart pounding rush to find a good defensive location and find what direction the swarm is approaching from. Your team must stay together, one or two of us could have easily been overtaken by the miniswarms you run into during mining. The classes compliment each other, and using each ability and class' strengths is important (so is bringing along one of each class), such as the scout's slowing grenade coupled with the driller or gunner's satchel charges. Each class feels important and helpful in its own way. Though new players like to tout the scout as the best class because of its independence with a grappel hook and good primary weapons, the scout lacks the staying power in tough battles the other classes bring, as well as the mining ability of the driller and climbing ability of the engineer. At the end of every game was an adrenaline filled adventure to locate the drop pod, or sometimes to drill straight to it, since molly, bless her heart, tended to cheat through supply drop holes to get to the escape pod (please don't change this, its hilarious and adds a good challenge to the end).

Some of the most co-op fun I've had, properly challenging and engaging at high difficulty, a cohesive style and system, and a feel of general polish all make for an outstanding experience.
I'd pay 60 dollars for this game, its a must-have if you like games like left 4 dead.

40588159.review:
I enjoy the game, it's got a lot of potential. However, until they fix the rather toxic kicking system I cannot recommend you buy it. 

Some groups you play with are fine, but I'd say 1 in 3 will either kick you without explanation, or wait until the end (where you've spent up to an hour in the match) and kick you at the last possible moment. What's the point, besides robbing others of fun?

If you're still thinking of buying, a least wait a little longer to see how the developers address the issue.

I wish I hadn't viewed the comments, now I feel the need to answer.

1. None of my friends play the game, if they did it would solve the problem somewhat but alas, it isn't happening.
2. I struggle somewhat with social interactions and the instakicks do affect me. I join a game and I say hello, but if I'm kicked before I can even type that REPEATEDLY, then yes it's a problem and it's not "kinda dumb" to point this out. 
3. Is the game not in early access? I wrote this review with the intention of getting the deeply flawed kick system looked at. One of you mentions many games have this problem. Besides Payday (I've not played it), list them so I can avoid. I've never encountered it before.
4. A simple fix would be to vote on kicks, instead of letting numpty hosts decide on a whim. It's especially aggravating when a) there's a bug that makes you unable to join any games after you're kicked and b) you lose all progress from the game. Not such an issue if you've just joined, but if it's a long game then yeah, it needs addressing.

Also, I'd like to point out that it's ok to disagree with my review, but please be civil about it. Being a dick helps no-one.

40586472.review:
Hi Zusammen!

Ich besitze "Deep Rock Galactic" erst seit 2 oder 3 Tagen. Das Spiel war eher ein Spontankauf, weil "Gamestar" es empfohlen hat. Ich bin schon sehr überzeugt von dem Spiel, es hält, was die Entwickler in den Trailern und Beschreibungen versprechen. Es läuft sehr flüssig und bis auf ein Paar kleinere Bugs, kann ich wenig über das Spielgeschehen meckern. Einige direkte Vergleiche zu anderen Spielen in den Reviews sind totaler Humbug. Wenn ich es vergleichen müsste, würde ich sagen, dass es mehr zu Payday und diversen Mining-Spielen passt. Ich frage mich, wieso manche es mit L4D vergleichen? Das ist wie Schuhe mit Handys zu vergleichen.


[i]Kurze Ansätze zum Spielgeschehen. Wer alles auf eigene Faust Herausfinden, bzw. Erkunden will, sollte den Spoiler nicht öffnen.[/i]
[spoiler]Die Klassen: Den Späher, den Bohrer, den Gunner und den Ingenieur. (Bisher jedenfalls). Jede Klasse hat ihre eigenen Fähigkeiten. 

*Der Gunner: Mit Granaten, C4 und einer Enterhaken-Gun für die ganze Familie.
*Der Späher: Kommt sehr gut und leicht an schwer zugängliche Erze oder anderes Material. Er besitzt auch Stun-Granaten.
*Der Bohrer: Gräbt sich mit Leichtigkeit durch Wände und Böden. Er hat ebenfalls C4 und eine richtig gute Spitzhacke.
*Der Ingenieur: Mit Automatikgeschützen und eine art "Plattform-Gun". Ebenfalls Unterstützer.


Zum Geschehen:

Kurz und Knapp gesagt: Du schlachtest einen Planeten aus und nutzt die gefundenen Ressourcen dafür, diese besagten Planeten schneller und effektiver auszuschlachten. (Deswegen Payday). Ab und an wird man von kleineren oder größeren Wellen attackiert. Natürlich von mutierten Ekel-Zecken. Da dies alles mit Style passieren kann, kannst du dir natürlich noch diverse Accessoires kaufen. Wobei ich sagen muss, dass aktuell noch relativ wenige zum Verkauf stehen. Ach ja, schöner machen sie dich auch nicht wirklich...[/spoiler]


Ich halte mich jetzt kurz:

+Sofern das Genre passt, wird es dich garantiert in den Ban ziehen. 
+Du kannst es sehr gut Solo-, als auch Multiplayer spielen. 
+Keine Lags, sehr gute Performance (von den FPS her) (Mit Highend Laptop)
+Viele verschiedene Biome, Schwierigkeitsgrade für Jedermann - vom Sitzpisser bis Stehkacker, alles dabei.
+Enormer Spaß mit Freunden. 
+Richtig viele Sprachen vorhanden. 
+Stündlich neue Missionen. 
+Upgrades für alle Charaktere.
+Mit den richtigen Leuten, enorm hoher Wiederspielwert.
+Sollte einer nach der Mission rauchen müssen, kann man in der "Lobby" einfach Tanzen und Musik hören, oder einfach total unnötig Fässer durch die Gegend treten.

NEUTRALITÄT spare ich mir jetzt mal.

-Es gibt keine Weiblichen Zwerge. Was mir eig. egal ist, aber für das weibliche Geschlecht sicher ein negativer Aspekt ist.
-Accessoire sind sehr wenige vorhanden. Eigentlich nur Bärte und Rüstungen.
-Nicht zu vergessen, es ist ein EarlyA-Game. Was grundsätzlich nichts schlechtes ist, aber wir wissen ja wie es laufen kann.
-Für Die, die es nicht wissen, u/o übersehen haben: Auf "Taste 5" kannst du (sofern 80 Nitra vorhanden ist) Ammo anfordern.



Noch eine Sache:

Das Spiel ist eines meiner Lieblings "Zocken-Mit-Freunden-Spiele" geworden, wenn ihr versteht was ich meine. Für mich hat es einen enorm hohen Suchtfaktor und Wiederspielwert. Das wichtigste ist, die Entwickler Pflegen das Spiel. Ich würde es einfach mal ausprobieren. Schau es dir Eine bis Anderthalb Stunden an, ansonsten einfach refund.

Absolut empfehlenswert!


Ciao.

40583309.review:
I will recount my first couple hours in game.

1. Spawn in tutorial mission.
2. Press F to throw flare, be amazed at ability to throw flare for some reason.
3. Wander around smashing rocks and pumping aliens full of lead.
4. Extract.
5. Wait for friend to finish downloading game.
6. While waiting, kick barrels into launch bay and get yelled at by your boss.
7. Continue your mischievous streak and knock all barrels into launch bay.
8. Repeat #6
9. Launch mission with friend and commence crazy dwarf space fun.
10. Repeat #3 but this time with friends. 

I've been disappointed time and time again by Early Access games, but Deep Rock Gaming seems to be a pretty complete game compared to most of Early Access. With that being said-- I believe there is still alot of growth to be had, but the fundamental gameplay is there, and it's so fun!

A dwarf in space smashing Alien skulls while collecting enough minerals to woo the dwarf lady of your dreams while sucking so much time away from your real life you'll let down everyone you know and love if you haven't done so already!

10/10 would kick barrels into launch bay again.

40581988.review:
Deep Rock Galactic is a FPS online co-op mining game set in a Sci-Fi environment with aliens roaming around and mining to be done. It is developed by Ghost Ship Games and published by the same people who have published games like Goat Simulator. This game is pretty amazing and I am going to explain why!

[h1]Graphics[/h1]
The graphics are low-poly and are simple, but wonderful, to look at. The game is also very well optimised, especially for a game in Early Access. In most Early Access games at this time, the game would run at around 30-40fps with some stuttering but surprisingly, this is the first ever EA game I’ve seen that is fully optimised that isn’t even near completion in Early Access. Not many developers prioritise optimisation first in an Early Access game, even Bohemia which is a big company, but I think the developers have made a good decision in making optimisation top priority. You will not be disappointed with the performance!!

[h1]Gameplay[/h1]
When you launch the game, you’re in your own little base. You have 2 terminals. One is quick join and one is tutorial / solo. If you do quick join, you are given options. Difficulty/Objective/Map. After choosing these 3, you are then put into matchmaking to look for a match that has all of the things you chose. Once connected to their match, you are given 4 classes. Gunner, Engineer, Scout, Driller. All classes gain 3 grenades, 3 recharging flares and a pickaxe (which can be used by right clicking). G is for grenade, F is for flares. 

The gunner has; a gatling gun, a heavy pistol, a zip-line gun (accessible for the entire team) and C4. The engineer has; a combat shotgun with a long range, a grenade launcher with 4 grenades, a gun which when it hits impact it dispenses a platform and 2 sentry turrets. The turrets can be recalled from a distance and reloaded. When recalled, all ammo in the turret returns to your inventory.The scout has; a grappling hook, a flare gun, an AR and a sawed-off shotgun. The Driller has; drilling arms, a flame thrower, an RPG, and C4. All classes can also be upgraded and ranked up by using credits you earn on missions. The more minerals you collect (even if you get all of your objective) will count towards your credit. 

All consumables (e.g Grenades, ammo) can be restocked by mining nitra in the caves or / and ordering a resupply drop from mission control. Any rare minerals you collect can also be deposited into a mobile MULE robot which walks on walls, floors or ceilings to get to the person who requests it. For example, if you’re in mining exploration and you have a lot of minerals that you need to complete the mission, to make the minerals you collected count towards the objective, you need to deposit it into the MULE. It can also be relocated on the command of yourself and your teammates. Once you gain all of your objectives, you will have an option to call a drop pod on the MULE. 

The drop pod will dispense randomly in an open area anywhere from 50m - 200m. You will then have to rush there as you only have 5 minutes to get to it before it leaves. With or without you. 

[h1]How much Content does this game provide?[/h1]
Now let’s see. Deep Rock Galactic offers hours of content. One mission can even take up 15-30 minutes on the easiest difficulty. Let alone the challenging difficulty. I’ve played around 3 hours of gameplay during the time of this review and I’ve only done 3 missions (all on easiest difficulty). This game will keep you busy for hours and with friends, days. I recommend getting a friend to buy this as it can provide hours of fun content.

[h1]Overall[/h1]
I personally enjoy this game and find it fun. The community is nice depending on who you play with. My first few games, the other players were really nice and understanding that this is a new experience to me as I play mainly FPS tactical shooters like Rainbow Six Siege so this is a foreign game to me. It may get repetitive if you play it a lot so it is recommended to play every now and then and not on a daily basis. Each mission has an objective or two as well as difficulty settings that give you a bonus. Playing this without friends is still possible but wont be as much of an enjoyable experience. 

The only thing I’m not liking the sound of is a system where the host can boot whoever he or she wants. They could be a complete cow and decide to kick you right at the end to keep all credits to themselves. It is not a good idea.

Thank you for reading and I completely recommend this game!

Good game! Just not reaching its highest potential.
Meh. Not my type of game.
Requires major improvement.

40580250.review:
ドワーフのおっさんが危険な鉱山へ赴き、鉱石を採掘し、モンスターの猛襲を切り抜け、目標をクリアして、無事に鉱山から脱出できればミッション達成！

とりあえずTrailerを観れば、イメージは大体わかります。


[h1]好きな所[/h1]
[b]・爽快感と収集の楽しさ[/b]
戦闘は面倒なことが少なく、戦いやすい。
敵が多くて鬱陶しい事はあるものの、全体的にサクサク倒せる。
鉱脈を掘ってザクザク鉱石が出てくるのも気持ちいい。

[b]・ロールの役割がはっきりしている[/b]
特徴的な4つのロールそれぞれに得手不得手があり、それによって攻略が楽だったり大変だったりする。
チームでロールがダブっても、二人いた方が意外と便利だったり、逆に痒いところに手が届かなかったり、具合が違って面白い。

[b]・英語が判らなくても割と遊べる[/b]
言語コミュニケーションがなくても大体なんとかなります。
ミッションも「○○を必要数集めろ」が主なので、やることが判らない事もあまりない。（固有名詞は覚えないといけないけど）


[h1]苦手な所[/h1]

[b]・ソロモードの難易度[/b]
CO-OPメインだから仕方ないとはいえ、ソロモードは苛烈を極める。
モンスターの襲撃は一人で捌くには多すぎるので、力尽きる危険性がかなり高いのに、復活回数が決まっている。

弾薬数もそのままなので、すぐ弾切れ。でも補給を呼ぶためのNitra要求数もそのままなので、大体集まってない。（しかし補給物資は全部独り占めできる）

そして最凶最悪のトラップモンスター（HL2のバーナクルみたく、天井に張り付いた本体から触手を伸ばし、プレイヤーを捕まえてくる）はソロの大敵。サポートしてくれるドローンは何故かコイツに攻撃してくれない。だから捕まったら最後、確実に1回力尽きる。
一応、触手が伸びてくるのが見えるので、常に上に気を付けていれば避けられなくはない。ただしフラッシュ数の少なさもあって常に周囲が暗いので、結構ひっかかる。特に高い位置にいると見えにくい。

[b]・置いてけぼりになると悲惨[/b]
ソロモードが辛いということは、CO-OPでも孤立したら辛い。
しかしこのゲーム、上下の高低差が激しいマップが存在していて、なおかつ移動に関する能力に差がある（つまり機動力に差がある）ため、置いていかれると道に迷う可能性が高くなる。

[b]・全体的に暗い[/b]
鉱山内なんだから暗くて当然だし、フラッシュを投げれば明るくなるのでゲームシステム的にはさほど問題はない。
ただし、フラッシュのチャージ時間は意外と長いので、一人で見て回るとすぐに暗い場所をうろつくはめになる。
マップのランダム生成もあるので、とにかく道に迷わないように注意が必要。


[h1]初心者向けアドバイス[/h1]

[b]・埋まっているレア鉱石[/b]
たまーに壁や地面に緑色の欠片が散らばってたり、灰色の丸い粒が埋まっている部分があったりする。
ここを掘ると中からレア鉱石が出土する。装備などの素材として結構大量に要求されるので、積極的に収集しましょう。

[b]・一人にならないように[/b]
ここまで散々ソロが辛いと書いたように、とにかく一人になると戦闘も探索も辛くなります。
力尽きると味方の助けがないと復活できないので、何もできない時間が長くなります。
特に一人でうろついていた時にあの天井から触手を伸ばしてくる敵にやられると、助けに来た味方が気付かずに餌食となり、また助けに来た味方が…　という具合に、連鎖的全滅も有り得る。

[b]・弾切れ注意[/b]
補給を呼べるシステムがあるからか、わりと簡単に弾切れを起こします。
弾薬がその辺に落ちていたり、敵からドロップしたり、味方に弾薬を補給できる能力もないので、弾切れを起こしたら補給を要請する以外に手段はありません。
ツルハシが近接武器扱いなものの、ツルハシの数発程度では倒れない大型モンスターや、ツルハシが届かない遠距離から攻撃してくる敵も頻繁に出てくるのであまりあてにはなりません。
ちなみに、補給を要請するにはNitraという赤い鉱石が必要なので、見つけたら回収しましょう。

40579225.review:
A one trick pony that has very little to offer outside of a very basic game loop. If you run a single mission you will have seen everything this game has to offer at this point, outside of how the different classes play. There are very few things to upgrade or purchase at the moment and the crafting materials you need to do so are dolled out very sparingly. There is a good foundation here for a fun co-op game, but it needs a lot of work to get there. 

I can see why the devs have said they plan to be in early access for a year to two years - there's just not a whole lot here right now. I feel that in my less than 10 hours of game time so far I have seen a lot of the same old in terms of map generation. The random generation is more akin to Warframe's tile system, and while superficially one mission might feel a bit different than the next, overall there's nowhere near as much diversity in map design as you might expect. I feel like eventually DRG might be worth a purchase, but right now it's a rather barebones experience.

40578358.review:
Do you like dwarves? Me gusta.
Do you like digging? Me gusta.
Do you like strategically creating a firing line of turrets and teammates, holding the high ground and facing down a hungry alien swarm? Me gusta.
This game is very playable in its early access state and can only get better with our support.
There's a good mix of toolsets for the 4 jobs you can play as.
Teamwork (and communication) is recommended. The toolsets work together.
Resource management (ammo, tool uses) is a part of this game.
There's plenty of customization and upgrades to purchase to keep you playing for a long time.

Some Tips:
Play lower hazard missions first and upgrade your kit(s).
Nitra. Get it. Hoard it. There is only so much in each level.
Do NOT pick up ammo resupply unless you have used a good amount of your toolkit, grenades, etc.
Scouts grappling hook recharges, but not while it's grappling. Hook also works both ways, so you can get down from high places without taking fall damage by shooting the floor.
When fending off swarms, you and your teammates take different flanks and find a high spot with good view of the surrounding walls and ceilings. Don't dig into a narrow space because the big toxic bugs will come in there, die, and leave nasty toxic fumes on top of you.
Sometimes the M.U.L.E. will take a detour through a tunnel left by a ressuply drop. This is an inevitable annoyance.
Look carefully as you go through a cavern. Plan your escape route. You will have to run back through here to extract. Set up ziplines, cut some stairs, turn around and look at the way you just came in to recognize where that passage is because you will have to make your way back through it. As you move through areas with deep holes, place platforms if you're an engineer to keep your team from falling on the trip to extraction.
As a scout, use a flare to light up an area during a swarm attack. LET THERE BE LIGHT!
Gunners, you see those minerals lined up in the sheer wall? Shoot a zipline to that wall. Ride it, cut a ledge with your pickaxe, then expand that ledge outward to grab those minerals easily. Or tell the Driller to go ride your zipline and get it done. You're the guy with the biggest gun, so you're the boss! It's not a gun unless it weighs at least 100 pounds!

40577519.review:
Deep Rock Galactic - Man, dieses Game hatte mich schon bei "DANGER! DARKNESS! DWARFS!". Dennoch hat mich der Preis etwas abgeschreckt, die 20€ Grenze zu überschreiten ist immer so ne Sache. 
Zum Spiel an sich:
Als Mitglied eines zwergischen Bergbauteams begibt man sich in teamorientierten Missionen tief in die Höhlen eines Planeten, der für seine wertvollen Mineralien sowie für seine überaus RIESIGE Menge an widerwärtigen Aliens bekannt ist. Das Wort "teamorientiert" ist hier zu beachten, denn auch wenn es einen Solo-Modus gibt, erlebt man damit nicht mal die Hälfte des Spielspaßes, den man im Team haben kann.
Jede der bisher 4 spielbaren Klassen hat ihre Daseinsberechtigung und ergänzt sich mehr oder weniger gut mit den anderen Klassen. Im Team heißt es dann Höhlen zu erkunden, neue Wege zu finden, Mineralien abzubauen und sich den massiven Angriffswellen der Aliens zu erwehren. 

Selten ist mein Puls so in die Höhe geschossen, wie in diesem Spiel. Wenn einem noch EIN Mineral fehlt, um endlich den Drop Pod rufen zu können und zu verschwinden, man es aber einfach nicht findet...die Gegnerwellen derweil immer häufiger und heftiger kommen...die Munition allmählich zur Neige geht...und der Ruf des Kumpels im Headset hallt "ICH HAB ES!"! Sehr gutes Spielgefühl!

negative Kritik: 
- Für den Inhalt noch zu teuer, 15-20€ hätten es auch getan. Aber wer weiß, vielleicht werden die Entwickler so schneller fertig ;)
- übermäßiges Kicken/Gekicktwerden, da der Host alleine entscheiden kann, wer fliegt
- man sollte mindestens einen Freund zum Mitzocken überreden, sonst verpasst man eine Menge
- Solo-Modus zu knackig


Unterm Strich gebe ich eine Kaufempfehlung ab, wenn ihr jemanden zum Mitzocken habt. Falls ihr eher solo unterwegs sein wollt, dann kauft es nur, falls ihr zufällig zu Durins Volk gehört und eine irre Liebe zum Bergbau besitzt.

40577255.review:
I've played 20hrs of this game so far and to be honest it is probably the best early access game I've ever bought. Even if the devs stopped improving it tomorrow I would still be keen to play the game as it is. It's a bit repetitive but it's challenging and feels rewarding after every match. Never been kicked from a team once and almost every time the team has had mics and we talk to complete our missions.
