Honestly for an Early Acess I am impressed. A brand new studio gave us this game and honestly you are in for a treat. If you are looking for a COOP experience, I must say it's one of the best out there. The Music, sounds and voice acting are very well done it gets you in the game. I would say buy it, play 2 hours and if you don't like it just refund it. But Honestly I tried that I didint stop at 2 hours, and I ain't refunding it.




-- [h1] More Info: [/h1] --

[h1] Good features: [/h1]
The Coop mecanic is very well done in my opinion, they are four different classes. 

-The Gunner, the Dwarf with a tough attitude. He bring into the mines he's minigun that is excelente taking most bugs and with a great crowd control. He also takes with him a pistol that can aim from great distance very useful taking about range enemies. He brings as well a Zipline gun, that can get the whole squad out of a horrible situation.

-The Scout, the Dwarf with the trusty shotgun. He also has a nice assault rifle to handle some crowd control. Not as good as the gunner but it gets the job does most of the time. He Has he's own grappling Gun, with it he can get almost anywhere. But careful falling is the scout greatest strength and weakness.

-The Engineer, The Dwarf with the Grenade launcher. With it he will take out massive groups of bugs merging on your position. He also has an automatic Shotgun that can does great damage from close range. Without the Engineer's Turrets the swarm attacks would be very dangerous. Thanks to it exploring the mines is manageable. And Thanks to he's platform gun that shoots platform he can be the solution of getting minerals that are very high above quite easily.

-The Driller, The Dwarf that most people say is useless. Trust me when I say that the Driller can save the whole squad often. He is equipped with two big drills, with it he can big up hidden minerals quite easily and make tunnels very rapidity. This is quite useful when the drop pod is on the other side of a wall and the only way out is to dig. The Driller also brought a Flamethrower that is very handy against large mods of bugs and very small bugs that attack in numbers.

Depending on your taste you will take one of these Dwarfs and explore the deep mines with your brothers. 

[h1] Missions [/h1]

There is few different missions that you can take. With four different difficulty. 
Named Hazard 1, 2, 3 or 4. 

1-2 Is quite easy no challenge there. I recommand it to level up your character and boost your weapons.

3 is very easy with a good team but can be the death of you in a matter a secondes.

4 Is a nightmare most of the time. Other difficulties you will hang around even when the mission is done but on 4 you get out of fast as possible.

[h1] Features that needs to be improved [/h1]

-Some other review mentioned that the kick systhem can be horrible. and honestly they are right. I sometimes joined up a game, greeted them with a friendly message. Fought with them, mined with them just to be kick when they felt like it. A lot of great ideas have been proposed and the devs replied to it saying they will fix it very soon.  [b] The Devs fixed that Feature that was sometimes annoying. [/b]

-The M.U.L.E is your trusty bot carrying the minerals for you. It follows you in your missions and without it missions would be impossible. When the Drop Pod gets called and the Epic music starts. The M.U.L.E will go straight to the Drop Pod leading you they way putting lights behind him after every steps. Which is great honestly. But sometimes the Mule just goes straight trew a wall and you have no other option than mine straight to the Drop Pod. It's a minor bug but it also adds another problem. The Surprise attack bugs, since the path finding is not that great like I said with the M.U.LE. It is the same with bugs sometimes, you are mining enjoying your Dwarf life and out of nowhere explosive bugs just crawls out of no where to blow up in your face. I don't mind that bugs can dig and surprise attack dwarf sure. But at least add a sound so the bugs can be heard when they are inside walls.

[i] Some comments suggested I add more information on my review, I wrote some additional stuff for you to get a better idea. Feel free to tell me if you want more information on a certain point. Hope I get to see you in the mines ! [/i]

40575631.review:
Daumen hoch für dieses geniale Spiel.
Habe das Spiel mit ein paar Freunden gespielt und muss sagen das Spiel hat wirklich Potenzial.
Vorweg am Anfang scheint einem das Spiel sehr schwierig und unbezwingbar, jedoch mit wachsender Erfahrung und Einstellung der Spielschwierigkeit auf einfach (Tourist) macht es eine menge Laune. Natürlich wird das Spiel einfacher je mehr Freunde man hat, um zusammen Missionen zu bestreiten, aber nichts desto trotz hat das Deep Rock Galactic viel Potenzial. Es besteht darin Ressourcen abzubauen und mit den unterschiedlichen Klassen (4 Klassen bereits vorhanden) Missionen abzuschließen bzw. zu meistern.

Zum Spiel:
Man startet zu beginn Misssionen auf einer Karte wo alle Teammitglieder oder Singleplayer anfangen Ressourcen abzubauen. Zwischendurch kommen immer wieder Wellen von Feinden die besiegt werden müssen. Wenn man alle Ressourcen gesammlt hat geht es darum, innerhalb vorgegebner Zeit, die Expedition zu verlassen.
Spielspaß und aufregende Momente garantiert.

Prositiv:
+Spielspaß mit Freunden
+Abwechslung zwischen Sammeln und Kämpfen
+gute Zusammenarbeit wird belohnt
+für ein mini Game gute Grafik (Lichter, Schatten, Umgebung)
+immer wieder für kurze lustige Schockmomente zu haben
+Preis/Leistung ok
+Umgebung ist komplett zerstörbar (also aufpassen was zerstört werden soll und was nicht)

Negativ:
-zu Beginn scheinbar unbezwingbare Npcs, wenn nicht genügend Erfahrung mit der Klasse besteht
-zu wenig Tutorials um in das Spiel hereinzukommen
-Singleplayer schwierig aber nicht unmöglich
-nach ein paar Spielstunden erscheint das Erreichen von Upgrades sehr teuer

Fazit:
Wer auf einne Misschung von Mincraft und FP-Shooter in einem actionreichem Mehrspieler Co-Op mit Freunden steht, wird hier nicht enttäuscht und erhält für den Early Access jede Menge Spielspaß. Für mich Daumen hoch und freue mich auf zukünftige Updates, sowie bereits angekündigte neue Klassen im Spiel.

40570633.review:
It's a good game (wouldn't call it fantastic), sort of left4dead but with mining (there is no building, just upgrading your gear and unlocking cosmetic items like hats, armor, and beards with the minerals that you mine).

Missions have a certain objective: either collect X of a certain mineral, collect X number of eggs (which is very similar to collecting minerals), or kill X number of bosses.

World is procedurally generated and consists of either long tunnels or large caverns. While you can dig everywhere and destroy any wall or obstacle (except your ship or robot buddy), more often than not digging straight through walls leads you nowhere (instead, there are "dirt walls" which mark the location of a wall that will lead you to another tunnel or cavern).

Throughout the mission you'll encounter a few hazards (geysers, toxic crystals/plants, pitfalls, etc.) and a few straggler bug-like aliens that attack you on sight. At seemingly random points in a mission you'll be alerted that a swarm is coming and you'll get attacked by a large number of these bug-like aliens.

After you're done with your mission, you will request evac, a drill-like vehicle will appear somewhat far from you, and you have to get there while swarms of aliens spawn near you before time runs out (at which point if at least one dwarf makes it, you complete the mission, otherwise, you fail).

There are 4 classes, which all have unique gear, and in theory function, although they are all capable on standing in their own.

Although the game supports solo play by scaling in difficulty with the more players in a game and giving you a robot companion in solo play (which shoots at enemies and revives you thrice, unless it bugs out and decides not to) I would strongly recommend playing it multiplayer.

The game is well polished and runs smoothly. It could use a bit more variety on the monsters, and I would love to see more classes as well (or maybe have gear options for the classes?).

At any rate, I do think it's worth the price.

40566727.review:
I rarely write reviews, a game has to either be an absolute gem or a complete disaster for me to take the time to write one,  in this case I am pleased to say this is an absolute gem no question about it.

Visuals 9/10 - Graphically it has its own charm which remains consistent and lends to the immersion just wish the ability to see your teams health bars were a permanent fixture on the hud as well as making it easier to find your teammates when you get turned around or seperated.

Sound 9/10 - The music and sound effects are spot on and really seem to kick into high gear when things get intense, the only reason its a 9/10 for me is ive encountered a bug on two occasions where recieving an audio notification on discord disabled the sound for the game until I relaunch it.
 
Gameplay 10/10 - This game is really addicting, missions last usually between 25-60 minutes sometimes longer and its just a really fleshed out cooperative experience, I havent tried to play solo so this is purely from a duo-4player coop perspective

Replay Value 9/10 - I just keep coming back for more, the upgrade system is robust enough to proivde imho 20-30 hours of play per class if you include cosmetic upgrades, it has enough variety within the procedural world they have created to keep it interesting though they could use to add more enemy types and color variations and biomes etc... but it is great for early access based on  what they already have on the table.

Value 12/10 - Best 24$ ive spent this year seriously ive spent way more for way less.

Overall 9/10 - I just cant recomend this game enough if you have friends, but I went in with just one buddy and found new friends easily enough on the official discord which has a direct link on the games main launch page.

Thanks for the pixels,
Machkezhno

40564774.review:
Deep Rock Galactic is a fun and pretty unique game where you can go mining as a dwarf.

Even in it's current state it is pretty good, the future looks pretty bright too. 

The graphics aren't realistic but they're not trying to be, instead they go for a simple yet pretty damn beautiful art style of solid colours and low poly looking stuff.

The gameplay is fun, you go in to a place to mine either alone or with others (more on that later) with a set objective. 
So for example you need to get 200 of a specific mineral and a bonus objective of finding 10 flowers. 
You look through the cave system which is pitch black, you need to light it up with flares, you're hacking away at the terrain to reach specific areas (or getting there using the class-specific gadgets) while also trying not to get killed by the aliens which inhabit the world you're mining on. 

Your reward for completing the tasks is money and any crafting materials you found in the mission which are used to make upgrades for your weapons, armour and vanity items.
You also get XP for your class level and player level.

Right now there's 4 classes which is cool, they all have different pros and cons. Some are better at getting around the environment where others are better at killing the aliens.


Playing this with people you know is great, playing solo isn't terrible but playing with randoms can be terrible.
However this isn't an issue with the game, it is an issue with humanity. 
Games like Borderlands and Payday have the same problem, people quit, people kick, people do the wrong thing on purpose.

If you have no friends and no social skills to make friends, perhaps think twice about getting the game but if you and your  buddies are after a fun co-op game consider Deep Rock Galactic as it is pretty nice, my dude.

The only negatives I can think of are that the game is in early access meaning the game isn't 100% polished, there could be a bit more content but there is plenty enough to have fun with the game right now. 
The core game is good meaning so long as the devs aren't stupid the game will only get better over the next year or so.

I'm feeling a 7.5/10 for this game right now.

Strongly recommend.

40559345.review:
This is a very polished early access title that already has a good amount of content, even though it does get a bit long in the tooth eventually. Love the atmosphere, the guns feel satisfying, movement feels just right, and the classes have a good variety of equipment and capabilities. The only drawbacks are the price, and it's not really clear how much the devs are going to add until the full release.

Still giving it a thumbs up however. It's great fun and has a good mix of tense combat, exploration, and gathering loot.


UPDATE 2: I initially gave this a thumbs up, then a thumbs down due to troll-kicking right before the end of a mission, as well as MP connection bugs. Within a week, the developers implemented what I think is a fairly good solution to the kick issue: Troll hosts can still kick people, but they at least get to keep whatever they contributed to the loot AND once the droppod is called there's no kicking anymore. Also, the MP connection errors seem to be fixed as well, had several good games with no issues.

As a result, I'm changing this back to a THUMBS UP, in particular because of the speed and reactivity of the developers. Keep up the good work!

40558850.review:
Update: Kick feature has been worked to be more forgiving and less abusive. That being said that addresses one of the two major issues I had with the game. The second being for its $25 dollar price tag, I can't recommend the game. 

First off, I understand fully that it is an Early Access.... okay so? Subnatuica Early Access adjusted its price multiple times, I paid $15 dollars when it first came to light and it actually FELT like it held the content and potential, I would even say each time it changed it price it STILL felt like it earned its value.. The Forest, was $15 dollars and I could see how it can be expanded upon and it felt it was worth its price. But for $25 dollars what you get is 4 classes, 1 of them literally has nothing unique going for it other than it saves you time digging. All the other classes feel useful and like you need them in order to fully function effectively. With that out of the way here is where the big issue lies. Every map feels the same. Yeah okay. I get it they are 'randomly' made so no two should be the same but they all FEEL the same. Most of the game types aren't fun, I only found two of them really fun and one of them is like a mini base you defend and turn supplies into. 

With all of that out of the way, again the game IS fun. Just not $25 dollars fun and I can easily recommend many other 4 person coop games with a lot more depth and content for the same price. I will say this though, this game offers a very unique idea and I really hope they hone in on it further and make it feel less like a No Mans Sky sense of randomness because even though it offers randomly designed maps, they really all feel the same with just different skins on them.

-Original Review-
Game is pretty overall fun. 

There are a few issues I have with the price being $25 dollars though, I think at most it's a $15 dollar game as it stands. 
My negative review is solely... and I mean solely on the fact that if you aren't planning on hosting your own game or having your personal friend hosting a game you most likely will be feeling kick abuse.... a lot. 

One of the forum moderators has made it pretty clear they have no intentions in using a majority vote system for kick and intend to always leave host in charge of instantly kicking people. This results in heavy abuse. You just spent somewhere between 5 and 40 mins on a mission and are at the extraction? To bad. Host didn't like you for whatever reason and kicked you from the game meaning you earn nothing at all. Not playing a class the host wants you to play? Too bad, you will most likely get kicked. 

Until this system is reworked to match most successful 4 person coop games like L4D, Vermintide, Gears of Wear, Borderlands, Gauntlet, etc etc where a majority vote is needed to remove people this game will always have its kick feature abused by trolls.

Other than that, it is a fun game. Classes are fun, Driller class feels a bit underwhelming and doesnt bring anything much to the table and a lot of people agree but if you voice anything slightly negative on the forum the moderator I talked about will come in and basically tell you you are playing the game wrong. (Nothing wrong, he has a right to take pride and support his game but constantly defending every little complaint made about the game makes people feel like you can't talk bad about the game or you will be banned from the forum - Hasn't happened simply just feels that way)


I'd only be willing to change my review to postive if Kick feature is reworked and game is either cheaper or have a lot more content added to justify a $25 dollar game. (To give you an idea for $5 dollars more you can get Vermintide 2 a VASTLY better game in terms of content, level design, characters, classes, weapons etc etc so why is this game so much for a few different themed maps that all start meshing together in how it feels overall and a few different types of objectives....)

@Soren - Captain of Ghost Ship
I am alittle more relieved that it is being looked into.
I dont think compensation would work because if my friend and I run duos and one of us gets down and then the other is getting swarmed, I can kick him to ensure he still gets stuff. So I dont see that working that well.

Better communication, I don't know what that is suppose to entail.

Lock down vote kicking after drop pod is called would make people call drop pod the second it comes down more which can be pretty annoying. If you make it so more than 1 person has to do it, that would still make the host panic and kick people or simply still troll.

Private servers things would be a better solution cause a lot of the kicks are issues with people trying to have private servers.

Vote-kicking would be your best bet. Yeah, joiners can become trolls but it is RARE. From my Xbox years on Gears of War horde, Borderlands 1 and 2, Left 4 Dead 1 and 2, Gauntlet games and my PC years of those along with Vermintide 1 and 2 and a few other 4 person coop games I probably have well over 5,000 hours (this is a low ball number) and have come across trolls like that VERY seldom. And you know what can be made to fix that? A report system. If two people want to troll a game together, they are going to do it more than once. Multiple reports for the same thing you can just ban them put add an 'avoid player' feature making it harder for them to get matched up into games if more than 1 person is avoiding them.

Although this still isn't discussing why the game is $25 dollars with far less content than other games of this nature, I would be more willing to change my review to not reflect how much of an issue the kick system currently is.
40558850.developer_response:
Hi,

Thanks for the review.

I'm sorry to hear about your experience with getting kicked. Getting kicked is never fun, but some kind of kick-feature is needed here. We have seen an uptick on kick-abuse happening and we will take action today. Any suggestions on how to solve this issue are very welcome.

We consider things like: 
a) compensation for getting kicked based on time spent (so you get xp, credits, etc)
b) better communication when kicking and getting kicked
c) lock-down late-join and kicking when the in the final extration phase (drop pod is called)
d) easier to setup private servers
e) vote-kicking (can backfire -> joiners becomes the trolls) 

We hope to implement solutions today or tomorrow. And push a new patch asap. We will keep iterating on this and listen to the feedback from you.

40557657.review:
Absolutely loving this game so far.

Deep Rock Galactic feels like a combination of the best elements pulled from titles like Minecraft, Left 4 Dead and No Man's Sky. The core gameplay is fun and interesting, exploring the cave systems and finding the resources you need to mine and collect while avoiding getting jumped on by all the different creatures can be really tense and challenging on the harder difficulties. 

The biomes are varied and they all look really nice. The colours and shapes of the areas available are so damn good just to look at. When you walk through a small tunnel and find a massive opening, it's a real "woah" moment. I also like some of the small things like the plants that you can use as elevators.

Gameplay is suprisingly solid for an Early Access game. All the core mechanics are well made, shooting most of the weapons feel like they actually pack a decent punch. The enemies and your M.U.L.E. have some very nice pathing to them, however I have witnessed the M.U.L.E. walking straight through walls on multiple occasions. This can be a bit of a pain when you're following him to the extraction point. A lot of focus is put into lighting. Caves are dark, so you need to make sure you're using flares effectively to find what you need. Used flares are still useful when they fizz out, as they can easily remind you where you have been. 

The multiple classes are diverse and interesting with their kits, but some feel a tad more useful than others. The scout seems to be the most important, thanks to his ability to light up large, tall caverns. Upgrade trees are nice in their current state, but hopefully they get expanded a lot. The ability to choose between multiple guns/support items for a single class would be great. (Eg. Instead of the scout having a ranged flare gun, could have special flares that he can plant which are brighter and last far longer.)

Audio is pretty good so far, maybe some slightly more distinct sounds for different enemy types would come in handy but other than that, the voice acting is lovely and the sound effects are neat. The game has a nice sense of humour to it with how sassy the dwarves talk. My favourite example is when they talk about how the commander has a cozy job.

Speaking of enemies, this is where the game in its current state I feel is lacking the most. Every biome you go to, you're going to be fighting big spiders. There's a decent variety with these spiders, but other than that you have some trap enemies that pick you up into the air, ranged spitting/spiking plants and some explosive plants. Not sure if there's more yet but that's pretty much all I've encountered so far. Hoping to see some flying monsters and some more variety than just spiders to fight on the ground. An enemy who can use stealth would be awesome to create some jumpscares.

Obviously being an Early Access title, the game is quite buggy. There are many that I have encountered naturally through playing and many more being posted on the official discord server. DRG is constantly getting updates to fix these bugs, which is great to see. So far though the game has only crashed once, my friends and I have only failed to connect to a game in the loading screen a couple of times and there has been no real "game-breaking" bugs in the sense of the game being unplayable. Very solid experience so far.

Overall, I have very high hopes for the future of this game as more content and polish gets applied. I only buy Early Access games that I find to be in a good enough state at the time of purchasing and Deep Rock Galactic is a brilliant example of that. If what you see advertised interests you, I highly recommend giving the game a try.

40557049.review: 两天玩了11个小时，回来给这个游戏做个总结：1.游戏整体非常不错，无论是画风还是优化都是非常棒的，作为一款国外游戏最优秀的当然是它的服务器，游戏本身裸连就可以完美游玩。2.游戏内容稍微有点单调，作为一款刚发售不久的游戏这点希望后期可以增加补充包。3.游戏全景破坏是相当棒的设定，每次挖矿挖到最后终点站撤退时，身为专职挖掘机司机的我，都会选择从终点直接开挖到出发点。省了来回绕的时间。4个人十分推荐喜欢休闲的人来入手这款游戏，虽说现在这个价格有点小高，但内容毕竟刚发售如哦你真的想入手不妨现在就入，它的前景很好，相比吃鸡那种垃圾游戏外挂满天飞，把把被神仙打死好玩多了。

40555913.review:
Huge potential here for a fantastic experience. I hope that by full release there will be more enemy types, more boss-level enemies, more dwarf classes, maybe some kind of crafting or material combination system, more weapons and tools and an option for custom loadouts, and more game modes. Procedural generation of each level is fantastic but when the mission and enemy types are basically the same each time, it is going to get a little samey after a while.

However, for an early access game, this is incredibly polished, and a lot of fun. The basic game mechanics are simple, but you have to work together and be strategic about making your way down, so you can make sure you'll be able to get out again once you've completed the mission. The graphics are heavily stylised and suit the game wonderfully. Lighting in particular is done really well. The game performs beautifully, never really going below 100fps on my 980, even when the horde is upon us.

Despite the guy below me complaining about the toxic community who kick new players on sight, I've only been playing in public games, and I haven't experienced anything like that. Other players have been fairly welcoming and are generally happy to help new players learn the basics. However, it's pretty standard in games like this to have a votekick system.

Overall, definitely recommend if you're into team shooters.

40552973.review:
[h1]Deep Rock Galactic[/h1]
[b]Preparen sus picos y ametralladoras.[/b]
Antes de empezar a redactar quiero dejar por sentado que, con el transcurso del tiempo, dicho análisis va a presentar modificaciones debido a que nos encontramos frente a un título que aún está en early access. Dudo mucho que lo que venga después sea negativo, ya que lo que tenemos aquí es un juego estupendo y muy adictivo.

[b]Primer dia como minero.[/b]
Se nos va a invitar a explorar nuestra base, desde la cual vamos a poder mejorar nuestro equipamiento, customizar nuestro personaje, elegir las misiones disponibles del catálogo (Estas van cambiando) y echarse un bailecito energizante antes de bajar a la oficina. Realmente esta última parte es muy divertida ya que da pie a las amistades.

[b]ROCK AND STONE BROTHER![/b]
Una vez bajamos del taxi vemos lo que nos depara la oficina en el dia. Nunca van a estar las cosas como las dejamos ya que cuenta con un sistema de generación procedural, realmente son pedazos de laberintos en los que uno puede llegar a perderse fácil si anda distraído o buscando oro cual enano codicioso para mejorar nuestro equipamiento.

Tenemos distintos tipos de misiones que realizar por dia laboral, como buscar cierto recurso, eliminar a tal objetivo, etc ... pero no va a ser tan fácil como suena, ya que tenemos todo en contra. Los escenarios son absolutamente oscuros por lo que vamos a tener que usar bengalas en todo momento. ¿Municiones? son totalmente escasas, por lo que buscar el mineral para realizar transacciones va a ser indispensable si queremos llegar a casa sanos y salvos.

Por el momento contamos con un abanico de 4 clases jugables ( Artillero, Explorador, Ingeniero y Excavador), cada una tiene su equipamiento fijo del cual aún no podemos agregar o cambiar nada, más que mejorar lo que se tiene. Seria bueno a futuro tener más variedad de armas, pero para empezar va bien.

No vamos a contar con una gran variedad de enemigos pero sí con una gran cantidad de ellos, los cuales algunos tendrán exoesqueleto haciendo que te cueste más derribarlos. Es cuestión de observarlos y encontrar su punto más débil. Pero ten mucho cuidado en como usas tu munición, recuerda que escasea, a veces un buen golpe con el pico basta para evitar gastarla.

Todo el ambiente es totalmente destruible (al menos hasta donde llegue a minar) y muy inmersivo a lo que es una cueva. Cuenta con una gran cantidad de elementos que le dan vida a cada expedición que hagamos, desde la fauna hasta una flora que cambia dependiendo la zona.

Una vez terminada la misión es hora de volver a casa, pero no va a ser tan fácil como llegamos ya que nos vendrá una horda de insectos alienígenas interminable, para colmo el taxi que te apura y la cueva es un laberinto. Llegar sin munición o vida a este punto no es muy recomendable, aca es donde un enano pecho peludo tiene que demostrar lo que tiene y enfrentarse a lo que le aparezca por delante (o esquivarlo).


[b]Conclusión Final[/b]
[list]
[*]Demasiado atractivo al que le guste la fórmula de enanos, survival, fps y minar.
[*]Tiene ambientes muy ricos y bien armados, te hace sentir dentro de la cueva pese a su diseño poligonal. 
[*]No cuenta con un modo historia al menos por ahora.
[*]De momento hay gran cantidad de gente jugándolo por lo que no hay problemas por encontrar partidas online.
[*]Seria bueno que a futuro agreguen más equipamiento para los enanos y enemigos.
[*]No note bugs más que un problema con el HUD que se le superpuso datos del navegador de misiones, pero es perdonable al ser early access.
[/list]

40552887.review:
This game is going to succeed, but there a few bugs (not the crawly, murdery, explodey kind) and issues.


1) You include a vanity shop where I can buy swaggy beards and armor. That's awesome.

All vanity options reset to default every time you join a new lobby. That's not as awesome.


2) Credits and Experience gained as a player are directly related to how well the team does as a whole. Everybody wins - that's a nice touch.

I can also join near the end of a match (Server browser shows time elapsed) and do nothing, and reap equal benefit to the hardest working player. In fact, I can farm servers this way and reach level 15 without any effort. Not so nice.


3) There is very little reason not to play Gunner. In one class you have Machine gunner, Sniper, Exploration (Cable gun), Demoman, and Miner. The Gunner is more maneuverable than the Engineer and on par with the Driller, while being able to easily outgun both. A team of 4 Gunners is unstoppable, but it's still fun.

Pros: 
Minigun (Crowd control)
Heavy Revolver: (DPS/Sniping)
Cable Gun (Maneuverability/Exploration)
Satchel Charge (HEAVY damage over a large radius)

Perhaps a shop system where you have to buy your equipment/ammunition before a mission with credits (although that may mess with the Devs vision of the game, lore-wise) would curb the awesome power of the Gunner without having to nerf anyone.

40551485.review: One of the best early access titles I've ever played. Great visuals, immersive music and impressive performance. Content wise it could be a little better, with more diverse missions and enemies as the old "go there and grab this" type of gameplay easily becomes repetitive and mindless. 40551409.review: I can't recommend this game right now, as much as it pains me. I think there is a GREAT foundation here, but right now the procedural generation algorithms need some tweaking, because it keeps leading to dead ends preventing any forward progress and making us rage quit. i.e. there will be the small brown rocks all around a wall, which noermally signifies a dirt wall you can break through to progress deeper, but then it will just be solid wall. We even tested spending 10-20 mins just digging with picks through the solid wall and got nowhere. If they can fix the procedural generation to not have game-breaking stops, I would say this is a definite buy, because the environments are beautiful, the gameplay is fun, and the teamwork is satisfying in co-op with friends, but when you sink 30 mins into a game only to have 80% of what you need and no way to progress it is FRUSTRATING.

40551373.review: I've never written a review on a game before but this one is seriously a lot of fun and has a ton of potential. When you've taken around an hour to get a feel for what the game will offer you, it becomes clear that there isnt a ton of content in yet. The content that's there, though, makes it impossible to put the game down even at its pre-release state. The graphics are beautiful and easy to run, the enemies are vicious and engaging, every aspect of the mining is filled with ingenuity that separates the experience from any other mining game. There are little details all thorughout the hubworld and various explorable biomes that let you know the developers are really going into detail. All of my friends agree its one of the best and most addicting coop shooter since like Borderlands or Left 4 Dead, and its not even released yet. The early access if anything is a bonus at this point because it serves as a reminder that most of the best content is yet to come. I think if the devs remain as focused and attentive to the community as they've been so far, this could be a very successful and very popular game.

40550845.review:
~THIS GAME IS AMAZING~ 
Have you ever wanted to play a mining/doom style game with hordes of creatures coming from the pitch black to devour your team? If so, then this game is definitely for you! Whether playing solo or with friends or queing up with randoms, you have an infinite universe to explore thanks to procedurally generated cave systems. The teams are combined of 4 players, each player can pick 1 of the 4 available classes or all pick the same class to make for an interesting mission. The classes are equally helpful and amusing making it entirely up to the players choice, whether you chose them for strategic importance or simply because you prefer one over the other. Now obviously the game is currently in early access but I've noticed the Devs are listening and taking notes on current bugs/glitches and quite honestly there isnt ANY major ones, at least for me. So far the game has had an amazing launch and has been made even better by the 1st patch. My rating for this game is 8.7/10 and i give it that because this is just the beginning of Deep Rock Galactic and its hard to say what the future holds for the game but as of right now the future is bright!

40550664.review:
The game is not only beautiful with its colorful indie artstyle, but it is VERY well-polished. Despite a relative lack of features in its current state, this is easily made up for by randomly-generated maps that keep all it DOES have from becoming monotonous. No two missions are the same, and that keeps it fresh and interesting.

From a roleplay perspective, I personally enjoy the novelty of the setting. The dwarves treat every level like another day at the office; and in a way, this game manages to make you feel like that too. Not only do you feel like a badass while blasting bugs, but you also feel like a miner doing his job and doing it well. It's satisfying, to say the least.

The price seems a little bit high, and the game is meant to be enjoyed with friends rather than strangers. But if your wallet isn't empty and you bring your friends, the game quickly becomes addicting. You WILL enjoy this game.

40549411.review:
I would like to preface my review by out-right stating that I absolutely, completely and totally love this game. I will now outline some of the major facets of Deep Rock Galactic that make it such a mervelous feat of video game production in an otherwise standardised and homogenous market:

For starters, the multiplayer/co-op component: I am the type of gamer that enjoys video games with friends. In this regard, DRG is phenomenal. If you're looking for a title to enjoy with your buddies, then look no further. I have myself been searching for something similar to this for not only months, but years. It is a truly excellent time! You're laughing with your friends, you're panicking with your friends, you're getting lost in the caves with your friends, it's fantastic!

Next, the exploration. I was intrigued when I read of a mining/minecraft style component of exploring caverns and grottos, all the while fighting alien bugs. Did you ever see Starship Troopers? Remember those bug caves? Well, this is LITERALLY a simulation of those caves! You're making your own paths, salvaging what ores you can find and carry, lighting up as much as you can, and pushing deeper into a maze of unknown tunnels every step of the way! Absolutely brilliant fun! I should also note that your robot companion feels like a character of his own! The AI is a friend, and surprisingly often do you rely on him to find your friends! He is mans best friend!

This point of exploration leads nicely into the class system - There are four.. Operators, I'll call them. Each is amazingly unique and fantastically fun in their own right.  When composing a team, you really want a bit of all worlds owing to the vastly interesting utilities that they all bring to the table. Want to run a Predator-style minigun and make a giant mess? You got it. Want to zipline around like a mad-man and provide a lightsource that illuminates whole sections of the cavern for your team? You got it. Want to play the digging machine that can crush his way through any wall and create paths for your team? You got it. Want to focus on mining and deploy automated combat turrets to protect your team? You got it. It's ALL there. I cannot wait to see how the developers continue to advance them! I should also note that the class upgrade system, where one can utilise the ores they salvage from missions to perfect armor, weapons and equipment, is incredible fun. You're always working towards something, which makes each mission that much more fun - Knowing you're taking the time to mine through every nook and cranny of the caves for the correct ores! Brilliant!

Lastly, I'd like to touch upon the difficulty of the game. Honestly? I feel like a lot of games these days are made difficult for the sake of being difficult. That's to say, developers will just make enemies stronger than they should be, which leads to failure being frustrating and victory feeling somehow unrewarding. It's a drag. DRG shines and does it perfectly right - The enemies have their strengths and weaknesses that you need to handle appropriately, but the game is TOUGH. It is VERY demanding. Resource management is TOUGH. Ammo management is TOUGH. Grenade management is TOUGH. Friendly fire makes it TOUGH. Having several missions completed to extraction, it was not easy getting to the point of finishing missions! Getting lost in these caverns is a challenge. Being overrun is a challenge. Falling off cliffs because you forgot to throw a flare is a challenge. There are a  plethora of fun obstacles that make going from A to Z very challenging, but extremely positively rewarding.

This game is a delectable addition to my library, and one I will be enjoying for a long while as it continues to develop! I highly recommand it to anyone looking to enjoy some very good quality co-op time with their buddies, and to anyone looking for a great adventure!

40547746.review:
This game is awesome on so many levels!

I m not going to go deep into how it looks, but more about how playing the game feels like.
And it feels great. 
Its an "early access", that is more complete and polished, than any of those triple A battllefields or cods with all of those damn dlc. 
Its a sandbox game with a very definite gameplay loop, that makes playing the game fun and rewarding, while providing some challenge regularly (for those, who seek one). 
Its what NoMansSky should have been. 

And oh boy, didn I tell ya bout da dwarves mate! 
They are looking great, trash talking occassionally and making you rofl time to time.
4 classes are very different and noone is strong on his own, but each and every is very powerful and needed in a team, to maximise your potential. Enemies are just bugs, mostly, but terrain, darkness and occassional claustrophobia proves to be your worst enemy, and a great fun generator.

Also, this is a game, that is really easy to get into, because most thing are extremely logical and obvious, you just need some time to spend with it to get to know better.

All things considered, I would say, that this is a great game with a far going bright future ahead. 

Best played with friends for sure!
Huge thanks to Devs, you rock!

40547703.review:
Soo ya, I have to come back and review this agian. My friend ended up not doing the gift return so I gave it more time and was happy I did. As my previous reviews only complaint was staying on the path, now I believe, [b]"Forget about going off the path, staying on it is hard enough."[/b]

[h1][b]Pros:[/b][/h1]
[i]Worlds:[/i] I have always been a fan of random generated worlds. It's not just that its new to me everytime, its that we are capable of doing it. The color, size, and depth of the worlds I find my self in do not dissapoint

[i]Characters:[/i] Having a fully equipped team with all the characters makes a diffence, as does finding the character you want to roll with, or dig =P I was a rat in a past life so digging is 2nd nature to me and like the driller the best, especially come extraction time.

[i]Missions:[/i] I enjoy the mission system directing you to try new things out and not stay on the path. A desire for some rare materials + difficulty level rewards rutinely gets me over my head! Often having to find a solution while low on / hoarding resources to get materials in hard-to-reach places is definitly fun. I am also a fan of the random bug zergs, its preatty much all I want in a game is difficulty while digging while getting better tools to dig better with, I dig it!

[i]Extraction:[/i] I feel this is the most anticipated part of the game, something I fear and ask for each successful dig...or is it? The fact that the mining company I work for just leaves me there to die without my rewards really makes me feel like a 21st century employee in a large corporate environment, thanks Deep Rock Galactic!

[h1][b]Cons:[/b][/h1]
[i]Crystals:[/i] Please do not put anything shiny in a game I cannot hit to get anything from! 

[i]Upgrades:[/i] I feel that the upgrades for each class is lacking, although I am still a bit new, I might find this ok. Also in digging games I prefer to get materials to craft with / upgrade. Although you do take some rare mats up with you to "upgrade" it is definitly missing out on the reward of building a new tool / weapon! 

[h1][b]Verdict, two thumbs up, get your game on...dig me?!?[/b][/h1]



[b][i]OLD REVIEW[/i][/b]
[i]Has everything I want, except I dont like having to "stay on a path." Granted I am used to playing 2D digging games like Terraria, Signs of Life, ect., so the concept of finding things is more difficult in 3D, but there was no way to know where the minerals were around me; like sending out a pulse of sonar to feel out the minerals arround me. As it is 3D set, its all the more reason to implement a system like this, I just wanna dig man! Perhaps I missed something, however I dont wanna spend any more time past the gift return for my bro.

BUT...I dug two very long paths and never ran across minerals or caverns =(
[/i]

40542797.review:
Deep Rock Galactic: Left for Dead meets Spelunky and Star Ship Troopers.
I picked this game up at launch, and it was love at first sight. Its well optamised, challenging, almost bug free, and is a truely solid Co-Op FPS.

I think to properly tell you how good this is, let me tell you a tale of me and some friends.
We hopped into the drop pod and down to the planet we went. Upon landing we scouted the area, looking for gems and riches. I, the scout, went ahead and searched for some more minerals while the engineer and gunner made zip lines and platforms across a ravine. We were attacked by many a swarm, but our teamwork and cooperation pulled us through. Eventually we completed the task at hand (to kill 3 Glyphid dreadnaughts) and had filled our pockets with gold, nitra and Umanite. We pressed the button on Molly and back came the drop pod...which had spawned on the other side of the ravine. Rushing towards it, i made it across with my grapple gun, but the others were left on the other side as no zip lines had be put across to the top layer of the ravine. Quickly we scrabled to get across, the driller leading the charge while the gunner help of the inpending horde. I was beckoning them on, getting them closer to the drop pod as the timer ticked away, 3 minutes, then 2 minutes. Suddenly disaster as the Engineer feel and was downed at the bottom of the ravine. I was the only one who could reach him. I ran back and grappled down to him, but we was swarmed by many Glypids and i could not revive him. I tried to lead the glypids away, taking many hits, but eventually got them far enough away so that i could revive him. But as i got him up the swarm returned and downed him again. With 1 minute left, the others had little hope i could save him. But i returend and through pure luck managed to bring him onto his feet. My health was low and one more hit would have downed me and doomed me to being left behind. We made a break for the dropod, 30 seconds left on the clock, and ran through the recently dug corridor to the pod. We hopped on with only 10 seconds to spare and off we blasted back to the saftey of the Hub.

This was just one example of the scenarios created by this game. Its fun, engaging, and utterly relies on teamwork and combining your teams abilities. I highly reccomend this game to anyone looking for a solid Co Op shooter.

Oh and on another note, the devs are very active and interact with thier community every second they can. I really hope this game goes somewhere good and that its a game i can be proud of supporting this early in its development.

40536333.review:
I requested a refund because the kick function is being abused: the host can kick any player, at any point in the game. What makes this worse is a playerbase intolerant to new players. You will get kicked for not playing like others want you to, without reason, warning, or actual useful advice for players still learning the game. 
There are also trolls who simply enjoy kicking you after 40 minutes before you can escape, making you lose all progress (XP and resources to buy upgrades) you've made during that session. The host that just kicked you benefits from all the work you've done. This is an extremely frustrating experience and damaging to the community.

I may consider rebuying once the devs have this kick issue solved, because the game itself is pretty good. It has an addicting gameplay hook where you work together, making use of each class' unique abilities, to reach the missions objectives. There will be occasional horde waves that you have to defend against.


-->> Updated: 4 March 2018 <<--

Thank you, Soren [dev] for acknowledging this issue and letting us know it's on your radar. I understand better now that it's challenging to find a fitting solution. At least "d) (compensation)" seems mandatory to me.
I've suggested voting before, as others have, but I realise now that could end up replacing one problem with another problem.
Maybe some kind of karma/reputation system could help. Like commending a player for being a good host.

About my refund request; it was denied, because at the time of my request I already played 4.8 hours. It's all good though, I already fell in love with this game during a closed alpha weekend and realised then it has a lot of potential.
I will continue to play the game, but only as a host from now on and see how it goes.
At this time I still wouldn't recommend the game with the current kick system, but that could change as development progresses.
40536333.developer_response:
Hi Bittersweet. Thanks for your honest review.

We agree that the Kick feature needs some love from us (the developers). It's never fun to be kicked and we will do our best to improve this part of the game.

We are considering several options here, though, due to the peer-to-peer nature of the game, we do need some kind of kick-feature in the game.

Part of the solution could be to 
a) more (and nicer) information when Kicking and getting kicked - reasons for kicking
b) prioritize games that has kicked people down in the matchmaking system
c) make sure you can not see and join a game where you were previusly kicked
d) compensate for being kicked from a game where you have actually contributed to the mission

You (and others) are very welcome to suggest solutions as well. Hopefully, we can get this issue solved quickly, so we can improve the experience for everybody.

Again, thanks for the help here.

40536249.review:
This game’s graphics are beautiful. My squad unloading bullets into horde of glyphids illuminated by flares, it was a scene reminiscent of Starship Troopers.

Gameplay is well polished. Shooting feels very satisfying, and my great experience despite playing with my friend on the other side of the globe speaks to the quality of the netcode.

Each of the four classes bring special tools that come in handy for  the squad. Engineer provides a lot of firepower with his turrets, Gunner and Driller help the squad navigate around the complex cave system with zip lines and drill, and Scout's flare gun will illuminate an entire cavern.

Threat of Glyphids will keep you on your toes, and ammunition are scarce. I struggled to consistently carry out a successful mission for the first few hours, yet the missions never felt frustrating or too hard.

Variety in objectives, enemies, and upgrades are somewhat lacking so far, but what's to become of this game is excites me.

40535024.review:
Однажды мы отправились в Грибнные топи, обычное задание на сбор яиц, все шло как обычно. Десантирование, гео-разведка, поиск путей, прокладка маршрута отхода. Я заметил на стене явные следы наличия яйца, достал кирку и начал откалывать куски породы и оказалось, что, мать твою, Джонни, там сидел чёртов жук! Эти сукины сыны научились прятаться даже там! Я позвал ребят и мы начали палить что есть силы по этому чёртовому жуку, кто то из своих мне даже прострелил каску, Джонни, это был просто ад! Наш разведчик упал в какую то дыру, мы его вытащили и перевязали. — Ребята, передайте моей матери… — начал разведчик. — Ты сам ей всё передашь, чёртов камикадзе! И тогда мы вызвали нашего бурильщика, нашего славного сокола, который выпустил на этих жуков напалм. Ты бы видел это, парень! Когда я приходил в эту пещеру, она была серой, а теперь она ещё долго будет черной, поглотив своей чернотой жуков. Я люблю запах напалма поутру. Все в этой пещере было им пропитано. Это был запах… победы! Когда-нибудь эта работа закончится.

10 пнутых бочек из 10

40532479.review:
TL:DR If you like Mining in the deep, exploring caves in various biomes, Dwarves and shooting bugs to pulp Deep Rock Galactic is for you! I've only played just over 9 hours in early access as of the writing of this review but I enjoyed every minute of it, most of it in co-op, which worked well despite some network issues.

My thoughts on the Game:

The premis of the game is to go out with a team of dwarves, board your space driller, and fulfill a contract to gather a set of minerals, find alien eggs, or even kill big bad bugs. The four classes have different specialities indeed and a well balanced team makes reaching the target much easier but due to the fully destructable environment and variety of tools any team layout can get the job done, eventually.. So far so good!

There are basically three stages to the game: 1) Explore - every cave system is different (I have yet to see major repitition) 2) Mine and Fight - once you locate your target resource or enemy you will have to reach the quota and fight of intermittent waves of monsters 3) Extract - once you reach your quota you make your way back to your space driller.

Part 1 and 2 are fairly straightforward, the higher the complexity of the cave and the harder the difficulty the more fun and intense it gets obviously, but strategic planning and communication (if you get a good team going) will get you through these. This is where the game shines in my opinion, unless half the team just goes off and you are left to fight waves of bugs thinly spread. This is however up to your team to fix cause the game does reward good team synergy and teamwork.

Part 3 is where the real failure awaits. During extraction you send your walking minecart ahead to the new driller location so you'll have to backtrack a bit following the beacons it drops. However, the minecart can just walk up walls, while dwarves are.. less subtle creatures so they will have to find a less direct route sometimes. This is particularly the case when there are holes in ceilings or huge open chasms which take some time to scale. While you're doing this a timer starts counting down until the driller will make its way back up and you are left to die with the bugs.

It's up to your team get everyone across in the end using the tools you have available, and remember - Leave no Dwarf behind!

40530403.review:
So I'll be short. If they develop it more, fine tune things, keeping adding more I'll play it. But I would wager a guess that it will hit a wall and just be a cash grab like the other 1000+ Early Access games on Steam. So, thumbs up for the moment cause its EARLY, but it may die out soon without more rigid update cycles.

They need Female Dwarves, don't care if they have beards. Cmon its fucking 2018 not 1980. You can do better.

About a 10-15% increase in Ammo counts, possibly more for solo players as it stands you run out way too soon even on low risk and upgraded ammo slots purchased.

More reward for exploring/mining. As it currently stands, rates are atrociously slow and counter productive to long-term play and keeping players around. The 'open world/procedural' dynamics are lost on players if a linear path is always prioritized and the 'only' route to mission success.

More random encounters needed. Rogue dwarves/Bots/Bug Types/Rock Wurms.. more stuff = good to keep players stimulated instead of mindless bug waves and linear path mining which get monotonous.

Flares need to last way longer, at the moment I have seen games filled with Tons of used flares at the bottom of caves. It becomes a variable 'Flare Throwing Simulator' at times.

There are other gripes but that is all for now.

Good for now, but it better improve soon or players will avoid it like the plague as many other titles are guilty of these days.

Super fun coop game. The classes feel unique and they play off of each other really well. The core gameplay is rock solid, and exploring caves with friends is a ton of fun. The character progression is a bit thin at the moment and I could see the missions getting repetitive after awhile, but I'm not bored yet and I feel like I've already gotten my money's worth. I'm not sure what the dev's plans are, but personally I think diablo-esque randomized loot that you can either find or craft would really suit this game well.

This is the rare Early Access game that has a ton of potential, but is also incredibly fun right at launch.

这时候我火可大了 泡妞这种东西虽然我没经验，但是你手速再快 也敌不过我三尺长镐 这可是劳拉开过
光的 SABI。
 
男队友和我几乎同时喊道：我马上来

我一看我队友位置，垃圾 跟我还隔了50多米 

周围一片漆黑 扔出的发光管直接跌落深渊 

妹子离我102米 鼠标对准！大镐一挥开挖！ 

90米，80米，70米.........

10.9.8.7.....

破土而出 胴体快要近在眼前 更要命的是我打破了之前5分钟挖150米的记录！

何其美哉 

咻的一声 当我快把墙抠开的时候  男队友的绳索声音从天而降  

我仿佛听到了检测到在途的聚变打击

那一根放在奇瑞高端机械键盘上还未按下E的手指微微发起抖来

最终我没有挖开 我在墙后0.5米处听到了妹子感谢的声音 “谢谢小哥哥，不好意思死这么远”

男队友：“不客气 如果我倒地，我相信善良的你也会来救我的 ”

我曹 我长这么大都没听过这么恶心的台词 这大兄弟刚正不阿富有正义感的声音倒是像极了锡瓦的八爷

但是我肯定他的内心是杰洛特那样的人。

萌妹子：“小哥哥声音真好听 等会加个steam好友以后一起玩呗”

男队友：“可以。不过我steam上不去。”

萌妹子:“那加个微信呀，等会那人走了我打公屏上”

男队友：“嗯，我按钻机了 走”

警报呼啸，5分钟撤离时间开始倒数


我却第一次不想那么勇敢的第一个回去了 

第一次觉得臭美商店里的装备对我来说毫无意义

挖一个更长更深的隧道 虫群涌入 誓死像300莽夫一样守卫着通往逃生舱的温泉关

第一次觉得自己伟大 

有人说，当你的镐挥得够快，寂寞就会追不上你 

我觉得特别放屁 

刘德华长那么帅都说过

[spoiler]泡妞是要经过上天批准的[/spoiler]

40528396.review:
Dwarves,   Bugs.  GOLD!  Can You Dig It!?  

Land on an alien planet and fight off waves of bugs while minign precious mineral deposits.  Once you meet yoru quota either return to the drop pod or continue deeper to dig even more minerals.  4 class (Scout, Gunner, Engineer, Driller) 

Team play is a necessity to beat the maps.  Run off on your wn and you will likely die. Leave no dwarf behind or you will likely die.  Maps are procedurally generated and vary in complexity.  Use the minerals you gather back at base to upgrade your weapons.  

The game just came out a few days ago as of this review, so it is somewhat laking in features.  The loadout for each class is set, and there are only 2-3 upgrades for each weapon.  Two of the classes, digger and engineer, need some work to balance them with the other 2 (they are weaker right now).  

Overall its a lot of fun especially if you like the random maze like quality of the maps.  7/10 would download again.

40528300.review:
ROCK AND STONE!

Deep Rock Galactic is a game about a team of sci-fi Dwarves going underground on a hostile alien planet to kill bugs and get rich.

Dwarves are awesome, guns are awesome, dwarves with guns is awesome.

40528094.review:
Antes de tudo, caso queira experimentar o jogo você pode baixar uma demo jogável por 2 horas na Windows Store. Não sei se vale a pena comprar por lá, o preço é o mesmo, mas parece que lá possui crossplay com xbox (no entando não sei informar se jogadores de ambas essas plataformas podem parear-se com usuários steam).

Decidi arriscar nesse early acess sugerido por um amigo, achei que fosse ser apenas um joguinho besta de criança, mas me suepreendi. Mergulhei fundo nas profundezas escuras de cavernas desconhecidas, coletando minerais, colhendo cogumelos cintilantes (mó viagem), entre cristais fluorescentes, materiais radioativos, erupções vulcânicas, gazes tóxicos, cavando túneis sem saber ao certo em que lugares inusitados eles dariam. Dai eu penso, tudo tranquilo até agora, só aqui de boa coletando recursos, até que começa a brotar de todos os lados hordas de criaturas medonhas, insetos gigantes com exoesqueleto que explodem fogo, lançam teias e cospem ácido, sanguessugas presas no teto que te agarram e te puxam para a morte, larvas gigantes cheias de olhos que eclodem em enxames de pequenos aracnídeos. Cada integrante da equipe fazendo a sua parte para sobreviver, construindo plataformas, torretas de defesa, iluminando o caminho, lançando cabos de rapel por entre abismos até lugares de dificil acesso ou drilando as paredes para abrir caminho entre as cavernas. O jogo é uma experiência cooperativa incrível e promete crescer e diversificar ainda mais o seu conteúdo (levando em conta ideias e sugestões da comunidade) trazendo novos biomas, criaturas, modos de jogo e talvez até novos tipos de mineradores.

Resumindo:

ROCK AND STONE
TO THE BONE
\m/

I can't play this game. I know its early access. I know. But mine is completely unplayable, not just "rough". I get in to the lobby and first five seconds of a mission just fine, but then I freeze up. There will be short moments when I can move a step or reload. 40527078.review: This game in the most basic terms is one of the best games I've ever played.  My crew and I can play this for hours upon hours.  The resource gathering isn't too hard if you know what you're doing and have the adventureous heart.  It does require some problem solving...You are in under ground caverns after all.  For Early Access its also a solid game visually and I rarely have any issues with the game in terms of it running.  The best part of this game is the unkown,  Will the bug swarm come right now? when you have little or no ammo? or can you mine enough materiels to get that critical supply drop, or will you succumb to the seemingly never ending bug swarm that is only moments away?  This game keeps me and my friends on our toes and has yet to get old.  We have only been wiped once as a group, and have collected mountains of supplies in our hour long runs on missions.  I love this game and cannot wait to see how much further it comes along.  10/10 would reccomend to anyone that loves problem solving games as well as survival games.

40526690.review:
Basically Minecraft Horde Mode. Fun idea, four classes, way too easy to get lost or fall off a cliff in the dark. Not a great deal of content yet. Pubs are a crapshoot. Surprisingly well optimized, including install size.

Game structure is, you're in a cave. Start farting a continuous stream of flares, because the darkness hates you. Go explore, find some ores, shoot some bugs. Once you have filled your quota of one of those three (depending on gamemode), call the extraction pod and scramble like a madman to get to it before time runs out while everything tries to kill you. Spend earnings on a limited selection of marginal character upgrades. Repeat until bored.

It's fun, but only very briefly. There's real potential here, but for now I'd say sit on your hands until that potential is realized and/or there's a decent sale.

40526560.review: This game is definitely worth the 78 yuan (roughly $15 CAD) I paid for it. It is much better to play co-op than solo, and it is best with friends rather than randoms. I don't recommend the solo mode because you never have enough ammo to deal with the hordes, and it's a slog to gather resources, but it can be fun with randoms. The progression system is fairly underdeveloped, and there could be more types of enemies, but considering it was just released to early access, I think it will shape up to be a distinct and entertaining co-op shooter.

40525056.review:
Un juego que promete mucho, a pesar de estar aun muy verde, ya te asegura muchas horas de diversion, sobretodo, si juegas con amigos.

El juego tambien cuenta con un modo singleplayer, en el que para que no te sea tan tedioso el estar ahi solo, le añaden a tu autismo un robot que te puede ayudar en casi todas las tareas.

A medida que se va actualizando se va añadiendo mas contenido, y esta bien optimizado, cosa que es rara de ver en un early access.

relajante y frenetico al mismo tiempo, y aunque parezca simple y repetitivo, engancha, y espero que cuando este terminado ofrezca mucho mas de lo que podemos disfrutar ahora mismo.

tienes una lista de misiones, las cuales se actualizan cada hora, con mapas generados aleatoriamente, contando que una partida te puede llegar a costar 20-40 min y que hay varias misiones disponibles al mismo tiempo, nunca repetiras un mapa.

El papel de la iluminacion es importantisimo, el cual hace que, a pesar de estar siempre en cuevas similares, te sientas intrigado por explorar y le da ese toquecillo de ""miedo"".

Hay varias clases para elegir, cada una con sus armas y sus especialidades, las cuales debes combinar con las de tus compañeros para que todo sea mas facil y podais sobrevivir a las oleadas de bichos que vendran a medida que os adentrais en la cueva.
Mi momento favorito, cuando llega la hora de huir de alli con el botin, tendreis que seguir a vuestro "robot almacen" (M.U.L.A) a toda prisa hasta llegar a la capsula con la que descendisteis, todo huyendo de hordas de bichos alienigenas y totalmente rodeados de oscuridad, tan solo iluminados con unas linternas y unas pocas bengalas.

la experiencia es muy agradable, todo bañado con una capa de humor que lo hace todo genial.
de las pocas pegas que le sacaria, seria que cadece de muchas animaciones, como las de recargar el arma, aunque, poco a poco, las van añadiendo.

Recomendadisimo, da gusto encontrarte estas pequeñas joyitas.

40522748.review:
Preliminary Review, still in Early Access. 

SO far i'm fairly impressed with the system in place here. This game is a quick hop into action and resource gathering. The procedural generation is fairly good and will likely be even better as the game advances. The classes are fun, although they are fairly simplistic, I would love to see more variation in the classes in the future, such as different kinds of weapons, maybe subclasses, etc. 

The game has a fun mechanic which revolves around how dark these caves are, you have a really weak flashlight equipeed, which can make for some silly jump scares, when the bugs show up. You also have flares, these are really important honestly, the flashlight just doesnt cut it and the flares are truly greeat at lighting up a medium sized area, my only problem is they dont last very long. Because the game is so dark and the flares dont last that long, you end up filling the map with flares which is a bit weird looking when you are running around. The darkness also brings up another problem, the maps procedurally generate, but the different cave systems are seperated by a specific textured item, which can be practically impossible to find at times. Yesterday i spent an hour and a half with some randoms looking around for the dirt so we could progress with the level. 

I like this game and I look forward to its future updates, but I also hope they make the generation a little more fluid, and finding ways to progress a little easier, because it can be the easiest thing in the world, or take two hours to find the next cave. 

Anyway, the art style is pretty cool, they are constantly working on the game with new ui tweaks and customization options. I look forweard to where this game goes, and I hope it doesnt get into the Early Access Development Hell, where the game ends up not getting finished. I would check this one out!

40521326.review:
What a fantastic little co-op game. Gives feelings of Left 4 Dead and Vermintide, but slower and more methodical than most other co-op "horde" games out there. The Devs released a patch the day after it came out on Early Access, adding in keybinding and many visual customizations, so I think we're in for a great update ride.

Pros:
+ DWARVES
+ BEARDS
+ Great soundtrack
+ Great style and atmosphere
+ Satisfying digging
+ A good number of varied environments
+ Procedurally generated, so nothing is ever the same
+ Difficulty seems perfect for each difficulty setting
+ No fighting over classes becuase you can have multiple of one class!

Cons:
- Progression system feels weak, needs more stuff
- No official forums for bug reporting, suggestions, but the devs seem responsive on Discord and Steam forums
- I'd personally like more classes 
- Enemy variety is medicore, hopefully more get added
- MORE IN-GAME WORLDBUILDING PLEASE 

The devs say they should have a roadmap on Trello soon. I look forward to seeing what they're planning on adding. Currently, it'd be a steal for $15, maybe not quite enough content for some at $25, as though there are different mission types, a number of them "play the same," just going into the map, traversing through it and mining, then getting out. Some more variety there would be neat.

There's a FREE TRIAL on the Microsoft store (which is also play anywhere and cross platform), so give that a try. Ideally, play on Steam for playerbase because I know game preview games don't do super well on Xbox, but the option to play with console friends is neat.

Verdict:
Try first, but you'll probably like it.

40517231.review:
Очень добротный саундтрек, который сменяется в соответствии с прохождением миссии, продуманный и интересный геймплей, приятная графика, высокий уровень оптимизации, большое разнообразие контента, общий драйв игры и достойная максимальная сложность, вариации уровней и пр.

Из недостатков только болячки, присущие большинству в Раннем Доступе (вроде постоянно дублирующихся по 3-4 раза реплик дворфов, которые нельзя никак отключить), но общая планка качества на данный момент (02.03.18.) на уровне законченного продукта!

Онлайн сейчас довольно высок и найти себе лобби с русскоговорящими (я уже отвык от этого) очень легко, пусть и под вечер. Есть мелкий косяк с громкостью голоса (все тихие), но это решается удвоением громкости голоса и уменьшения всего остального процентов на 25.

Хочется только пожать руку Ghost Ship Games за прекрасный старт (почти напечатал "релиз") и пожелать успехов, т.к. концепт и без того достойный, а если реализация продолжит [b]хотя бы[/b] поддерживать планку, то мы увидим что то невообразимо крутое!

40515191.review:
Great game.  I have not had any issues with the community, I've probably added more friends to my friend's list because of this game than I did for L4D.  Everyone's been super chill.

Minimal bugs so far, I've only encountered one (Drop Pod access facing/embedded in a wall) and that's on the dev's fix list.

It's a great mix of Space Beast Terror Fright + voxel landscape.  There are a few types of missions, and areas to explore, with different rare resources.  

Very stable and polished for early access.  I really hope the devs continue to rock this game.  

For people scared of the price - there is a demo available on the Windows Store (Windows version has cross-platform play w/ Xbox people) - but not Steam, so if you try it from the Windows Store, but want to play w/ Steam friends, make sure to buy on Steam.  (Please correct me if I'm wrong).

What a great game. It takes the classic 4-man coop versus hordes of AI enemies ala L4D, Vermintide etc and throws in sci-fi dwarves that dig too deep and too greedily... and it does it really well. 40513761.review:
This game has a decent frame to build on but right now there's not much there. 

There are about three upgrades for each item in the four classes. There are no other weapons/gear to use so reaching endgame with any particular class doesn't seem like it will take too long. Granted, I I only played two hours to refund since the game doesn't seem to have much content. But as someone with two hours in, it doesn't seem like I'm working towards anything that interesting. 

Take Monster Hunter which has a comparable model. You start out with weapons and gear that don't look that cool and don't have effects that really do much, but after grinding you're rewarded with really cool looking gear to fight even cooler looking bosses. This game doesn't have that, you use the same weapons to fight the same 7 enemies every mission. 

That aside, I'll admit the weapons you do get are pretty cool I've gotta give it that. There's not that much enemy variation though, once you've done two or three missions you've probably seen all of them. 

Right now the game doesn't have enough to keep me going and it definitely doesn't warrant it's $25 price tag. I think eventually this could become a very solid game but right now keep your wallet shut.

40513551.review:
Копай, убивай, сбрасывай бочки в шахту запуска

Довольно удивительная смесь майнкрафта с классическим уничтожением волн врагов. Идеи хоть и не новы, но разработчики смогли вдохнуть новую жизнь, создать что-то своё.

Плюсы:
- Кооператив на 4 игроков.
- 4 класса, детально проработанных и доступных для игры.
- Нет микротранзакций (надеюсь и не будет).
- Достаточное количество мобов.
- Наличие в игре своих фич.
- Хорошая оптимизация.
- Графика для игры подобного рода вполне хороша.
- Музыка. Музыка в этой игре - это отдельная история, про которую можно слагать легенды. Она превосходна.
- Каждая пещера в игре процедурно сгенерированная, а значит уникальная. Доставляет интерес исследования.

Минусы:
- Крупные баги вроде застревания на тросе или в коллайдерах.
- Мелкие баги, присущие всем альфа-играм.
- В лобби практически нет ничего интересного.
- Иногда возникает топорность анимаций.
- Хотя пещеры уникальны, режимов игры всего 2 - ликвидация и копание. Пахнет неразнообразием.

Вердикт - 8/10 с поблажкой на ранний доступ.

40513404.review:
First review ever written for this joy of a game. It deserves my time more than most of the shit games I play currently (looking at you pubg)

Pros:
- Well designed Sandbox, you ever played Minecraft or Terraria ? Well you have the better version of it right here, besides the fact that your mission isn't to settle down and survive but to get the hell in and out before the lack of supplies lets you powerless in the face of dozens of hungry insectoid lifeforms

- Very different bioms: each have their own set of minerals, textures and flora.

- Progression system is based on buying new stuff and then upgrading new stuff all of it thanks to the gold and other minerals you mine during your raids.

- The UI is sooth as silk.

- The graphics and musical atmospheres are FUCKING AWESOME.
Graphics: lighting well managed and overall polygon-ish models make it stand in between retro and and modern indie gaming.
Music: Somewhere between the film Drive and Bladerunner 2049. Call it however you like Neon/retro/Space/Futuristic/wierdly dwarven

- A class system where each of all four heroes (at the moment there are 4 of them) have their own role and importance. You will quickly see that a team with two or more of the same hero will probably lose a raid.

- I have not seen a glitch throughout my playthroughs

- Beards

(Other pros incoming as soon as I notice them)

Cons:
Well for now. Its still an Early Access soooo:

- Only 4 heroes

- Alienbugs are the same no matter the biom

- Might feel a bit grindy to upgrade or just buy new gear ?

- Not enough Beards

TL;DR:

If you have friends, buy it
Its good and quite unique as for a shooting/mining/survival game
Good graphics and AWESOME music
buy it
















buy it

근데

전체적으로 하나의 자연동굴에서 광물을 캐는데, 여기까지는 좋음
플레어를 써서 어두운데를 돌아다니는데, 플레어 지속시간이 너무 짧음.
내가 던지고 싶은 위치에 딱 던져서 아 이건 여기있구나 하기도 전에 플레어가 꺼져버림
혹시나 싶어서 플레어 지속시간을 늘렸지만 여전히 짧음.

광물같은경우 대부분 벽면에 붙어있음.
붙어있어서 캐는것까지는 좋은데,
문제는 몇몇 특수광물( 외계인 알같은거 )이 문제임.

예를 들어서 열개의 외계화석을 찾는 미션이 뜨면,
한 네개 ~ 여섯개까지는 잘 찾음.
근데 나머지 네개를 찾는거부터 시작임
구석에 너무 꼭꼭 숨어있거나 땅속에 박혀있어서 그걸 찾으러 온 동굴을 다 파야함.

파다가 지쳐서 접은 미션이 깬 미션보다 많음.

광물 위치는 동굴벽 여기저기에 있어서 괜찮은데
짧은 플레어 시간 + 찾기 힘든위치( 동굴벽 구석, 천장 저어어어기 위 등 )
엄청 찾기 힘듬.

그래서 만약에 이 게임을 산다 하면
자기가 광물위치 잘찾는 호크아이 혹은 맵 위치를 잘 기억하는 길잘알
혹은 내가 이 게임을 오랫동안 플레이해서 적응할 자신이 있다 하는 사람만
사길바람.

전 일단 업뎃 좀 하고나서 해보겠습니다.

开始准备入这个游戏，是因为看了评论说这个游戏具备很多游戏的优点
开始犹豫入这个游戏，是因为看了评论说这个游戏没有基友不怎么好玩

哪怕一起迷路挖洞

40511961.review:
[h1]Общее впечатление[/h1]
Первое впечатление довольно положительное, сама механика игры хоть и выглядит однообразной но это только на первый взгляд. На самом деле игра приятно удивит даже самого придирчивого игрока.
[h1] Начну с плюсов:[/h1]
[olist]
[*] Хорошая оптимизация - Даже играя на стареньком компьютере игра покажет хорошую производительность. Таких неприятных моментов как подвисания или просадка фпс лично я не встречал.
[*] Приятная графика - графика на мой взгляд довольно неплоха, детализацию ландшафта осуществили на твёрдую 4.
[*] Геймплей - насчет самого процесса кооперативной игры, на впечатление о ней в большинстве случаев будут влиять игроки с которыми вам "посчастливилось" сыграть, так что лучше играть с друзьями. Короче говоря с тимой может не повезти.
[/olist]
[h1]Минусы:[/h1]
Поскольку я  на данный момент играл менее 1 часа то особых изъянов я не заметил, но отмечу то что бросалось в глаза
[olist]
[*] Мало вещей для кастомизации - вещей пока действительно мало, но думаю эту проблемку устранят до выхода игры из раннего доступа. 
[*] Ветки прокачки довольно скудны - опять же надеюсь на исправление к полноценному релизу.
[/olist]

Ну а на этом у меня все, на последок скажу что игра однозначно стоит своих денег и имеет довольно большой потенциал для развития так что вы не пожалеете.

The game is great, although its one of those games that gets a whole lot better with friends and voice communication. That's what its all about in my oppinion. Solo is quite boring, and joining randoms are a hit or miss kinda deal. A lot of random open games doesn't utilize the voice comms.

4 Player Co-Op, dig for resources / eggs etc. and once you have what you need, You gotta make it back to the drop pod to escape, this really is a teamwork game, if you don't function as a team, it will become very hard to survive and complete the round.

Its a fun little game. Is it worth the 22.99 euros ? No, not in its current state, I'd say its overpriced. 14.99 euro, would've been a far better price point. There's not a lot of content yet for it to be justified, as such, it gets repetitive fast.

I'll recommend the game for how it plays. But I'd say its a 51% for and 49% against recommending the game, based entirely on the price.

40509094.review:
You just can't win with early access... The top complaints you will here are performance is bad, game breaking bugs, network issues. NONE OF THESE THINGS ARE PROBLEMS in Deep Rock Galactic. The game is like they claim, ROCK SOLID. I am positive that the very few issues this game has will be patched out in no time and let me state, there are very few issues with this game.

People claim the game is repetitive. This is true but it's so much damn fun everytime. Lots of games are repetitive, most games are repetitive, the only difference is that this one remains fun. Finding your way down these very complex randomly generated cave systems is very interesting. It really challenges your memory and navigation skills. You really have to take into account your surroundings and leave your little trail of flares "jelly beans" to help you decide where you have been making getting back to your ship to extract very intense and exciting. Coupled with the beautiful and amazing lighting using the unreal 4 engine makes this game feel so right. Many things this game does just feels right. Everything just works how you would expect it to, like you would want it to.  

This is definitely a buy. It is the most polished and playable EA title on the steam market place I can guarantee it. This game will only get better and it is the only game in a very long time that has held my attention for 5 hours a sitting.

Тут ненужно таскать ресурссы с собой в кормане нет! Тут свами бегает мул-робот (грузовой) в который просто высыпаешь ресурсы.В игры каждый класс персонажа и тут 4 имеет свое снаряжение и оружие которое что бы прокачать нужно использовать заработанное бабло и специальные ресурсы ! No matter what you are doing in this game, ( ie. mining, shooting, exploring, extracting, evacuating, running, covering, yelling, etc.) you will be left with a strange and overwhelming sense of satisfaction. It will egg you constantly to come back, for just another round with your instant BDFs (Best Dwarf Forever) . 40507181.review:
Vraiment une super découverte cette early access, On y joue a 4 et je dois dire que je suis convaincu par le jeu, très bien optimisé, aucun lag a signaler, aucun crash, plutôt aboutie pour le moment, seul quelque bug sont à signalé  comme le fait de tombé dans le vide et mourrir au debut de la mission ( surtout si vous prenez le siège de droite :p).

Le jeu se décompose en deux phases l'éxploration le minage et l'accomplissement d'un objectif principal et secondaire 
 et ensuite l'extraction. La première phase est rythmé de vague de mob qui donne des combats epic et demande du team play, la seconde qui consiste a rejoindre un point d'extraction aléatoire donne des séquences de combats epic.

Il y a un système d'upgrade des divers accéssoires, armures et armes qui force a fouiller un peut plus les maps a la recherche des composant nécessaires.

A l'heure de l'evaluation le contenu disponible dans l'early est suffisant pour justifier le prix du jeu qui en vaut clairement la peine.

Je recommande a 100%.
